issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/464,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/464,capella,780523911,464,MDE-Reporting configuration doesn't work when Log4J configuration is overriden,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:40:10Z,2021-01-06T12:40:19Z,"On Capella, users can choose levels to be logged and appenders through 'Windows/Preferences/MDE-Reporting'.
Log4j current implementation provides its own mechanism to extends the default behavior of log4j where user and additional plugins can override the default behavior.
But its the first plugin loading its configuration that will be considered as the default one, so we can't rely safely on this mechanism.
Anyhow, in Capella, these customization must comply with user choices defined in Windows/Preferences/MDE-Reporting.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/466,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/466,capella,780524144,466,OE2System is desallocating functions,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:40:34Z,2021-01-06T12:40:41Z,"Fix code to handle Exception_CFE01_01 usecase

Creating a REC and then instantiating a RPL only works once. After restarting Capella, one more RPL can be instantiated but it needs to be restarted again for the next RPL. The discussion in this thread (https://polarsys.org/forums/index.php/m/3489/) points to the problem being isolated to Linux.
The same symptoms are also present in Capella 1.3.0.
In my case the problem is occurring on OpenSUSE 15.1 with the standard distribution Java version 1.8 as per below:
The Eclipse console output is attached and shows exceptions. Lines 477 to 515 (inclusive) are emitted while creating the REC. The lines after 516 are attempts to instantiate RPLs.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/468,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/468,capella,780524316,468,Capella 0.8 trigs installation of JRE 6 on Mac OS X,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:40:54Z,2021-01-06T12:41:02Z,"This is a well known bug since Kepler release.
A work around is to launch capella from the Terminal (in Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS).

> since the version 1.2.0 of Capella, this problem is solved.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTI3NzIxNw==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/469,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/469,capella,780524435,469,Capella executable for Mac OS X platform miss the x bit,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:41:05Z,2021-01-06T12:41:14Z,"In Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS, the eclipse file miss the execution right:
Capella can therefore not be launched.
Usually caused by building the product on windows platform and can be fixed by switching to a Unix platform.
Work around is of course: chmod +x Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/471,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/471,capella,780524676,471,Add methods on AbstractCommand to know if a command has been rollback or interrupted,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:41:29Z,2021-01-06T12:41:37Z,"Cosmetic change (for developpers).
We have to override methods ""commandInterrupted"" and ""commandRolledBack"" before to know if an AbstractReadWriteCommand has been interrupted or rollback during its execution. This was painful.
> It would better to add those services in AbstractCommand class
> > It would better to add those services in AbstractCommand class
> ""It would BE better"" is even more better

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/472,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/472,capella,780524810,472,Adapt Capella code to Sirius bugzilla 457833,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:41:40Z,2021-01-06T12:41:49Z,"The type returned by the internal method
DAnalysisSessionImpl.getSemanticCrossReferencer() has changed in Sirius since the bugzilla 457833 [1]. Capella uses this internal method and must be adapted.
> A gerrit is available here: https://polarsys.org/r/#/c/470/

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/475,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/475,capella,780525158,475,Preference initialized when workspace is reopened,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:42:15Z,2021-01-06T12:42:23Z,"Preference are not kept when a workspace is closed and reopened.
> Management of transition preferences now use the CapellaPreferenceStore but are still shared between different projects.
> Workspace preferences are no more reinitialized when the workspace is closed and reopened.
> Re-opened in order to correctly manage preferences per project

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/476,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/476,capella,780525278,476,Error on close session,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:42:26Z,2021-01-06T12:42:36Z,"An error occurs while closing session.
Message ""The program was not able close the session"" is generated in Error Log with the following stacktrace:
> The backport of [165] has introduced this error since we have introduced the super.dispose() in the ted.dispose() as it supposed to be.
> This super.dispose() leads to inconsistencies since session's close through CloseSessionCommand is called into a transaction.
> Since refactoring of CloseSessionCommand leads to major modifications, the super.dispose() call will be drived with a new ticket and not treated in 0.8.1.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/478,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/478,capella,780525505,478,Progress Monitoring > Set Progress... does not propagate progress statuses on Constraints and Diagrams.,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:42:50Z,2021-01-06T12:42:58Z,"Steps to reproduce (tests done on a remote model):
1. In a remote model, in Operational Analysis > Operational Activities, create a new Constraint
2. In Operational Analysis > Operational Activities > Root Operational Activity, create a new Diagram,
3. On Operational Analysis, click on Progress Monitoring > Set Progress... and select a progress status,
=> Constraints and diagrams (and probably tables) are not impacted by the selected progress status.

> Diagrams and Tables are not impacted by the set progress Status but are displayed in the Progress Overview if a status is set manually.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTI3ODAxNg==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

> Replay the scenario described in the ticket a check the memory consumption is not growing.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/491,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/491,capella,780526963,491,Impossible to make generalization with Logical Component in Library,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:45:16Z,2021-01-06T12:45:23Z,"1. 3. In P1, create a LogicalComponent LC2 and a PhysicalComponent PC2,

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/499,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/499,capella,780527777,499,FastLinker behavior must be concordant with general Capella behaviour,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:46:46Z,2021-01-06T12:46:53Z,"Some examples:
1. It is not possible to create a Generalization or an Association between a class in Project and a class in a Library,
2. With the FastLinked view, it is not possible to create the association ClassInLA -> ClassInSA,
3. With the FastLinker view, it is not possible to create the association ClassInSA -> ClassInLA (it is possible in CDB diagrams, but it is perhaps not normal...),
In addition, the FastLinker has its own implementation to create Assocations, we should use (code ?) a common implementation.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/511,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/511,capella,780530516,511,Switching EI element kind from MEMBER to TYPE does not disable its direction,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:51:13Z,2021-01-06T12:51:20Z,"Let us consider an EI element of kind 'member' (), for which we have defined a direction (in, out)
When changing the kind of the EI element to type, the direction cannot be edited anymore, but the direction value previously defined remains activated.

As a consequence, this information of direction remains visible in the model exports and the model validation rule DWF_I_03 and DWF_D_43 detects an error (an EI of kind `typeÂ¿ should not have a direction).
- The fact that DWF_D_43 and DWF_I_03 raise the same error (duplicated rule?)
- The quick fix proposed for DWF_D_43 does not work, as a direction cannot be edited for Type EI element
- When changing back to 'TYPE' an EI element, clear the direction information

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/532,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/532,capella,780532928,532,Memory Leaks fixes and Performances improvement on Migration,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:55:17Z,2021-01-06T12:55:25Z,"There is some memory leaks and performance issues leading to poor performances while Sirius Repair processing:
- When using an editing domain without session, org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator.viewer.ActiveSessionManager keep reference to the editing domain
- org.polarsys.capella.core.data.migration.aird.SiriusMigrationContribution keeps references to resources even after migration

Repair processing while migration use way too many accesses to session.getSessionRessources. With the customization made into SiriusSessionFactory, this method is no longer an attribute to the session, but a computed method which lead to really poor performances while the repair processing.
LibraryManager can be improved to keep the getModel(domain) since it doesn't change during whole life of an editing domain.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/545,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/545,capella,780534487,545,Problems with Literal String Value,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:57:50Z,2021-01-06T12:57:58Z,"1/ A common string as ""jkqfgksd"" does not appear with quotes (""jkqfgksd"") in explorer an in diagram, whereas an empty string ("""") or a string with a single blank character ("" "") does. Note that undefined string values appear as <undefined> which is correct.
2/ To create an empty string value one must first create a string non empty then modify it, which is weird and unnecessarily lengthy.
3/ The red cross at the right end side, does not erase the value in the window (but actually does the job when clicking on finish except when, beforehand, you clicked inside the value field !)
> Verified by Aurelien Didier with Build master.

> 3 points listed in description were OK.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTI4NDU1MA==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/547,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/547,capella,780534763,547,Dependency check does not raise error,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:58:14Z,2021-01-06T12:58:21Z,"- Create 3 Data pkgs A, B, C
- Create a primitive class in each package A, B, C
- Create a property in the class in package A typed by the class in package B
- The corresponding dependency is displayed in the PDD (from package A to B)
- Create a property in the class in package B typed by the class in package C
- The corresponding dependency is displayed in the PDD (from package B to C)
- Create a complex value in package C. Type it with the class in package A
=> The PDD don't display the dependency from C to A
=> Validate the model : no error detected
- Create a numeric type in package A
- Create a collection in package C and use the numeric type in package A as its index
=> The PDD don't display the dependency from C to A
=> Validate the model : no error detected

> Verification OK. Dependencies are displayed in Package Dependency diagram. Cycles are correctly detected by DWF_D_25","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTI4NDc0MA==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/548,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/548,capella,780534870,548,Add a check of precondition for writable files before a transaction is committed,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:58:25Z,2021-01-06T12:58:33Z,"Right now, before a transaction is committed, only read-only files are checked via the fileModificationPreconditionChecker extension point (org.polarsys.capella.core.model.handler) => We need another check of precondition for writable files.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/549,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/549,capella,780534997,549,[SubSystem Transition] NPE for all activities in activity explorer for the model created by a multiphases transition,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T12:58:36Z,2021-01-06T12:58:44Z,"After a multiphases transition, a new project is created and its overview is open but in dirty state.
If the user click on a activity, a NPE ""Unhandled event loop exception"" is thrown.
If the project is closed and re-open, no more errors.
The error appears after the ""Apply"" on the ""Differences Display"" window.
- start a Melody Advance with SubSystem Transition Addon installed
- create a [PAB] diagram (In the Activity Explorer: Physical Architecture > Allocate Physical Functions to Physical Components"")
- right-click on this PC, select ""System to SubSystem Transition > Vertical > SA-LA-PA""
- click on the ""..."" button in ""Output Capella Model"", then ""Create a New Project"", give it a name then ""Finish"", click on ""Ok""
- a ""Differences Display"" window appears, click on ""Apply""
- select an activity in the Activity Explorer of the new Project (automatically opened)
The activity is not run and a ""Unhandled event loop exception"" is thrown in the Error view.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/569,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/569,capella,780541966,569,Memory leak: Information view is not cleaned of refinement markers when session is closed.,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:10:11Z,2021-01-06T13:10:20Z,"Steps to reproduce (problem reproduced on Capella 1.0.0 but probably present in Capella 0.8.x):

=> Information view is filled with logs from the refinement,
=> Information view is not cleaned of refinement logs (on the contrary, markers created by validation rules are correctly removed when the corresponding sirus session is closed).
Not cleaned markers cause memory leaks because model elements are still references by them.
> This bug is reused to correct other memory leaks.

> Memory leaks corrected, they were coming from the fact that when a model was closed, the Information View was not cleaned from entry linked this closed model.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTI5MDI2Nw==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/609,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/609,capella,780546585,609,Library access policy is not updated,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T13:18:03Z,2021-01-06T13:18:06Z,"Library dependency is set up as follows: Capella project depends on Sub-library with ReadAndWrite access right. Sub-library depends on Super-library with ReadAndWrite access right.

Open the ""Manage references"" wizard, we expect the Capella project to have ReadAndWrite access right to Super-library. However, on Access Policies view of Capella project, the Access policy for Super-library is readOnly instead of ReadAndWrite.
Close and reopen the wizard, the Access policy is updated.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/611,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/611,capella,780546809,611,OpaqueExpression should extend DataValue rather than ValueSpecifiaction,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T13:18:24Z,2021-01-06T13:18:27Z,"It should be possible to use an OpaqueExpression wherever any other expression may be used (e.g. Unary/Binary expressions):
For example it is possible to use a UnaryExpression as the max value of a property, but you cannot use an OpaqueExpression instead. Also, you cannot add an OpaqueExpression to a DataPkg.
The use of OpaqueExpression is limited, because it is a ValueSpecification, whereas UnaryExpression etc are DataValues.
To fix this, OpaqueExpression should extend DataValue, rather than ValueSpecification.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/612,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/612,capella,780546924,612,XyzExt.getRootComponent does not return the root component,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T13:18:35Z,2021-01-06T13:18:37Z,"For a given component, I would like to find its root component, i.e. if the component is in the PA package, I would like to find the Root Physical Component, if it's in the LA package, I would like to find the Root Logical Component etc.

ComponentExt.getRootComponent() looked like a suitable helper to do exactly that, but instead, the method just returns the arguments parent! Looking through capella code, there are quite a lot of ""getRootComponent() helper methods in the XXXExt helpers, and these implementations suggest that this is indeed the intended behavior.
Please, for each of these methods, document what exactly is meant by 'the root component'. Clearly you do not mean the ""Root Physical/Logical"" component.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/614,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/614,capella,780547129,614,Capella compare feature has no purpose,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:18:56Z,2021-01-06T13:19:09Z,"What is the purpose of the capella compare feature? It just includes the diffmerge sdk feature, so why not just include just the diffmerge sdk feature instead?
> This feature includes a plugin named ""capella.core.compare"" containing a capella specific diffmerge customization.
> It also includes another feature named ""capella.common.compare.feature"" that includes itself a set of generic customization for diffmerge.
> In Capella 1.2.0, the generic customization will be contributed to EMF DiffMerge project and be removed from Capella.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/615,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/615,capella,780547268,615,Capella project explorer only shows diagram nodes but no model elements,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:19:12Z,2021-01-06T13:19:18Z,"When I open the model ""RulesOnDesignTest"" that is in org.polarsys.capella.test.validation.rules.ju/model a session opens, but the Capella Project explorer does not show model contents, only sirius elements are shown:
I can open diagrams, but the project explorer still does not show model elements.
When I switch to the ""Modeling Perspective"", the sirius ""Model Explorer"" shows model elements.
No errors are present in the error log or the information view.

When I open the melodymodeller file with the CapellamodellerEditor, the editor indicates that therer are errors in the resource. It seems likely that the errors in the resource are somehow causing the explorer to fail in showing model elements.
So there's really two things to fix here:
1. Remove the errors in the model resource
2. Capella should somehow indicate such resource errors to the user. Maybe this could even be requested to sirius, as sirius does all the resource/session management.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/621,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/621,capella,780547883,621,Capella business queries extensibility,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:20:21Z,2021-01-06T13:20:28Z,"Capella shall have a better support of queries extensibility:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/629,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/629,capella,780548940,629,F8/F9/... do not work in the semantic browser while there is a selection change on the same tree on referenced/referencing element panel,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:22:01Z,2021-01-06T13:22:10Z,"The issue seems to be associated to the focus in the Semantic Browser pane. To reproduce:
1- in Capella, open a PAB with 2 components linked with a PhysicalLink
3- unlink the Semantic browser (click on the double arrows button)
5-Window>Show View > Semantic Browser => Notice the Semantic Browser view is not linked to the diagram (Semantic Browser empty)
6-in the PAB select a Physical Node and press F9
7- in the Semantic Browser left pane, select the other Physical Node and press F9 => the other Physical Node becomes the Current Element
8- in the Semantic Browser left pane, select the Physical Link and press F9 => Nothing happens
9- in the Semantic Browser left pane, select the Physical Link and press F8 or any right menu action => Nothing happens
10- select another tab of the Semantic Browser or another view, then in the Semantic Browser left pane, select the Physical Link and press F9 => the Physical Link becomes the Current Element
The problem can also be reproduced in other cases while there's a selection change on the same tree on referenced/referencing element panel.

> The problem can be reproduced on other use cases with Semantic Browser. As long as the tree's content does not change, only the selection on that tree changes, F8 and F9 do not work. When selection change happens on the same viewer, missing updating selection provider won't update the selected element.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/648,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/648,capella,780551005,648,DynamicCreationAction should allow customized child creation menu labels,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T13:25:38Z,2021-01-06T13:25:44Z,"In EMF.Edit, an ItemProvider for a class may override the Label/Image for the create child/sibling actions. In Capella, this feature is crippeled, the label is always the Metaclass name. (See DynamicCreationAction which has a line
This is limiting and I would like to restore the default EMF.Edit behavior:

Imagine I have an Boolean Operation class, with 2 different operators, AND, OR. The operator is set as an enum attribute on the class. I would now like to have a create child menu for each available operator:
The created instance always has the type ""Operation"", but with a different operator attribute. There is now no way in Capella to set these labels with the hardcoded label in DynamicCreationAction.
Other cases where this would be useful are creation of Components (NODE vs BEHAVIOR), creation of Functions (Control Functions), etc.

I think this would be quite easy to patch: We would simply identify the capella root item providers and override their CreateChild.Helper methods to return the metaclass label by default to conserve the current behavior. Specialized item providers can then override these methods again to provide specialized labels like in my example.
> Jean, there's something I don't understand here... Please help.
> I have found that some (at least one) item providers already override the getCreateChildText() method, for example PhysicalFunctionItemProvider:

column2: public String getCreateChildText(Object owner, Object feature, Object child, Collection<?> selection) {

column1: > But then again, this text is overwritten during menu creation:
>    * Extends {@link DynamicCreateChildAction} to override the setText.
> So the item provider code customisation is useless?! Was it just forgotten to remove them? Maybe when the submenus were introduced, e.g. for ""owned default max value""->...?

> Now, if I was to submit a patch as proposed above, I would also have to go over all the item providers to remove their customisations of getCreateChildText (like here with PhysicalFunctionItemProvider), or otherwise all these customisations that are currently ""hidden"" would show up again.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTI5NzQ1NQ==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/649,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/649,capella,780551112,649,CapellamodellerResourceImpl.IdToEObjectMap not filled with emde.Element,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:25:49Z,2021-01-06T13:25:58Z,"CapellamodellerResourceImpl.IdToEObjectMap not filled with emde.Element
In Sirius, there is a feature to open a specific representation on the opening of a session. It is documented here [1]:

If Show on startup in set, then when a modeling project is opened which contains instances of this diagram description, they will be opened: if only one such representation exist, it will be opened automatically; if there are more than one, a dialog box will appear to allow the user to select which one(s) to open.
In Sirius, it is done in org.eclipse.sirius.ui.tools.internal.views.common.modelingproject.OpenRepresentationsFileJob.runInWorkspace(IProgressMonitor) [2].
In Capella, I think it could be done in org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.actions.OpenSessionAction.doOpenSessions(IProgressMonitor).
* Open the session with contextual menu ""Open Session"" on representations.aird
KO: The diagram is not opened.
> The patch set [1] is a proposition of fix. I'm not sure about condition with the boolean shouldOpenActivityExplorer...
> Actually these diagrams should be opened even when the activity explorer is not launched at session opening.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/656,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/656,capella,780551970,656,Cannot save after model copy paste: The object ComponentFunctionalAllocation is not contained in a resource,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:27:16Z,2021-01-06T13:27:25Z,"Problem reproduced on Capella 1.0.2 and on future 1.1.0.
2. Create an Operational Actor ""OperationalActor 1"" , an Operational Activity ""OperationalActivity 1"" and allocate the last one to the first one,
3. Select ""Operational Analysis"" and launch the ""Create System Actor"" transition,
=> At ""System Analysis"" level, you have an Actor ""OperationalActor 1"" allocating a System Function ""OperationalActivity 1"",
4. At ""System Analysis"" level, copy the Actor ""OperationalActor 1"" and paste it in the ""Actor"" package,
5. Save => Melody stays in a dirty state => Error in the ""Error log""

When pasting ""OperationalActor 1"", the ComponentFunctionalAllocation stored in the Actor is ignored in the copy (a Function can not be allocated by several Actors/Components). But the TransfoLink is pasted and still references the not copied ComponentFunctionalAllocation => we have a pending reference.
Do not copy the content of the ownedTraces reference when copying an element.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/657,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/657,capella,780552079,657,[Coding Style] Get rid of mixed line endings,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T13:27:28Z,2021-01-06T13:27:31Z,"The capella codebase has quite a few files with mixed line ending style.
This mixed style breaks editors, it breaks patches, it breaks git (especially when git.core.autocrlf is used), hurts eyes, it is a smell in the code base.
So we have 5154 files with a plain Windows Line Ending Style, and 2584 with mixed (!) style, meaning files that contain both windows and unix newline styles.
I think most of the mixed endings originate in some automation involving the class file copyright header.
Another case is that I think that editing files inline in gerrit will change line endings to the system line ending style: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/gerrit/issues/detail?id=3345
So I would not use inline editing unless we define the system line ending of the gerrit server as the capella style.

So I would like that we agree on a line ending style and use that. I'd say windows because that's what most files actually are using now. Changes that violate these should be rejected - if possible automatically.
Since an action like this will mess with peoples clones, I propose to do this on a weekend, advising everyone to stash away any changes and to pull the updated codebase first thing on a monday.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/670,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/670,capella,780562693,670,Potential NPE when trying to get a resource on a session,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:44:52Z,2021-01-06T13:45:01Z,"* Open a shared Capella project
* The editor of the representation is opened with this message: ""Authentication failed! Content access has failed at editor opening, you can try to reopen this editor.""
* Try to create a new Capella project: *KO*
There is a NPE in org.polarsys.capella.core.commands.preferences.util.PreferencesHelper.getSelectedCapellaProject() l.163 as there is no Session
> This bug is not resolved as the corresponding gerrit has not been merged.
> OK: we now check the Editor status before trying to open the Session.
> Verified in our very specific case where on restart, Capella was not able to load the model and subsequent project creations were all KO.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/679,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/679,capella,780563947,679,Better Capella Project Creation API,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:46:39Z,2021-01-06T13:46:47Z,"The current Project Creation API is too hard to use:
- It is not possible to create a capella project without a session without the need to subclass, because some useful methods are protected, e.g. SessionCreationHelper.createSemanticResource()

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/680,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/680,capella,780564074,680,Reduce calls of EObject.eResource() in Capella,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:46:51Z,2021-01-06T13:46:59Z,"The goal of this bug is to reduce calls of EObject.eResource() in the code.
The idea is not to remove the call of eResource() but rather to optimize the code to keep the value in a local variable for the same object when it's possible.
Below is a non exhaustive list of methods to optimize:

- org.polarsys.capella.core.model.handler.pre.commit.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener.markDirtyDependentResources(Set<Resource>, Map<ResourceSetSync, Set<Resource>>, Notification, EObject, Map<EObject, Resource>)

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/685,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/685,capella,780564751,685,Detect duplicate element IDs at load time,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T13:47:53Z,2021-01-06T13:47:55Z,"Duplicate element IDs should be detected at loading time. Their presence indicates a serious error in the model and such an error should be detected as early as possible, maybe also during save operations.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/689,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/689,capella,780565182,689,Export Preferences to Workspace Configuration Project does not work on Linux/MacOsx,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:48:35Z,2021-01-06T13:48:43Z,"In the Export Preferences dialog box, the computed field ""To preference file:"" is filled with a file containing ""\"" even on Linux/MacOsx when Workspace... is pressed.

In a workspace containing a Capella Configuration Project, click on File > Export... > General > Preferences > Next and in the Export Preferences dialog box, select Preferences to export and click on Workspace... then click on Select All and OK; in the Export Preferences dialog box the field ""To preference file:"" is filled with ""<workspace>/<configuration project>\<configuration project>_preferences.epf"" but should be ""<workspace>/<configuration project>/<configuration project>_preferences.epf""

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/690,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/690,capella,780565307,690,ValidationRuleTestCase does not consider diagnostic children when counting problems,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T13:48:47Z,2021-01-06T13:48:50Z,"With EMF Validation, it is possible to return a multistatus for a single validation rule, to report multiple problems for a given object.

I have a test case where an object is validated and the constraint implementation returns a multistatus with two children. Yet, the ValidationRuleTestCase implementation only counts one detected problem, even if there are two.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/691,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/691,capella,780565410,691,ValidationRuleTestCase.getOracleDefinitions should be called as late as possible,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:48:57Z,2021-01-06T13:49:05Z,"getOracleDefinitions() is currently called in the constructor. This means that oracle definitions need to be known at compile time which is sometimes not the case.

It would be better to delay calling this until the test model was loaded to allow calculation of the oracle definitions at runtime, using information found in the test model. In my case I have failing model elements name prefixed with fail_ and passing model elements name prefixed with ok_. I can easily add more test cases just by updating the model without changing the test case implementation.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/692,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/692,capella,780565548,692,[Performance] Business Queries are called twice,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:48:57Z,2021-01-06T13:49:18Z,"The old business queries code has not been removed and is still executed.
An example can be found here : org.polarsys.capella.core.model.helpers.DataPkgExt.getAllDataPkgs(EObject)
A check shall be done on all queries and/or helpers in order to remove all these duplicated queries execution.
> - old BQ computations have been removed along with the code
> - one new constant added for BQ GetCCIIShowHideComponent__Lib.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/702,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/702,capella,780566869,702,CapellaECrossreferenceAdapter does not handle REMOVE_MANY notification for containments,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:51:07Z,2021-01-06T13:51:13Z,"Removing all elements from a containment reference with clear() or removeAll(), is not handled CapellaECrossReferenceAdapter. The removed objects will remain in the cross referencer so they create a memory leak. The removeAll() case should be handled exactly the same way as the remove() case.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/716,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/716,capella,780568826,716,ClassCastException in DynamicCreateChildAction if child item provider returns a composed image,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T13:53:47Z,2021-01-06T13:53:49Z,"DynamicCreateChildAction casts the image object returned by item provider to URL without checking if the returned object is a URL. Have 'shouldComposeCreationImage' return true on an item provider leads to a ComposedImage which is not a URL so this will break with a CCE.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/721,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/721,capella,780569550,721,Capella ecore models should refer to eMDE by relative uri.,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:54:51Z,2021-01-06T13:54:58Z,"If I open/validate a Capella ecore model from data.def into an Ecore Editor, the editor cannot resolve eMDE model elements, even if eMDE is in my target platform definition.

This is because the capella ecore models refer to emde elements via platform:/plugin uri, which forces eMDE to be part of the _running_ platform. As a developer, I am not interested in having eMDE in my development platform. It should really be sufficient to have it in the target platform.
The fix should be simple - in theory: Replace the platform:/plugin references with relative uris.
EMF maps all models in the target platform to platform:/resource uris. So I should be able to refer to eMDE with platform:/resource/...
I have tried this, and ... it doesn't work: It looks like genmodels produced by EGF are using platform:/plugin uris for their ecore models, which messes up the uri mapping/resolver.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/725,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/725,capella,780570051,725,Wrapper plugin for non-orbit 3rd party libraries,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T13:55:36Z,2021-01-06T13:55:42Z,"Some 3rd party libraries are not in orbit. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/733,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/733,capella,780571055,733,Save behavior from the Capella Project Explorer view is not extensible and may be inconsistent,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:57:08Z,2021-01-06T13:57:16Z,"Currently in Capella, when saving a modified model or diagram from within a Sirius editor, the saving action follows the following steps:
- Retrieve the UISessionFactory through the org.eclipse.sirius.ui.uiSessionFactory extension point of Sirius.
- Use the UISessionFactory to retrieve the ""UISession"" (org.eclipse.sirius.ui.business.api.session.IEditingSession) of the Sirius Session we are saving.
- In Sirius the implementation org.eclipse.sirius.ui.business.internal.session.EditingSession is also an implementation of org.eclipse.ui.ISaveablesSource.
- The UISession is cast in order to obtain the org.eclipse.ui.Saveable instances. These Saveables provide the actual save behavior.
When saving a modified model or diagram from within the Capella Project Explorer view, the saving action follows the following steps:
- The CapellaSaveablesProvider provides the instances of CapellaSaveable which provide the actual save behavior.

The save behavior in Capella thus relies on the consistency of the CapellaSaveable implementation with the save behavior of the Saveables provided through the Sirius extension point. In other words, the save behavior of Capella depends on the view upon which the save is called. This consistency may be challenged by additional plug-ins providing other UISessionFactory implementations. Moreover, the save behavior is not extensible as the instantiation of CapellaSaveables by the CapellaSaveablesProvider cannot be extended. It should instead allow Capella extensions (e.g. Team For Capella) to customize this behavior.
A solution to do that is for the CapellaSaveablesProvider implementation to also rely on the org.eclipse.sirius.ui.uiSessionFactory extension point to retrieve the Saveables.
> https://git.polarsys.org/r/#/c/4739/ has been merged on master for Capella 1.2.0, see commit 5a4296ca4f35407704e29087b818f6423719fd78

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/734,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/734,capella,780571194,734,Capella saving policy is not based on the default Sirius saving policy and behavior,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T13:57:18Z,2021-01-06T13:57:28Z,"Since Sirius 2.0.0, the default saving policy used by Sirius is the IsModifiedSavingPolicy and Sirius activate two behavior to enforce save determinism.

This has been done in [ECLIPSE-430724 and https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=445603.](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-430724 and https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=445603.&type=Issues)
, to diminish indeterminism of the save behavior: session.save() might be called within the context of a read-write transaction and this introduces indeterminism.

During the CapellaSavingPolicy installation, Capella disables the optimizations made in [ECLIPSE-445603](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-445603&type=Issues) (setDeferSaveToPostCommit(false) and setSaveInExclusiveTransaction(false).
It makes no sense to *save* in the middle of a transaction and is only asking for more troubles among other issues :
- triggers are not launched yet, meaning if we close and reopen more work will need to be done like refreshing a representation for instance.
- we might be saving an half modified model, dangling references might still be presents
- the transaction might not be valid and be cancelled or failed before the end, yet we saved in the middle of it.
It would be interesting to check why this has been disabled in Capella and if it should be enabled.

The CapellaSavingPolicy relies on ResourceSetSync.getStatus(res) and disable the serialization change detection (this is ok only because Capella models use technical ids, but if an add-ons has a serialization using Xpath serialization c)
The IsModifiedSavingPolicy relies on the Resouce.isModified attribute and
cross-resources dependencies to compute the list of resources to
actually save. It can be much faster than the previous SavingPolicy (superclass of CapellaSavingPolicy)
1. it uses the resource.isModified state as a basis to compute what
2. it browses the other resources to detect dependencies toward
3. it filters this set of logically modified resources by serializing
them in a file buffer and comparing the result with the current file.
This strategy has the following characteristics:
- we avoid many serializations compared to the SavingPolicyImpl
implementation by using the isModified boolean;
- on the other hand we might browse the models, but this is made in a
way that proxies should not be resolved. In practice this did not even
came up in the profiling traces;
- we will never ever actually save the file if there is no change (just
- only platform:/resources and file:/resources are considered (which is important for CDOResources for instance, we don't need to browse the model there, or Ecore resource
with http:// URIs, we don't need to send PUT on the Eclipse Server...).
- It make sures non existing files will be saved anyway as their
isModifed"" status would not be enough for a resource which just got
- It also makes the IsModifiedSavingPolicy ignore resource.isLoaded when deciding whether a resource has changes or not. This is necessary to keep the same behavior as the previous policy
It should be very instersesting to keep the Sirius saving behavior or at least to inherits from IsModifiedPolicy instead of SavingPolicyImpl
> The two provided patch sets require https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/146456/
> Set ""org.polarsys.capella.core.session.saving.policy.old"" to ""true"" to restore old saving policy
> The saving policy is still the old one.
> The DRAFT patch set which shows how to switch on the new saving policy has not been modified nor merged ( see https://git.polarsys.org/r/7953 )
> See CapellaSessionListener, the default value if there is no passed system property is still true.
> For Capella 1.4.0, the new saving policy (consistent with Sirius default behavior) can be enabled by setting ""org.polarsys.capella.core.session.saving.policy.old"" to ""false"".
> I propose to reopen this ticket it would be clearer than creating a new bugzilla.

> Otherwise we should create a clone and rename this one into a ""Preparation steps to introduce a CapellaIsModifiedSavingPolicy"".","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTMxMzEwMQ==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/749,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/749,capella,780573279,749,Do ID generation in EFactories instead of ModelElement's getId method,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:00:23Z,2021-01-06T14:00:31Z,"In generated code, ID generation is done in getId method of ModelElement. This should be done in the createClass methods of EFactory classes.

> Tu Ton, did you test the impact of this on model loading time? This patch will always create the ID at object construction time, and this is also called once for every loaded model element. Seems not ok for me.

> You're right for the impact on the loading of objects. With this patch, when a model is loaded, objects are created with a generated id but right after that, their persisted ids are used instead when they are attached to the resource.

> However, we think that this is the proper way to set id for a new object rather than setting id via the getId method like before. Because i) as long as the getId method is not called, the object is not set with any id and ii) in the context of Team for Capella, there's the problem when the getId method is called within a Read-only transaction while the setId needs a Write permission.

> I agree that it's even worse to set it in the getter. Still, would be cool to see how much more time it takes to load a big model with this new approach.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTMxNDYxOQ==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/758,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/758,capella,780574510,758,[AFM] Modeling project can not be opened any more,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:02:10Z,2021-01-06T14:02:19Z,"Attachment: [ecoreProject.zip](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280916.zip)
- by double clicking the aird if in Capella perspective
- by unfolding the ecoreTest project if in Modeling perspective
-> KO : java.lang.RuntimeException: The modeling project ""ecoreTest"" is invalid: Problem during loading models: Cannot find metadata resource: /ecoreTest/representations.afm
Because of the check done in MelodyTeamSessionFactory.checkMetaData, all Sirius projects that do not have the afm file are considered as invalid.
This issue is a regression from Capella 1.1.x.
This issue is blocker for every user that would have to manage their own model and representation through a sirius project.
> Actually the afm check is done is SessionMetadataHelper.checkMetadata
> It seems that org.polarsys.kitalpha.ad.services.manager.ViewpointManager.checkViewpointsCompliancy(ResourceSet) should check that the context is in a Capella project
> Or the session factory should do this check before calling the KitAlpha check.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/763,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/763,capella,780582582,763,Delete causes explorer refresh even if delete transaction command was rolled back,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T14:14:30Z,2021-01-06T14:14:35Z,"CapellaDeleteCommand fires a LongRunningOperation.complete event even if the command was rolled back.

> So if a complete event is sent, project explorer refreshes to remove the deleted elements from the view, but then, the command is rolled back and no refresh is performed -> It looks like the elements were deleted, but are actually not.
> For cases like this, it would be good if the Project Explorer had an explicit 'Refresh' button, to force a manual viewer update.

> I will submit a patch to make sure that the complete event isn't sent if the command is rolled back.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTMyMjI2OA==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

The delete command operation class is no longet CapellaDeleteCommand, but BasicCapellaDeleteCommand (since 5f3937a89e181754d480df9958a988934ef7ac3c) so makes sure the listeners reflect that change.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/787,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/787,capella,780585321,787,Eclipse hangs when popup menu is opened in Capella Project Explorer,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:18:41Z,2021-01-06T14:18:49Z,"In Capella versions 1.2.0 and 1.1.2 I experience a problem with creating new capella elements and diagrams from capella project explorer. When I try to open context menu in Capella Project Explorer for capella elements Eclipse freeze for some time (5-10 s) every time menu is opened.
The most long time Eclipse hangs for Data Package.
There is no problem with context menu when I open it for non Capella elements in Capella Project Explorer.
When I open context menu for capella element in Project Explorer (not Capella Project Explorer) there is no such problem. But in Project Explorer only diagrams can be created but no new elements.
There is no this problem in Capella 0.8.7 and 1.0.2. In these version all works well.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/791,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/791,capella,780585770,791,Prepare reprensentation lazy loading,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:19:24Z,2021-01-06T14:19:32Z,"The reprensentation lazy loading is the idea that representation data are loaded only when needed.
1- representation data are stored in a dedicated resource.

2- the applicative code explicitly loads the representation only when required. In other terms, it supposes that all code that do not need the representation has to be migrated to not load call DRepresentationDescriptor.getRepresentation
1- As an experimental mode, Sirius allows the representation to be stored in a dedicated resource for local resource using property system @createLocalRepresentationInSeparateResource=true@
Refer to doc Sirius\Developper\Representations lazy loading
2- The aim of this ticket is
* to migrate the capella code to rely on DRepresentationDescriptor instead of DRepresentation everywhere it is possible.

* as once previous migration is done, no representation should be loaded until we need them. So the second part is to explicitly load the representation where we need it(Open Diagram, Clone diagram, move diagram, rename ...)
> I pushed a first patchset to gerrit(https://git.polarsys.org/r/5654) to guide you on what have to be done.
> With this patchset, you should be able to do the following actions without loading the representation:
> * then unfold nodes in capella explorer
> * then display contextual menu and submenu on diagram or semantic object on which you can add representation
> To check that a representation is loaded or not, just call DRepresentationDescriptor.isLoadedRepresentation()

> You can display that information using the ""Sirius Debugging"" view (org.eclipse.sirius.ui.debug plug-in). Select the DRepresentationDescriptor under the semantic object -> the view display if the representation is loaded.
> Next steps will be to check that functionalities that need the representation
> * will correctly work (that supposes that the rep is correctly loaded)
> Functionalities to check are: open, Clone, Rename, delete, export etc...
> Can someone link to the corresponding Sirius bug for this?
> A new gerrit fixing the following issues from previous commit https://git.polarsys.org/r/#/c/5654/:
> - On Open diagram, prevent loading diagram before the progress monitor is displayed.
> - On Rename diagram, prevent keeping the DRepresentation on attributes of the command
> - On CapellaScmDecorator, remove reference towards DRepresentation since registered only descriptors.
> - On Capella Label Provider used in status bar, display a (Not Loaded) information when a representation is not loaded.
> - It factorizes accesses to RepresentationDescriptors on all actions by adding a new Helper into RepresentationHelper

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/794,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/794,capella,780586149,794,Progress Monitoring > Set Progress at top-level ... corrupts the library / project,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T14:19:56Z,2021-01-06T14:19:59Z,"After setting the Progress at the top-level (i.e. at the project level, right below the *.aird) in a Capella library, with the default options (i.e. only changing the ""Value to propagate"", tested on ""DRAFT"", ""REVIEWED_OK""), this library is no longer seen as a library by other projects. i.e. when you try to reference this library in another project, it is not displayed among the possible libraries.
This ends up in not being able to use your library. Which is pretty bad :-).
The good news is that you could revert the modification by propagating a ""null"" progress value.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/796,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/796,capella,780586415,796,Move Components and Parts together between containers,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T14:20:18Z,2021-01-12T12:05:30Z,"When component is moved into another component in Project Explorer the part (typed with this component) remains in the previous component. As a result components containment hierarchy is different from real structure (derived from parts).

In project with SingletonComponents components and parts should be moved together. When componen is moved into new container the part should also be moved into this container. When parts is moved into new container the component should also be moved into this container.

The right behaviour with component\part movement is realized in component breakdown diagram. When component is moved into another component in  component breakdown diagram it's part also is moved into new component.
The same behaviour with component\parts movement should be applied in Project Explorer.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/797,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/797,capella,780586516,797,The same ordering for components\parts in SingletonComponents projects,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T14:20:27Z,2021-01-06T14:20:29Z,"Ordering of components should result in parts ordering in SingletonComponents projects. And vice versa ordering of parts should result the same components ordering.
Information about parts ordering is used when different reports are created from Capella model. Reodering of components by user does not influence parts order in this reports.

Parts represent the real product structure. Components definitions can be stored in any place and it does not change product structure (defined by parts). So namely parts should be used to get product structure from Capella model.

In SingletonComponents projects parts are hiden in Project Explorer. Users think about containers as about parts. When user change ordering of components he think that he reorder container's parts. But currently it's not the case because components ordering does not influence parts ordering.
If Parts filter is switched off then user can change order for parts. But in this case he needs to apply the same ordering for parts and components. It's couner productive.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/802,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/802,capella,780587207,802,Spaces in fragmented file URIs are displayed as %20,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T14:21:26Z,2021-01-06T14:21:29Z,"The fragmented file URI displayed by the popup named ""Model Fragmentation"" for ""Fragments..."" action is not decoded, example : ""platform:/resource/Fragmented%20Model/fragments/OA.melodyfragment"".
The method to use is probably org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI.decode(String).
* Create a new Capella project named ""Fragmentated Model""
* On Operational Analysis, use the contextal menu ""Model Fragmentation""
* KO: The popup proposes by default the URI ""platform:/resource/Fragmented%20Model/fragments/OA.melodyfragment""

* KO: If the user want to add a space between ""O"" and ""A"" to have a real path like ""platform:/resource/Fragmented Model/fragments/O A.melodyfragment"", it must write ""platform:/resource/Fragmented%20Model/fragments/O%20A.melodyfragment""
This issue is probably linked to [POLARSYS-460](https://github.com/search?q=POLARSYS-460&type=Issues) and [POLARSYS-1382](https://github.com/search?q=POLARSYS-1382&type=Issues).

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/809,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/809,capella,780588088,809,Performance issues on EObjectLabelProvider.getText,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:22:45Z,2021-01-06T14:22:53Z,"Since bugzilla 2032, performance may be significantly discreased on a remove model due to intensive use of EObjectLabelProvider.getText.
This method use eResource to retrieve the EditingDomain of an element, instead of using TransactionHelper.getEditingDomain, which was improved in 1.1.2 with bugzilla 1570.
To avoid performance issues on diagram refresh, the EObjectLabelProvider.getText shall be replaced with a more performant one.
> EObjectLabelProviderHelper.getText() is around x8 slower than EObjectExt.getText()
> With bugzilla 2036, EObjectLabelProviderHelper will be moved from org.polarsys.capella.common to org.polarsys.capella.common.helpers, where we will be able to use TransactionHelper in it.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/824,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/824,capella,780590092,824,Use descriptors on Contextual Elements instead of diagrams,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:25:41Z,2021-01-06T14:25:49Z,"On Capella diagrams, it is possible to define a diagram contextual towards one or many semantic elements. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/826,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/826,capella,780590359,826,Refactor of menu contributions,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:26:05Z,2021-01-06T14:26:14Z,"When a new view is contributed in Capella, if we want to add common navigation contextual menus like ""Show in Capella Explorer"", ""Show in Semantic Browser"" to it, we have to create explicitly those commands by creating <command> in plugin.xml of the new view.
It adds dependencies from the new view towards all classical views, and it not compliant with eclipse standard contribution mechanism.
For instance, the menu contribution ""Show in Semantic Browser"" is defined 3 times in capella.
In eclipse, if a view want to contribute to the ""Show in"" menu, it just have to register to a group ""group.showIn"" and this menu is available to all views that are covering the showIn action.

- In Capella, there is already some groups (separator) allowing to contribute to menus, but capella.platform.sirius.ui.menu register all the group to all popup menu, and we don't want this behavior. (REC/RPL, pattern menus are available in all views but this not relevant)
Goal of this issue is to refactor menu contributions to change this behavior:
- Menu contributions are moved to the plugin defining the action. (A view like Semantic Browser is responsible to adding its menu command to a shared group)
- When a view want to have for instance the 'navigation group', it just have to add the shared group to its contextual menu, to benefit to all contributions to this group.
- capella.platform.sirius.ui.menu will still be responsible to defining shared group in the shared capella existing views, but will not register any commands on it.

> *** [ECLIPSE-555600](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-555600&type=Issues) has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTMyODcyNQ==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/839,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/839,capella,780592222,839,Memory leaks after the export of Capella project to remote,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:28:41Z,2021-01-06T14:28:50Z,"Some references to the editing domain and to transaction remains after the export of a Capella project to remote.
- It seems the SemanticEditingDomain initializes a crossreferencer in its constructor but does not dispose it.
- The ExecutionManagers also keep a reference to the editing domain

> I resumed work on the analysis of memory leaks which Guillaume had paused. The gerrit was no longer accessible (it was on the old polarsys repo). I pushed the pull request 223 [1] to have it for history. It is the same as https://git.polarsys.org/r/6497 pushed the 29/08/2018.

> Finally, there is no real leak with ExecutionManager. It was retained by ViewpointManager. This leak has been fixed directly in Kitalapha with the bugzilla ""[563093] Avoid memory leak in ViewpointManager"" [2]. So the cleaning in ExecutionManager done by the gerrit is no longer needed.

> Concerning the unregisterAdapters of resourceSet. The same job is done in ""DAnalysisSessionImpl.close(IProgressMonitor)"" with disableAndRemoveECrossReferenceAdapters(), except for dataNotifier. The resourceSet is no longer referenced (after other fixes). So the cleaning of dataNotifier is not necessary. Or at least, it does not cause memory leak.
> In consequence, I close this issue as invalid and abandon the gerrit.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/841,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/841,capella,780592546,841,Remove kitalpha legacy annotation and simplify M2 generation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:29:05Z,2021-01-06T14:29:14Z,"http://www.polarsys.org/kitalpha/dsl/2007/dslfactory is replaced by http://www.polarsys.org/kitalpha/emde/1.0.0/extension since at least 2014.
In our root metamodels located into m2 folder,
we still use this deprecated annotation and migrate it the new one while generation of our generated metamodels on data.gen
Goal of this ticket is to simplify the generation of our metamodel by migrating directly the annotation on root metamodels on m2 folder, and simplify EGF generation.
EGF generation org.polarsys.capella.common.extension.migration.egf generates genmodel and ecore files located into *.gen plugins.
It also do some steps which can be simplified :
- Adding new annotations in the *.gen ecore  => done with EGF pattern, it can be simplified using java
- Update some manifest files => done with EGF pattern, it can be simplified using java
- Replacement of old imports of files that was never opensourced (prior 0.8.x) => to remove
> Simplified but keeping the original behavior.
> Only http://www.polarsys.org/kitalpha/dsl/2007/dslfactory is deleted on target ecore.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/858,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/858,capella,780594852,858,CapellaCloneDiagramCommand.undo() can fail to delete the cloned representation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:32:19Z,2021-01-06T14:32:28Z,"I detected several issues in CapellaCloneDiagramCommand

In some specific context (Team for Capella with lazy loading of representation), if the shared .srm resource is deleted before the call to CapellaCloneDiagramCommand(), some exceptions are thrown (IllegalStateException).
When I looked into the issue, it appears that some parts of this specific command should maybe be done directly in Sirius and this command removed (copy of eannotations on the descriptor)
The concrete issue is that the undo() method begins by looking for a Session from the descriptor.getRepresentation().getTarget where as the representation is maybe no more here or not loaded.
It should use the descriptor.getTarget() to do it.

Note: to go further, the command should inherit from recording command: this would allow to get rid of the undo() and redo() command. It will prevent the undo() to call dialectManager.delete(representation, session) and redo to ask the user a second time in which  aird he wants to store the created diagram. Furthermore, it will directly take the change description and apply the same change than the first execution.
> I also created a bug in Sirius : [ECLIPSE-540258](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-540258&type=Issues)
> My current concrete reproduction case requires Team for Capella.
> A new issue has been created to improve clone action with the ""further actions"" described in the description.
> The two merged commit fixes our issues.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/888,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/888,capella,780613735,888,EnumerationLiteral in Enumeration's ownedDataValues reference instead of ownedLiterals,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:57:49Z,2021-01-06T14:57:58Z,"Facts:
DataPkg and Enumeration extends DataValueContainer that have a relation ownedDataValues.
Enumeration can also contains EnumerationLiterals with its relation ownedLiterals.
In Capella Project Explorer, EnumerationLiteral can only be created in a Enumeration, even if it is a DataValue (so it is not possible to create an
EnumerationLiteral under a Data Package for example)
In CDB diagram, a ""Data Values"" tool allows to display DataValues like EnumerationLiterals.
EnumerationLiteral displayed in the CDB can be drag'n'drop under a DataPkg. If the EnumerationLiteral is drag'n'drop again under an Enumeration, it
will be contains via the ownedDataValues relation, not the ownedLiterals.
In a Enumeration, EnumerationLiterals can be contained by two different relationships, so you cannot reorder literals using ""move up / move down""
create a DataPkg and an Enumeration with several EnumerationLiterals under it
display the DataPkg with the ""Data Packages"" tool or a with drag'n'drop from the Capella Project Explorer
display one of the EnumerationLiteral with the ""Data Values"" tool
drag'n'drop the EnumerationLiteral to the DataPkg
In the Capella Project Explorer, drag'n'drop the EnumerationLiteral to the Enumeration
- fix ""Insert / Remove Data Values"" palette tool to avoid to insert in CDB existing enumeration literal, except if he target is an existing enumeration
- provide a new validation rule to detect this invalid enumeration literal and quickfix to update it
> - DnD a LiteralBooleanValue from a BooleanType to a DataPkg on ProjectExplorer should be forbidden.
> - Copy/Paste a LiteralBooleanValue from a BooleanType to a DataPkg on ProjectExplorer should be forbidden.
> - Show/Hide Data Values should not propose LiteralBooleanValue to avoid similar bug of EnumerationLiteral

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/889,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/889,capella,780613899,889,[Move Elements] Better handle move of parts and components across projects,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:58:01Z,2021-01-06T14:58:11Z,"Automatic move of parts as described in [POLARSYS-1904 is not satisfying. Sometimes parts are referenced by other elements so we would have to auto-move these elements too, which isn't possible to do in an automatic way. User-interaction is needed: Rather than auto-move the part, we add a 'synthetic' backreference from a component to its parts, so that when the user adds a component to the stage, a backref to its parts forces the user to also add the representing parts to the stage. From that point on, the transfer UI could auto-propose a new parent for the part as soon as the user chooses a parent for the component and vice versa.](https://github.com/search?q=POLARSYS-1904 is not satisfying. Sometimes parts are referenced by other elements so we would have to auto-move these elements too, which isn't possible to do in an automatic way. User-interaction is needed: Rather than auto-move the part, we add a 'synthetic' backreference from a component to its parts, so that when the user adds a component to the stage, a backref to its parts forces the user to also add the representing parts to the stage. From that point on, the transfer UI could auto-propose a new parent for the part as soon as the user chooses a parent for the component and vice versa.&type=Issues)

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/891,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/891,capella,780614225,891,Delete action and command should use the RepresentationDescriptor instead of the Representation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T14:58:31Z,2021-01-06T14:58:39Z,"Attachment: [testCapellaInvalidRep1.2.2 (1).zip](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280920.zip)

Delete action and command should use the RepresentationDescriptor instead of the Representation to avoid having descriptors that can't be deleted because of a broken reference to their representation.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/900,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/900,capella,780615505,900,Composite Functional Chains and Sequence Links,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:00:17Z,2021-01-06T15:00:25Z,"Goal of this issue is to enhance Composite Functional Chains and add sequencing concepts on Functional Chains.
- In 1.3.0, Functional chains can be compound with another chains but with some limitations.
A chain can be linked to another only if there is a functional exchange between funciton ending and starting chains.
Connecting a chain if they have a common functions, or if there is a functional exchange between functions at each involvments of the chain, not restricted to start/end of chains.

- Sequence Links express precedence between executions of represented Functions. A sequence link indicates that, in the context of the Functional Chain, the source Function should operate before the target Function

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/905,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/905,capella,780616202,905,CreationService should not need to be called manually,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T15:01:18Z,2021-01-06T15:01:24Z,"Whenever an element is attached to the model, the creation service (CapellaElementExt.creationService) must be invoked, e.g. to handle part creation when a component is created, or to name the element properly. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/927,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/927,capella,780619623,927,Refresh All Sub Representations needs progress monitoring improvements.,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:05:38Z,2021-01-06T15:05:47Z,"![RefreshSubReps131.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280922.png)
* Open a Capella project with a large amount of representations
* Select the .aird and launch the Refresh All Sub Representations
* A dialog is displayed asking for confirmation. It shows the number of found representations
* Clic on the progress icon or open the Progress view
* The task is renamed for each refreshed representations the progress bar shows one tick sometimes before being set to 0.
* Users do not known when this will end or the amount of done/remaining work.
I detected the issue on a project with 328 representations.
Additional remark: It seems that the action should be called refresh all representations, I do not see the meaning of ""Sub"" in this case.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/940,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/940,capella,780621373,940,Capella does not start with Java 11 or 12,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:08:10Z,2021-01-06T15:08:17Z,"While doing some tests on Capella, I tried to launch it with JDK 12.0.2.
It appears that the eclipse.ini is incomplete: --add-modules=ALL-SYSTEM should be added (as done in .ini of the Eclipse packages since Oxygen 3.a)
Then I get several initialization errors due to the use of javax in Capella classes: the root causes seems to be always the same:
Several Java EE and CORBA modules have been removed from the JDK 11 (see https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/11-relnote-issues-5012449.html) :
Those errors prevent several Capella bundles to start. Note that Eclipse Photon and Eclipse 2019-06 start well.
> In my case, I also had to do some tests running Capella 1.3.x with Java 11.
> I was not able to launch a capella 1.3.x with java 11 until I add javax.xml.bind into org.polarsys.capella.common.tools.report required dependencies.
> As javax.xml.bind is not in Java 11+, it is possible the javax.xml.bind and javax.xml.stream should have to be added in target platform dependencies.
> Note that javac.xml.bind could be taken in Orbit.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/945,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/945,capella,780622149,945,Validation rules after Component/Actor refactoring,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:09:10Z,2021-01-06T15:09:18Z,"1. Update existing rule dealing with Components/Actors
2. Add new rules to cover the cases below:

rule#1: A Component or Actor â€œis Humanâ€ true cannot have sub components nor sub Actors (only deployments of component/actors is allowed, getContainedParts shall be empty, managing sub packages too)
rule#2: Only root Actors (inside structure) can be kind UNSET (actors contained into another actor/component cannot be unset)

rule#3: Add WARNING for Actor and physical component UNSET (except root component (always UNSET)) and provide a switch (QF multiple) to move towards Behavior or Node: e.g. ""Switch to Behavior if possible"", if possible because the switch depends on the parent or deployment rules (with messages to understand why the switch cannot be done, due to parent or deployment nature of other component/actor ""Totot"" & QF navigation towards this related model element)
rule#4: Only Actor UNSET can deploy both components/actors kind Node or Behavior, otherwise check consistency like any other components.
o Node Components (actor or not) can contain Node and deploy Node or Behavior
o Behavior Components (actor or not) can contain Behavior and deploy behavior
rule#5: Op Entity: isActor = false and isHuman = false, detect other cases and add switch QF
o System cannot contains any component/actor
o Only one component isActor=false shall be contained in the root structure pkg (directly or recursively by owned structure pkgs (components contained into a component are allowed) )

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/961,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/961,capella,780638190,961,Reorganize Actor/Component related tools within the Diagram Palette,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:31:39Z,2021-01-06T15:31:48Z,"According to the PAB model, the Actor Reuse tool, and the Component Reuse tool should be grouped together with their associated actor/component creation tools, under similar function groups.
For instance, the current state of things does not comply with the above specification at the Logical Architecture level.
> As it is visible on the Diagram's Palette framework, the Reuse Physical Actor is part of a functional group which also includes the Physical Actor creation tool.

> As in opposition to the PAB diagram, within the hereby Palette, the Reuse Logical Actor tool is in the same level as the other tools (Logical Actor creation tool included). There is no tool group, and this should be added back.
