issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/964,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/964,capella,780638603,964,Command Line launch doesnt work,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:32:13Z,2021-01-06T15:32:21Z,"When capella is launched with command line, it doesn't work.
!MESSAGE An error occurred while automatically activating bundle org.polarsys.capella.common.tools.report.appenders.reportlogview (538).
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: An error occurred while automatically activating bundle org.polarsys.capella.common.ui (543).
Caused by: org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Exception in org.polarsys.capella.common.ui.MdeCommonUiActivator.start() of bundle org.polarsys.capella.common.ui.
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: An error occurred while automatically activating bundle org.polarsys.capella.core.preferences (635).
Caused by: org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Exception in org.polarsys.capella.core.preferences.Activator.start() of bundle org.polarsys.capella.core.preferences.
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Workbench has not been created yet.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: An error occurred while automatically activating bundle org.polarsys.capella.common.ui (543).
Caused by: org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Exception in org.polarsys.capella.common.ui.MdeCommonUiActivator.start() of bundle org.polarsys.capella.common.ui.
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: An error occurred while automatically activating bundle org.polarsys.capella.core.preferences (635).
Caused by: org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Exception in org.polarsys.capella.core.preferences.Activator.start() of bundle org.polarsys.capella.core.preferences.
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Workbench has not been created yet.
> - CommandLineApp is initializing the logger before creating the workbench.
> - Then, the logger is initializing its appenders ""ReportManagerActivator.getAppenders"", among the InformationView,
> InformationView, is located into reportlogview plugin, which is depending on common.ui
> - common.ui is depending on core.preferences which is requiring the workbench. (due to fix of [POLARSYS-2506)](https://github.com/search?q=POLARSYS-2506)&type=Issues)
> - The first fix is to use standard eclipse preferences for the csv, not the core.preference.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/972,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/972,capella,780639731,972,Capella isn't able to work with MacOs Catalina,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:33:44Z,2021-02-23T08:11:36Z,"Hi,
It's not possible to run Capella on MacOsx: even when configuring execution rights on the app package as well as pointing on a local JVM (Java 8).
I see the launch window, but then it's asking to install the old Java 6 VM which is no more compatible with Catalina...

> I think this a general error with eclipse on MAC. I am using High sierra and had the old java 6 and several other versions installed that made Eclipse fail. However I managed to get Capella work on Mac doing the following:
> Install adopt openjdk8 (if you have it already installed you can **reinstall** it)
> In theory at this point you should be able to run it, but things are not always so easy
> The launcher bundled with Capella is not working out of the box, so we will transplant a working one from another eclipse installation. First get the donor by using the following command:
> this will put a fresh eclipse installation in your apps folder
> Now, use finder to find your Capella copy extract it and right click to bring up the context menu, select:  **""Show package contents""**
> You  will see a pair of directories:
> MacOs: contains a launcher and workspace
> **Info.plist: used to configure Mac native launcher**
> Now locate your eclipse installation in your apps folder and **""Show package contents""**

> If you are lucky it should work now, but if you are like me and have more than one Java version you might not be so lucky. I got Java 11 installed and the current Capella version available doesn't get along with it very well.
> Thankfully the fix is easy open Info.plist you will find a section that looks like the following:
> <!-- to use a specific Java version (instead of the platform's default) uncomment one of the following options,
> or add a VM found via $/usr/libexec/java_home -V
> Un-comment and put the path to your openjdk8 installation usually it is /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/adoptopenjdk-8.jdk/Contents/Home/bin/
> Got it working in the end.
> 1. install the jdk8 from oracle site, not via brew, neither sdkman
> 2. Update Eclipse.App/Contents/info.plist and Eclipse.App/Contents.Eclipse/eclipse.ini files to reference the jdk (/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_261.jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java)

> I guess there are some fix to apply on the cappella side (for example adding the execution bit on the eclipse file) before closing that ticket.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTM2OTg0Nw==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/974,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/974,capella,780639974,974,Validation rule to detect the integrity of Capella project,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T15:34:07Z,2021-01-06T15:34:08Z,"Currently in Capella the model validation mechanism ignores some basic elements of a default structure (let us assume a newly generated project structure is altered by removing the logical component realization link from the physical structure).

A dedicated validation rule should be defined and integrated within the already existing rules, in order to raise an error if a project structure lacks one of the basic elements (i.e. realization links at different levels for the root functions/elements, or even root elements themselves).
It is about checking the integrity of the Skeleton of a project, using a reference model, and checking a targeted project against all its base components.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/976,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/976,capella,780640183,976,Homogenize the order of the adapters on the resource set and the one in the loaded EObjects.,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:34:27Z,2021-01-06T15:34:37Z,"The order of the adapters on the resource set is not the same than the one in the loaded EObjects.
Regarding how and when the session is opened, we get different eAdapters order on the model elements.
The order of the adapters can impact the order of EMF modifications and so the end result of model modification can be different.
It is important to have DataNotifier adapter in first position because it is the (famous and useful) adapter which affect directly model element.
This different order is even more significant and damageable on collaborative model since the model is opened before dataNotifier setting.
In order to priorize the DataNotifier in the first place, we have to modify the order of adapters on the resource set.
> It seems that this issue is resolved since the commit 4e56f98b9b5c2fa638649283422d86fb43c3a06e [1].
> @Philippe Dul : Can you confirm? If yes, I let you mark the issue as resolved. I've already changed the ""Target Milestone"" to 1.4.1.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1000,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1000,capella,780643415,1000,Performance problem on Refresh of Duration in Exchange Scenario diagram,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:39:08Z,2021-01-06T15:39:22Z,"Use case:
1. Create a new Exchange Scenario diagram
3. Add an Actor and 2 Functional Exchanges between System and Actor
==> The Refresh operation takes 4-5s to finish
1. The Refresh of the second, third Duration ... and so on in the diagram is OK
2. The Refresh of other elements in the sequence diagram (e.g. FE, Loop, Timer) is OK
The method refreshEdgeMapping of class DDiagramSynchronizer (org.eclipse.sirius.diagram.business.internal.sync.experimental.sync) freezes during debug (with the Duration as input edge).

> The default value of the attribute ""Size Computation Expression"" for the style of an edge mapping is [eContents()->size()/]. This kind of expression initialized the Acceleo3 interpreter that is not used in Capella and this is costly. This commit replaces all the default value of this attribute by ""1"".

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1051,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1051,capella,780651146,1051,[xAB] Visually distinguish external and internal components,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T15:49:29Z,2021-01-06T15:49:31Z,"In xAB diagrams, it is possible to add a Component that lies outside of the component hierarchy of the diagram target component. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1057,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1057,capella,780651910,1057,Ability to move xAB diagrams,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T15:50:33Z,2021-01-06T15:50:41Z,"It should allowed possible to move an xAB diagram to a different component.
There is just one corner case that should be analyzed:

In an xAB under a component C, it is not possible to add C to the diagram, since C is the diagram target. So when moving an xAB that already contains a node for C under C this restriction would be violated. Either this restriction is removed, or the drop target must be validated to not violate this condition.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1081,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1081,capella,780698165,1081,Deleting FOP on copied Function removes exchange from orignial Function in the diagram,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T16:52:37Z,2021-01-06T16:52:46Z,"In Capella Team, steps to reroduce:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1086,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1086,capella,780698895,1086,Show/Hide of Function involving FE with Exchange Categories can lead to useless Edge creation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T16:53:43Z,2021-01-06T16:53:57Z,"Detailed steps to reproduce:
1. Start Capella 0.8.6 and create an empty model,
2. Create a SDFB diagram (see attached screen shot ReproductionSDFB.png),
3. Create a Category referencing the FE:
i. Right click on the FE > Category > Create Category,
ii. Keep the default name and click OK,
4. Using the Show/Hide Function tool, hide ""System Function 2"",
6. Open the ""Model Request Interpreter view"" and enter <% outgoingEdges %>

7. You have 3 edges where there should be only one (there are 2 weird edges without name). One of the Edge is not in the containment tree of the model: this can lead to model inconsistencies (mainly when working in collaborative mode)
> Hardcoded strings in Properties view, Value attribute
> In the first comment (Detailed steps to reproduce), Step 6:
> once the request is entered in the Model Request Intepreter you have to select the Functional Output Port of the internal SF1 to check the number of outgoing edges.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1091,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1091,capella,780699720,1091,Refactoring of Exchange Category creation for better testability,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T16:54:49Z,2021-01-06T16:54:57Z,"Sub classes of CreateCategoriesController open an InputDialog to ask the user the new category name.
Hence we can not use this class in our auto tests.
=> Add a new parameter to be able to give the category name without opening the InputDialog.
> 1. For testability, new parameter added to give the new Exchange Category name (if a value is specified, the InputDialog is not shown),

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1092,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1092,capella,780699871,1092,[Performance][CDB] Avoid unnecessary refresh operations when executing tools + optimize refresh operation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T16:55:01Z,2021-01-06T16:55:10Z,"1. In common.odesign, Class Diagram Blank definition, we have some tools with ""Force Refresh"" checked. In addition, during the execution of the tool itself, we call CapelleServices.foreRefresh(DDiagram) with an Acceleo expression like this one: <%$diagram.forceRefresh%> (or something close).
-> Refresh of the diagram is done 2 times.

2. When refreshing a diagram, we browse the whole semantic model for each Edge Mapping to search for semantic candidate elements for Edges. In CDB we have 3 Edge Mappings so the model is fully browsed 3 times.
-> It can be optimized by using ""Semantic Candidates Expression"" in .odesign.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1162,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1162,capella,780711867,1162,Functional Scenario allow creating functional exchanges between a function and its children functions,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T17:12:39Z,2021-01-06T17:12:40Z,"Functional exchanges between a function and its children functions are forbidden.
Dataflow Blank diagrams prevent user from creating such exchanges.
However, this constraint is not implemented in Functional Diagram tools.
This contraint shall be added to Functional Diagram tools.
See this forum discussion for context: https://polarsys.org/forums/index.php/t/552/

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1163,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1163,capella,780711962,1163,FunctionalChain internal arrow to a port without exchanges must not be displayed,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T17:12:47Z,2021-01-06T17:12:55Z,"Steps to reproduce:

column2: create a component with 3 functions A, B, C and 2 exchanges between A-B and B-C
create a functionalChain with the 2 exchanges
create a category with exchange B-C
display this category with the ""Switch Functional Exchanges / Categories"" tool

column1: => the internal arrow in function B is still present and target a FOP without exchange B-C

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1164,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1164,capella,780712082,1164,Inserting a FE on a function moves the other FE inside the function in a xDFB,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T17:12:58Z,2021-01-06T17:13:08Z,"The issue is that all function ports and associated functional exchanges are redrawn when a new is added in a special case described below:
- Create the following functions F1 owning F11, F12 and F13, and create another function F2 in a SDFB display all that functions, then link F1 to F2, F11 to F12, F12 to F13, F13 to F11
- Now click on the palette tool ""insert/remove functions"", and click in the diagram, select F2
=> F2 is removed from the diagram and the display of other elements is unchanged.
- Now click on the palette tool ""insert/remove functional exchanges"" and select the link between F1 and F2
=> F2 is added to the diagram and the display of other functional exchanges and function ports is modified.
Normally only the new added elements should be selected.
ICO file with 6 icons in it

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1166,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1166,capella,780712356,1166,Add possibility to hide an event kind on state machine diagram.,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T17:13:24Z,2021-01-06T17:13:26Z,"![hide_event_kind.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280954.png)

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1167,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1167,capella,780712481,1167,[xDFB] Cannot show Applied PropertyValueGroup if the group is a child of the applying function,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T17:13:34Z,2021-01-06T17:13:43Z,"When a Function in an xFDB diagram applies a PropertyValueGroup and that PropertyValueGroup is a child of the function, the PropertyValueGroup is not shown on the Diagram after the PropertyValueGroup is selected with the AppliedPropertyValueGroups tool.

This is caused by a RefreshExtension specific to xFDB diagrams. The extension moves the PropertyValueGroup graphical element into the function graphical element. A guard must be placed here: PropertyValueGroup elements shouldn't ever be moved around by that refresh extension.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1170,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1170,capella,780712917,1170,Improve performances on refresh of diagrams,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T17:14:12Z,2021-01-06T17:14:13Z,"Performances on diagram refreshes can be improved. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1177,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1177,capella,780713880,1177,Function border is always in dashed and italic when the inserted parent is allocated too and has more than one child not allocated,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T17:15:32Z,2021-01-06T17:15:40Z,"UseCase 1: A function allocated to 2 components is dashed even if the function if displayed on an allocated component.
UseCase 2: A function with 2 sub-functions but only one sub-function allocated. The parent function border is dashed.
Function border should be dashed only in the specified use cases :
- ALL its leaf sub-functions are allocated to cpnt/sub-cpnt.
- Function is not allocated directly to the displayed component
> I reopened this bug since there is the following regression compared to 1.2.0:
> - An allocated function with all of its leaves allocated to a component has solid border style instead of dash style.
> - On the other hand, an allocated function with all of its leaves allocated to a sub-component has dash border style instead of solid style.
> you shall not have reopened the issue but create a child.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1191,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1191,capella,780715757,1191,Copy-Paste of DiagramElement from a diagram to a different kind of diagram is not forbidden,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T17:18:09Z,2021-01-06T17:18:16Z,"I can copy, for example, a system function from a SDFB (functions are containers) or from a SAB (functions are nodes) to a diagram of different type like

serialized in the .aird, and you can found it in the ownedDiagramElements of the representation (use <% self.ownedDiagramElements() %> expression in
the Sirius interpreter view on a representation).

- Create a SystemFunction in the SDFB
- Ctrl+C on it, then Ctrl+V on the CDB => the container appears 1 second at the top-left of the CDB and disappears.
Now open the Sirius interpreter view, write this expression <% self.ownedDiagramElements() %>, and click on the diagram => A container called
SystemFunction 1_1"" is present and should not.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1208,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1208,capella,780718020,1208,Use new Sirius capability to automatically launch a refresh on Collapse/Uncollapse of compartment in FCD diagram,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-06T17:21:39Z,2021-01-06T17:21:47Z,"Currently, there is a problem in FCD diagram for the edges bewteen LogicalFunction or FuncionalChain after collapsed or uncollapsed the compartment of the FunctionalChain.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1231,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1231,capella,780721018,1231,Copy/paste in diagram and reopen session does not show the same result,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T17:26:08Z,2021-01-06T17:26:11Z,"Open a PAB diagram
Create a node PC with deploy behavior pc inside (PC1 and PC2)

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1232,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1232,capella,780721123,1232,Enabling of Mode/State mixed hierarchy affects creation of new states on Mode Machine,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T17:26:18Z,2021-01-06T17:26:21Z,"Attachment: [Scenario.docx](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280959.docx)

With the option 'Mode/State mixed hierarchy allowed' checked in Preferences->Capella->Model, a few issues arise when adding a new State to a Mode & States Diagram which already has created modes added to it.
-New States can only be created within a mode and not outside a mode

-Although new states can only be created within a mode, states created within a mode can be dragged outside of a mode to be a separate entity in the diagram. This occasionally creates a second instance of the State within a mode, and the dragged State remaining outside of the mode.
-Occasionally deleting a created state from the model does not always work and it leaves a 'null' box behind which only disappears from the diagram after a refresh
-Occasionally dragging a State back into a mode creates a second instance of the State

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1233,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1233,capella,780721234,1233,problem on functionnal chain diagram using PVMT view on functionnal exchanges (CAPELLA 1.3.1),eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-06T17:26:28Z,2024-10-22T11:45:26Z,"![PVMT problem on functionnal exchange in functionnal chain diagram CAPELLA V1.3.1.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280960.png)

In Capella 0.8.0, after launching a comparison between two .aird, if the user perform a merge trying to modify a .melodymodeller WITH no opened Sirius's session on this .melodymodeller, THEN the merge fails. There's no error message displayed but the user can see that the selected differences have not been merged. The Diff/Merge editor still operates normally except the fact that the problem appears again if the user tries a similar merge and the Diff/Merge editor is marked as DIRTY if it wasn't already.
Before launching Diff/Merge, open a session on the models that will be modify by this merge.
The problem comes from an exception thrown at line 56 in:
org.eclipse.emf.transaction.RollbackException: This element is part of a library configured with read-only access policy.
At a rough guess, it's an integration problem between Diff/Merge and libraries. This problem occurred after an evolution of the aforementioned libraries.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1266,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1266,capella,781134986,1266,Diffmerge on a modal window lead to invalid selection on Capella Project Explorer,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:38:07Z,2021-01-07T08:38:15Z,"Diffmerge viewer, when used in a modal window doesn't handle selection properly.
- It modify the selection provider of the active part, (mainly capella project explorer), and doesn't restore it after closing the modal window.
- When closing the modal window, it reset the selection of the active part to 'empty', leading to inconsistent context menu actions when clicking on the same selection prior the modal window opening.

=> Context menu shall be properly registered

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1268,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1268,capella,781135219,1268,Last comparison parameters not taken into account,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:38:31Z,2021-01-07T08:38:38Z,"If a comparison is configured with non-default parameters (e.g., ignore IDs), when the comparison is restarted or a new comparison is started then those parameters are lost.
This is a regression as a consequence of [POLARSYS-2030](https://github.com/search?q=POLARSYS-2030&type=Issues).
> In order for the fix to be simple, the following issue has been raised in EMF Diff/Merge:
> [ECLIPSE-539921](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-539921&type=Issues) - Support defining a default configurator in comparison methods

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1269,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1269,capella,781135336,1269,[PERFORMANCE] Diff/Merge performance regression when session is open and Properties view is active,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T08:38:42Z,2021-01-07T08:38:48Z,"Reproduction scenario:
- Import the EOLE sample model, copy/paste it to EOLE2.
- Open an EOLE2 diagram and make a few changes.
- Click the Properties view to make it visible and select an element in the diagram so the view is refreshed.
- With EOLE2 still open and EOLE not open, start a diff/merge with default settings between the two .aird files.
- The computation of the comparison takes far longer than usual.
Note that this can be avoided by closing the Properties view before starting the diff computation.

> At first sight, I can't remember a recent change in the diff/merge that could be the cause. I would expect a change either in the Capella Properties mechanisms or in the way Sirius handles resources to be a more probable cause.
> The state of the workbench when the issue occurs leads to the following observations.

> 1. On the Sirius/infra side: When the diff/merge attempts to load the resources of EOLE (not EOLE2, which is already loaded), the construction of the model at load time leads to the production of a lot of notifications that are sent to the TransactionChangeRecorder.

> 2. On the Properties view side: a CapellaDataListenerForPropertySections reacts to every SET notification that is sent due to the loading of the EOLE model, and it consequently refreshes the view and its label provider every time.

> At first sight, behavior 2. seems to have been thought for situations where only a few fine-grained user actions are performed, not a batch of modifications. (Btw, I wonder how that behaves when a Transition is carried out.)
> The patch mentioned above fixes the issue. It refines behavior 2. by excluding the case where the notification comes from a resource that is being loaded.

> It may still be worth investigating how the diff/merge tool could temporarily stop notifications from resources that are being loaded by the diff/merge. It would prevent similar issues from happening again and reduce the dependencies between the diff/merge tool and other technological components.

> Shall this be marked as resolved?","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTk3MDc3OA==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1303,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1303,capella,781139340,1303,Dynamic validation rule documentation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T08:45:30Z,2021-01-07T08:45:36Z,"AFAIU at the moment, the documentaiton for a validation rule is exactly the same text as the descriptor text of the rule. In this case, it might be possible to generate documentation for rules at runtime by using these extension points.
One would just read out the available constraints and generate content based on that.

For quickfixes, I think this would work most of the time since most quickfixes are bound directly to a specific rule, so we can just read the quickfix registry to tell if a rule has a quickfix or not, but some fixes are calculated dynamically, in which case it's not possible to know in advance if a given rule has a qf or not.
> This was implemented for cybersecurity validation rules, but blocked because:
> Validation rules documentation must be available as static html, bc Thales needs these internally. Looks like they dont know how to run the eclipse help server propertly...
> Anyhow, if someone decides to pick this up in the future, can look at this commit here, showing how it could and should be done:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1304,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1304,capella,781139460,1304,Keep models used for documentation/screenshots,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T08:45:42Z,2021-01-07T08:45:44Z,"I have to update a few screenshots after adding a new UI element. Now, it's a PITA, because I have to recreate the model that's used in the current screenshot. If that model was kept somewhere in git, this would be much less work.
Maybe we can add some metadata to the wikitxt screenshots, indicating which model the screenshot came from.
It's not possible to select destination folder for generated documentation, thus it's not possible to generate the documentation at all. Screenshot attached.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1319,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1319,capella,781141086,1319,SVG images in the Help section are sometimes not displayed,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:48:33Z,2021-01-07T08:48:41Z,"SVG images in the Help section are sometimes not displayed.
In the new Eclipse 2019-06 version the icons in the Help section have been converted to svg (previously gif).
On some machines the internal Eclipse browser passes into compatibility mode when opened, emulating a older version of the browser that may not support SVG images.
- The user has IE 11 installed on his system.
- The internal browser of Eclipse goes into compatibility mode and switches to IE7 for a unknown reason, leading to SVG images not being able to be displayed.
The solution is to thus open the Help section in a external browser.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1321,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1321,capella,781141305,1321,[Documentation] Remove the Part Reusage Tool from Interfaces related Diagrams,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:48:54Z,2021-01-07T08:49:02Z,"![fig-01.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280965.png)
zip file contains 2 jar files to import
One small inadvertence was detected in Capella Documentation, related to diagrams for interfaces (i.e. Contextual Component External/Internal Interfaces).

While the documentation states that the palette tools inventory should contain a part reuse deployment tool (check fig-01), the effective behavior of Capella is to not show this kind of tool (check fig-02). This is due to the fact that interface diagrams work with types, not parts.
So we are going to align the documentation with the de facto status, thus removing the reuse part tools mentions from the online help.
> Added up a snapshot of the effective behvior of the Diagram Palette Tool
When submitting a reply or creating a new topic, I have to wait for moderation or other ""users"" to mark this change as of interest in order to be published.
As a committer on the project, could I be able to bypass this step?
I need to enrich the community around Capella so the forum is one of the major means of use for me.
Note: the forum address for Capella:
We currently have a developers mailing list dedicated to frequently asked questions, announcements, and so on.
I would like to request a private mailing-list (user) for exploitation, methodology questions, and so on.
> Sorry, I meant ""private"" in the sense it will differentiate from current developers mailing list. But of course it is public.
> Sounds good. Let's call it capella-user.
> Any news? Has the mailing-list ""user"" been created?

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1336,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1336,capella,781142991,1336,Provides an automatic check to prevent inter-model dependency violation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:51:48Z,2021-01-07T08:51:56Z,"Capella shall provide an automatic check when the model is modified so that no references between objects are created if they violate the library dependency graph.
- We have a project P that references a library L,
- we have two classes A and B in project P and there is one association from A to B.
In that context, the check should prevent the user to move A in L because no references can be created from L to P.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1337,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1337,capella,781143091,1337,Provides a validation rule to detect inter-model dependency violations and inter-model cycles,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:51:59Z,2021-01-07T08:52:08Z,"Capella shall provide a validation rule to detect inter-model dependency violations and inter-model cycles.
For instance, let say we have:
- a project P that references a library L,
- two classes A, B in project P
- one class C in library L
- three associations A->B, B->C and C->A.
In that context, the validation rule should detect that:
- there is a inter-model dependency violation on the association C->A
- there is a inter-model cycle {A, B, C}

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1342,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1342,capella,781143691,1342,Testability issue due to creation of async GUI jobs during session state changes,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:53:00Z,2021-01-07T08:53:09Z,"When a session is closed, some listeners create async GUI jobs to properly update the GUI.

For instance, NavigatorSessionManagerListener is a session listener. It reacts to session state changes by creating async GUI jobs to refresh the navigator (for instance call of ""refreshViewer"" in ""notify"" method). But some of these jobs take as a parameter the session whose the state has changed. As a result, closed sessions are kept in memory until these async GUI job are executed.
In normal use cases, these GUI jobs are executed just after the user close the session.

However, in the test framework, playing test suites means opening and closing session very speedly. A lot of these GUI threads are queued and the thread manager promotes the main JUnit thread and does not give them a chance to execute periodically (they are all executed once the JUnit thread ends). Therefore, sessions are not flushed from the memory and the JUnit thread stop by rising an ""out of memory"" or ""java heap space"" exception when lot of different test models are used by executed test cases.

> done by adding an active waiter (loop that ends when all GUI thread have finished their work). That's a patch. The perfect solution should be to not create async thread in GUI but there are to much work to do for that purpose now.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTk3NzUwOQ==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

Patch applied until [POLARSYS-261](https://github.com/search?q=POLARSYS-261&type=Issues) is solved.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1352,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1352,capella,781146261,1352,Promote a component in a library,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T08:57:12Z,2021-01-07T08:57:14Z,"The normal process of implementation of REC / RPL recommends the use of a library for ""storing"" the REC, in order to be instantiated in cappella projects via RPLs. But in a conventional process modeling, we model first the non-redundant system, then we integrate to it the redundance by duplicating some of these components.

If you follow the REC / RPL recommended process management , we are forced to recreate all the elements that we want duplicate in the library project,  create REC from those elements, delete this same element in the model, then instatiate twice the REC from the library in the model.
One way to speed up this modeling step would be:
â—¾ promote a group of architectural elements of a Capella project in a Cappella Library,
â—¾automatically create the REC in the library
â—¾and automatically replace the elements in the source model by the first instance of the RPL form the new REC

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1353,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1353,capella,781146382,1353,Decomposition of actors as sub-actors,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:57:23Z,2021-01-07T08:57:32Z,"Currently capella does not break down actors as ""sub-actors"", which in some cases forced to skew the model. For example, through modeling of launcher avionics, we need to model the interfaces between electrical system (which is a part of avionic) and the upper stage engine (which is part of the sub-propulsion system of the launcher).
If we apply the ARCADIA methodology implemented in capella, we can only have one level of decomposition for the engine, for all the allocated functions of this engine.
But in our model we would be able to handle interfaces with it in more details, because we know this actor (the engine) since it is already developed.
Today the recommended solution is to integrate some of the actor in our system.
In conclusion, the need is to decompose actors as ""sub-actors"" in order to improve the level of description for the interfaces between the system and the actors.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1365,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1365,capella,781147804,1365,[groovy] Allow scripts to use java libraries,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:59:39Z,2021-01-07T08:59:47Z,"It should be possible to add/reference .jar libraries for use in a script.
I will commit a solution that works as follows:
The user puts the script which needs access to a library into a Java project and adds the library to the project build path using ordinary JDT operations.
The capella groovy launcher will then register these libraries with its its internal classloader so that it can load the library classes.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1366,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1366,capella,781147917,1366,Merge of Basic VP from branch master to v1.0.x,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T08:59:50Z,2021-01-07T08:59:59Z,"Merge of following corrections to branch v1.0.x

I am writing a test case for an addon validation rule. I inherit from ValidationRuleTestCase and would like to check that a 'valid' model element is not incorrectly flagged as 'invalid' by my rule. However this isn't possible since Line [144..146]
assertTrue(""Validation rule "" + ruleID + "" has not detected an error on object "" + objectID + "" while it must be the case"", false); //$NON-NLS-1$ //$NON-NLS-2$ //$NON-NLS-3$
So you essentially cannot pass 0 as the expected error count on an OracleDefinitionCase, which means the base class is not suitable to test for false positives.
Also, there are lots of these: assertTrue(..., false). While that looks funny, note that junit has a 'fail' method which does the same.
PS: Please add a ""Test Framework"" component so we can file these bugs separately
> I have searched for cases with OracleDefinitions with nbErrors = 0 in existing capella tests, and only found one:

> Strangely this test passes. So I checked why: The test actually uses a ""scope"" to limit the validation to some subtree. It turns out that the objects for which nbError is expected 0 are never validated because of that limited scope. That means the test definition is not sound.

> To avoid inconsistencies like the one above, there should be some crosscheck that objects that are in the oracle definition of a test have actually been validated by the test. If that's not the case, the test should fail.
> > Also, there are lots of these: assertTrue(..., false). While that looks
> > funny, note that junit has a 'fail' method which does the same.
> I just see that this is corrected in the master branch.
> *** [POLARSYS-1452](https://github.com/search?q=POLARSYS-1452&type=Issues) has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1375,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1375,capella,781148972,1375,Test framework: Allow multiple test methods per test class,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T09:01:35Z,2021-01-07T09:01:37Z,"JUnit, the base of capella test framework has always allowed multiple test methods in a single test class.

Why does the Capella test framework remove this possibility? We really should _enhance_ the JUnit base framework and allow this also in capella. The tests are cluttered with tons of anonymous classes because of this. Each of these anonymous test classes should really be a test _method_.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1376,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1376,capella,781149072,1376,Bad handling of cross references in some cases,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:01:45Z,2021-01-07T09:01:53Z,"The Capella cross referencer CapellaECrossReferenceAdapter assumes that attachment/detachment notification it receive are always in the wanted order.
This means that when an we do a detachment of an EObject followed by an attachment, we will have a REMOVE notification followed by an ADD notification.

With the current code, if the order of the notifications is inverted, we will remove all cross references of the target object by handling the remove notification lastly whereas we should not have remove these. (org.polarsys.capella.core.model.handler.crossreferencer.CapellaECrossReferenceAdapter.handleContainment(Notification) we check only that (null != oldValue) that will be true in case the ADD notification comes first )
This can be problematic when Capella is used in a context were notification order are not guaranteed like in Capella team with a CDO environment.
We should check the oldValue has not an eContainer to do the removal because it means no Add notification on this EObject has been done previously.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1384,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1384,capella,781150193,1384,Move to Java 8 as minimum BREE on org.polarsys.capella.common,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:03:29Z,2021-01-07T09:03:38Z,"The target for Capella 1.2.0 is Eclipse Neon. Java 8 is necessary for launching Eclipse Neon. So I think, that the BREE must be move to Java 8 for Capella (as it was done for Sirius: [ECLIPSE-495701)](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-495701)&type=Issues)
Furthermore, this avoids potential compilation problems, with Guava for example.
> Hi, I currently get several compilation errors due to the 1.7 BREE.
> > The type java.util.function.Predicate cannot be resolved.
> > It is indirectly referenced from required .class files
> I get the same in org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.analysis.CsServices and other classes  using the Guava class Predicate.
> Note that I have several installed JREs (1.6, 1.7, 1.8) and so Eclipse takes the 'perfect match' for each execution environment.
> A possible workround is to force the default JRE to be Java 1.8 for each execution environment

> Why I don't see these compilation errors in my IDE? How do our target platforms differ? For plugin org.polarsys.capella.common.linkedtext.ui which requires java 1.7, its guava dependency gets resolved to com.google.guava_15.0.0.v201403281430 and that compiles fine.
> I am using the setup/oomph based environment for capella, so maybe something is off here?

> I have a compilation error in the class org.polarsys.capella.common.helpers.transaction.ContainmentTreeListener (commit https://git.polarsys.org/c/capella/capella.git/commit/?h=v1.2.x&id=8681f76edf50f8a179a0f4fa69a9b7c9724fb68f) because of the Map.putIfAbsent method which does not exist in Java 1.7.
> This error is visible if a 1.7 JRE is used for JavaSE-1.7 execution environment (and not a 1.8 JRE to compile Java 1.7).
> Ouch, that would be me. Will fix asap, sorry.
> Florian, I didn't even know I could have several different BREE mappings active at the same time in the IDE. So your idea is to just bump the BREE for all capella plugins at once?
> > Florian, I didn't even know I could have several different BREE mappings
> > active at the same time in the IDE. So your idea is to just bump the BREE
> > for all capella plugins at once?
> Yes, I think that would be a good idea. As Laurent remarked, Capella 1.2.0 will indirectly depend on Java 1.8 anyway.
> I reopen this issue as I see several plugin with Java 1.7 in their .classpath file:
> I also see several BREE which are set to Java 8 and which make me have several Compilation errors as described in previous comments.

> See for example org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.analysis (searching ""Bundle-RequiredExecutionEnvironment: JavaSE-1.7"" returns more than 150 org.polarsys... plugins on master and capella v1.2.x branches)
> Same amount of plugins if you look for 1.7 in .classpath files.
> Fix merged on 1.2.1 is covering only common/plugins/org.polarsys.capella.common plugin.
> Since there is many other plugins not covered by the fix on this version (about 150), a new ticket covering all other plugins has been created:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1396,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1396,capella,781151660,1396,Adding Mass Editing and Mass Visualization capabilities to Capella,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:05:50Z,2021-01-07T09:05:58Z,"Integration and customization of the Mass Editing and Mass Visualization components for Capella.
A description regarding the core features of these components is available at the following URL: [POLARSYS-2123](https://github.com/search?q=POLARSYS-2123&type=Issues)
A new column provider enabling the edition of ""single"" and ""many"" references is added for the Mass Editing component. The editing logic is based on the business query mechanism.
A new column provider for Semantic Browser queries is added for the Mass Visualization component.
Both components are synchronized with the Properties view and other existing components (Semantic Browser, etc ...)
Send to"" menus for Project explorer elements and diagram elements are also included.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1397,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1397,capella,781151782,1397,Uniqueness of property sections IDs,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:06:01Z,2021-01-07T09:06:09Z,"EEF 2.x has a bug related to sections of Property tabs (see  [ECLIPSE-537506)](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-537506)&type=Issues)
EEF 2.x will display all Property sections with the ID ""MySection"" in the tab ""MyTab"" even if the section comes from another contributor (e.g. Capella, Sirius Diagram, Sirius Table).

So, when EEF 2.x is installed along with Capella, the sections ""Management"", ""Description"", ""Extensions"" and ""Base"" display their sections three times (one for each contributor (Capella, Sirius Diagram, Sirius Table)).
It is possible to avoid that by making unique the IDs of the sections.
> I will provide a contribution soon to handle this problem.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1405,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1405,capella,781152759,1405,Reimplementation for Capella Search and Replace,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:07:35Z,2021-01-07T09:07:43Z,"As the current Search and Replace in Capella is not implemented by using Search extensions provided by Eclipse workbench, this feature is hence not coherent with the workbench and is not easy to use.
In this ticket, I propose to re-implement the search and replace by using Search extensions provided by Eclipse workbench.
- Use the Search extions to implement Capella search page and Capella search result page.
- 2 search modes: Containing text or matching regular expression.
- 3 search fields by default: Name, Summary (not for representations) and Description
- Search on all Capella elements and Representations
- Possibility to select projects to search: propose only opened Capella projects with opening session
- Ability to replace matched text by other text: Replace button
- Search in background: allow users to do others things while searching
- Replace in foreground: not allow users to do anything while replacing
- Results of a search must be visualized in the same Search view as others searches
- Group matched occurrences by project and element
- Highlight matched occurrences in the line containing it
- Ability to filter out matched occurrences: Filter by Capella Element, Filter by Representations, Filter by Not Modifiable elements (Locked elements)
- Ability to navigate matched elements from Search view to others Capella views
- Ability to navigate elements from others Capella views to Search view
- Ability to select certain matched occurrences to perform replace

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1412,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1412,capella,781153583,1412,Bad library resources loaded in CapellaWorkspaceProvider,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:08:53Z,2021-01-07T09:09:01Z,"In Capella, we have a LibraryManager. It is responsible to collect all available Libaries and Projects.

To collect Libraries/Projects it delegates to the CapellaWorkspaceProvider class (which extends AbstractCapellaProvider). This class has a light EditingDomain to manage library references directly available in the Workspace.
If another AbstractCapellaProvider is contributed, its resources are loaded in the  CapellaWorkspaceProvider though they should not.
=> Do not load resources not handled by the CapellaWorkspaceProvider , using the isHandled method.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1413,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1413,capella,781153705,1413,CapellaWorkspaceProvider should provide API to test if an EditingDomain is the WorkspaceDomain,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:09:05Z,2021-01-07T09:09:13Z,"I would like to iterate over all EditingDomains via ExecutionManagerRegistry.getInstance().getAllEditingDomains(). Now this includes the editing domain created in the CapellaWorkspaceProvider class which I am not interested in.
I've seen that this domain has a special ID, so I would just check the ID to skip over it, but it would be good to have an API available for this check:

But still, this is cumbersome.. I would have thought that the EditingDomains returned by ExecutionManagerRegistry would correspond to the opened capella projects in the workspace, not some temporary helper domain. Couldn't you just create the domain without registering it with the global registry?

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1415,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1415,capella,781153939,1415,"Library bug detachement of PC, Behavior and function",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T09:09:27Z,2021-01-07T09:09:32Z,"![Semantic browser Library break PC+BC+Function.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280974.png)
I work with Capella for about 6 months. I have to perform modeling of migration. So I opted for the following method:
All components constituting the five projects are created in the library with REC, the RPL are them in projects.

After 4 months of work, the library no longer works. The physical components in the library are detached behavioral components and functions. Except that these components constitute the REC of all components in the related projects.
The semantic browser presents the REC component as being non-existent (see pictures attached)
However RPL in projects normally and allocations are still valid (PC ==> Components Behavior ==> Functions).
The semantic browser presents the RPL component as being existing (see attached pictures) and shows all its exchanges.
However even opening safeguards that were damaged, I still had the same problem.
Start from 0 would be very difficult given what is working 4 months.
> Is it possible to attach the models to this bugzilla ?
> Or to send it to me by email ?

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1423,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1423,capella,781154841,1423,REC-elements from a Library can not be used with a fragmented Capella-Model,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T09:10:52Z,2021-01-07T09:10:58Z,"![ReplicableElements2.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280975.png)
After the fragmentation of a Capella-Model it is not possible to use REC-elements from a library in the Model (no problem with unfragmented model).

After the fragmentation of the model (5 fragments: OA, SA, LA, PA, EPBS) some elements of the REC (Functions and FunctionalExchanges) become orange and there is no project explorer on the right side of the instantiation-dialog to assign the elements to a location.
> The behaviour outlined above was when the REC was created in the library.
> The other way round - creating the REC in the fragmented model and try to save the REC in the library - I get an ""error while saving session"".
> Can you describe your ""steps to reproduce"" please?
> Bind the Library to the Model (Lib must be writeable!)
> Build a small ""part"" e.g. a Component with 2 Functions and a FunctionalExchange.
> Select the ""part"" and -> ""Create REC from selection""
> Try to save the REC in the REC-Catalog of the Library and try to save the Model & Library:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1428,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1428,capella,781155431,1428,[Move Elements] Allow force move of elements even if validation fails,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:11:48Z,2021-01-07T09:11:56Z,"When elements are moved via the transfer view, a validation checks if incoming/outgoing references to the moved elements are still valid. The purpose of that is to see if an element in a project can reference an element in a library. The rule however also reports problems that have nothing to do with the element being in a library or not, e.g. If Class A has a Property b of type C, and C isn't primitive, an error is reported. Users will still want to move the element in spite of that error. To allow that, the errors must be shown in a dialog and the user has the final say on whether the move should be canceled or not.

A class A has a property b of type C, and C is not primitive. When C is moved, to a library, an error is reported: C cannot be referenced. However, this error has nothing to do with the fact that C is in a library or not.
We need to add some information/layered approach to whether a reference source-ref-target is ok if source and target are in different models.
I still have no idea how to best do this.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1438,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1438,capella,781156673,1438,All capella projects should be usable as libraries,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T09:13:45Z,2021-01-07T09:13:48Z,"Quite often the forum question comes up: I have a project, but I actually want a library. To convert a project into a library there is no usable tool: One has to replace the toplevel type of the project. It should be easier to have a project behave like a library, i.e. it should be possible to reference the project as a library. My ideas:
1) A project is a library is a project. No distinction at all.
2) A project is a library if it has a certain property value tag (similar to what was used for multipart projects). This way, a user can 'convert' a project into a library quite easily.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1443,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1443,capella,781157211,1443,[DWF_DS_20] Functions shall be considered as allocated if all their subfunctions are allocated.,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:14:39Z,2021-01-07T09:14:47Z,"To summarize:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1444,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1444,capella,781157318,1444,Updates on validation rules,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:14:51Z,2021-01-07T09:14:59Z,"Validation rules shall be updated in order to ensure:

> WARNING: this patchset contains 3053 new lines of code and may require a Contribution Questionnaire (CQ) if the author is not a committer on the project. Please see:https://wiki.eclipse.org/Project_Management_Infrastructure/Creating_A_Contribution_Questionnaire
In a class, when a property or an association role is part of key, value of maximum cardinality must be equal to one.
Value of maximum cardinality must be set to 1 in {0} for property/role {1} (property/role is part of key).
{0} = Class (respectively association if class does not owns the role) name
a key part may be a property or an association role owned by the class.
In class property, association role and exchange item element, maximum cardinality value is defined and, unless abstract, evals to a value in [1, *[.
Value of maximum cardinality, unless abstract, must eval to a natural number in {0} for property/role/element {1}.
{0} = Class (respectively Association if class does not owns the role/ExchangeItem) name
A datavalue is a natural iff:
It has no type or its type is of NumericType with kind=INTEGER and its actual value (as a string) is such that Integer.parseInt() returns an integer greater or equals 1.
In class property, association role and exchange item element minimum cardinality value is defined and, unless abstract, evals to a natural or zero (i.e. integer belonging to [0, *[).
Value of minimum cardinality, unless abstract, must be eval 0 or a natural number in {0} for property/role/element {1}.
{0} = Class (respectively Association if class does not owns the role/ExchangeItem) name
For a property, type of the default (resp. null) value shall be Undefined (implicit typing) or the propertyâ€™s datatype or a super type of the propertyâ€™s datatype.
Type of {0} value of property {1} in class {2} is inconsistent with its type.
{default | null} depending of the feature under check.
A property/role in a class shall not have the same name as a property/role of a super-class.
In class {0} property {1} has a same name as a property of super class {2}.
If class K inherits class C, if property or association role is owned by C with type/class A and redefined in K with type/class B, then B inherits (or is equal to) A.
In class {0} property {1} overrides that of super class {2} with a wrong type.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1452,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1452,capella,781160767,1452,Problem while switching between validation profiles,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:20:25Z,2021-01-07T09:20:34Z,"Steps to reproduce:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1459,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1459,capella,781161611,1459,Validation traversal should be customisable,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T09:21:44Z,2021-04-01T11:47:30Z,"When a component is validated on a diagram, one would expect that the component's allocated functions and its exchanges are also validated, but this is not the case. This is because the capella validation traverses only the content tree of selected elements, and allocated functions are not in the content tree of the allocating component.
There are probably many more such 'semantic traversal rules' thinkable, for example:
- Validate a component port should also validate the port interfaces.
- One existing rule is already hardcoded into the capella validator: Whenever a Part is validated, the Parts component is also validated (or was it the other way round, not sure..)
I don't think a fixed set of rules would ever be able to satisfy everyones needs, so I wonder if we can make these traversal rules customizeable.
> Yes, I like this idea. it could be useful in many other use cases.

> I imagine that a customizeable / extensible validator could be provided in the constructor of the class ""org.polarsys.capella.core.validation.EValidatorAdapter"" instead of the default batch validator.

> If a component is validated, all its deployed children must also be validated. (I'm quite surprised this isn't even hardcoded)","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NTk5Mjg2Mw==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1460,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1460,capella,781161720,1460,DCOM_13 add port and function name to validation result and split result into two lines,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T09:21:56Z,2021-01-07T09:21:57Z,"Current result text is:
FE_3 (Function Exchange) conveys some Exchange Items which are not allocated to its source (EI_XX) and/or its target port (EI_XX)
It would be good to show the name of the input/output ports and their associated functions, like this:
FE_3 (Function Exchange) conveys EI_XX (Exchange Items) which are not allocated to its source port LF1>FOP1 (Function>Port) and/or its target port LF2>FIP

Another idea is to maybe split the result into two lines, one for missing ei on the output port, and one for missing ei on the target port. Or even better have one line with up to two children (one child for EI missing on output, one for EI missing on input). But having two separate lines is maybe confusing good, because the associated quickfix fixes both ports.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1461,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1461,capella,781161795,1461,[Move Elements] Do not allow partial move of elements connected to exchange,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:22:04Z,2021-01-07T09:22:13Z,"The end points of an exchange should always be in the same project. It is not allowed that one end is in project A and the other end in project B.
Can be fixed by adding a business query for exchange source and target features.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1462,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1462,capella,781161947,1462,Validation in scenarios between functional exchange / interaction and function / activity,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T09:22:17Z,2021-01-07T09:22:20Z,"Currently, the sequence in a scenario between a sequence message representing a functional exchange / interaction and a state fragment representing a function / activity is only graphical.
It is proposed to add validation rules to check :
- that a functional exchange represented just after a function is indeed an output of the function
- that a functional exchange represented just before a function is indeed an input of the function
Those validation rules will apply on Exchange Scenarios and on Operational Entities Scenarios

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1471,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1471,capella,781163026,1471,Add QuickFix for EMF error concerning unresolved proxy,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:23:56Z,2021-01-07T09:24:05Z,"If a Capella element references another element in a library (class generalization for example), and you delete it in the library, and you validate your model referencing the library, an EMF error raises ""The feature X contains an unresolved proxy X"".
2) Create a class ""Class Parent"" inside L;
5) Create a class ""Class Child"" in M;
6) Insert ""Class Parent"" and create a generalization from ""Child"" to ""Parent"";
An EMF error appears that concerns an unresolved proxy for the now missing ""Parent"" class and no QuickFix is available for the error.
A QuickFix is available for the error and, when applied, it deletes the Generalization link that has its ""super"" missing.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1472,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1472,capella,781163178,1472,Add a new validation rule and quickfix to detect duplicated Involvement links,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:24:08Z,2021-01-07T09:24:16Z,"Today, an Operational Capability can be involved twice in an Operational Actor without any validation rule to detect.
1) Create an Operational Capabilities Blank (OCB) Diagram;
4) Add an Involvement Link between the Capability and the Actor;
5) From Capella Explorer, copy/paste the Involvement link of the Operational Capability (disable the filter for EntityOperationalCapabilityInvolvement if it  is active).
The duplicate Involvement link is not detected by the validation.
The duplicate Involvement link is detected by the validation rules and a quickfix is available to remove the duplicates.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1473,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1473,capella,781163321,1473,Validation rule + quick fix for EnumerationLiteral elements that are not typed by their parent,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:24:20Z,2021-01-07T09:24:29Z,"If you drag&drop or cut/paste an EnumerationLiteral from an Enumeration to another, the Type of the EnumerationLiteral will not change to match the type of its new parent. This will introduce errors later in other tools and it is an inconsistency that needs to be fixed.
4) From Capella Explorer drag&drop EnumerationLiteral1 to Enumeration2;
5) From Capella Explorer cut/paste EnumerationLiteral2 to Enumeration2;
6) Add another EnumerationLiteral element inside Enumeration1;
7) From Properties change the Abstract Type to null for EnumerationLiteral3;
There will be no errors/warnings present after the validation for EnumerationLiteral1 and EnumerationLiteral2;
Rule DWF_D_35 will show a warning that EnumerationLiteral3 has no type.

A validation rule will show a warning for EnumerationLiteral1 and EnumerationLiteral2 saying that they should be typed by their parent (Enumeration2). A QuickFix will be proposed which, when applied, will change the Abstract Type property of EnumerationLiteral1 and EnumerationLiteral2 to Enumeration2.

Rule DWF_D_35 will no longer be applied to EnumerationLiteral elements, only to EnumerationReferences, because EnumerationReferences must have a type but it is not mandatory for them to have the type of their parent.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1474,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1474,capella,781163440,1474,[Move Elements] Referential validation during move produces duplicated results,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:24:32Z,2021-01-07T09:24:40Z,"When referential validation is executed during a move, some constraint errors appear twice in the result.
If A,B the validation rule checks the:

So a) and d) overlap => Some references are checked twice => Hence the duplicate output. The rule must add a guard so that incoming references for moved elements are only checked if they originate in an element that was not also moved.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1475,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1475,capella,781163569,1475,[Move Elements] Referential constraints batch validation checks elements multiple times,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:24:44Z,2021-01-07T09:24:52Z,"When in batch mode, the referential constraint I_38 will check a single element multiple times:
- The validation framework walks the selection content tree and calls validate() on each element in the tree
- For each validate() call, the rule implementation itself walks the tree too.
The second step must however only be done during live validation to prevent multiple checks on the same element.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1508,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1508,capella,781167786,1508,"Some elements are not displayed correctly in ""Properties"" view, ""Expert"" tab",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:31:02Z,2021-01-07T09:31:10Z,"Problem detected on Capella 1.1.2 (dev) - see build https://hudson.polarsys.org/capella/view/Capella-v1.1.x/job/capella-v1.1.x/175/
2. At SA level, create an IntegerPropertyValue,
3. Apply this IntegerPropertyValue to the RootSystemFunction,
4. Open the ""Properties"" view, ""Expert"" tab and look at the ""Applied Property Values"" field.
=> the IntegerPropertyValue is not displayed as expected: we should have ""IntegerPropertyValue 1 = 0"" (as in the Capella Project Explorer) but we have a technical display.
> The problem occurs when an AdapterFactory has a decorator (see CapellaAdapterFactoryProvider).
> The decorator has a reference to the parent AdapterFactory (in this case the CapellaAdapterFactoryProvider) but the decorated AdapterFactory does not have this reference.
> => So, when it is used, the decorated AdapterFactory can not delegate to its parent.
> The solution is to the set the parent to the decorated AdapterFactory when the parent is set to the decorator.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1511,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1511,capella,781168219,1511,[RichText] Typed text in descirption is lost restarting Eclipse or switching from a model element to Diagram element,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:31:36Z,2021-01-07T09:31:45Z,"Create a new Capella project and create inside it a diagram

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1512,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1512,capella,781168366,1512,Business Queries should not remove current value(s) from available values,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:31:48Z,2021-01-07T09:31:57Z,"To continue works done in [POLARSYS-1878](https://github.com/search?q=POLARSYS-1878&type=Issues)
The business query interface has two methods:
Many implementations remove the current value from the list of available values, so that there is no way to find out if the current value is actually valid according to the query.
=> If the current value is a valid value, it should be included in the available values.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1522,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1522,capella,781169801,1522,Unable to apply property value groups from a library to a PC Node,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T09:33:53Z,2021-01-07T09:33:55Z,"Hi,

I am using a capella library project to predefine property value groups that I wish to recall in other projects once I reference the library in them. I started by creating 2 property value groups in the library, and the group called 'PropertyValueGroup 1' has a property called 'FloatPropertyValue 1' that sits underneath it in the Capella Project Explorer hierarchy i.e it is a child.

I then double clicked on 'PropertyValueGroup 2', navigated to the 'Extension' tab and applied 'FloatPropertyValue 1' to it (i.e the Float property is still a child of 'PropertyValueGroup 1' but it has been applied to 'PropertyValueGroup 2').

I then created a standard Capella project and referenced the library in it. In this standard project, I proceeded to make a PAB diagram and created a single PC Node on the diagram. By double clicking on the node in the diagram and going to the 'Extensions' tab, I tried to apply to it the property value groups which I had earlier defined in the library. However, I found that there were no options to pick from.
Shouldn't the property value groups defined in the library be presenting themselves as options to be applied to the PC Node?

I am able to drag these property value groups from the project explorer to the diagram so that they appear, but cannot seem to apply them to the PC Node. I also noted that 'FloatPropertyValue 1' only appears under 'PropertyValueGroup 1' in the diagram, even though I also applied this float property to 'PropertyValueGroup 2' as I was building the library. Is this meant to happen? (I was expecting the float property to be in the property value group box on the diagram when the float property as been assigned to the group, even if the float property is not a child of the group).

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1525,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1525,capella,781170213,1525,On-the fly attachment of extension objects when editing properties,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:34:28Z,2021-01-07T09:34:36Z,"With eMDE model extensions, the current workflow of setting an extension property (e.g. the Mass or Price of an element) involves 2 steps:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1538,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1538,capella,781172027,1538,RPL phantom Link,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T09:36:59Z,2021-01-07T09:37:05Z,"J'ai conversÃ© avec Philippe DUL et Pierre-Marie PERCHOC car j'Ã©tais bloquÃ© sur les updates des RPLs de mon modÃ¨le, ci-dessous le mail de Philippe rÃ©sumant la situation et la raison de mon ticket. A lâ€™instanciation du RPL, les ports apparaissent alors en jaune, ce qui nâ€™indique pas forcÃ©ment une erreur, mais que lâ€™outil nâ€™a pas rÃ©ussi Ã  placer automatiquement les ports dans un Ã©lÃ©ment.

Il faut alors que tu positionnes les ports dans une fonction de ton modÃ¨le (dragNdrop du port/ligne jaune vers une fonction de la zone droite du wizard) et le port devrait passer en vert, te permettant ainsi de poursuivre lâ€™instanciation.
A la fin du document, tu indiques que si lâ€™on fait un Cancel lors de lâ€™instanciation, un lien â€˜RPLâ€™ erronÃ© apparait dans le semantic browser.
Ce cas est reproductible sur un modÃ¨le simple :

Il sâ€™agit dâ€™un lien â€˜fantÃ´meâ€™, hormis une mauvaise information dans le Semantic browser, il ne devrait pas corrompre ton modÃ¨le (si tu fermes ton modÃ¨le puis le rÃ©ouvre, ce lien disparait du sÃ©mantic browser) Pourrais-tu logguer un ticket sur le bugzilla de Capella ? ""

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1551,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1551,capella,781184960,1551,Conformance Check Rule should consider active filters,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T09:56:27Z,2021-01-07T09:56:36Z,"The conformance check rule for REC/RPL (DCON_02_Rpl2RecConformanceConstraint) does not take active merge filters into consideration.

For a replica of a function rec, which has 'description' set as an unsynchronized feature. If the descriptions of the function differ, the rule reports a conformance warning. However when the replica is updated, no differences are displayed.
In general, the rule should consider and apply the merge filters in the same way as when a 'true' update is performed.

> Incremental mode is no more used when updating RPL from REC or REC from RPL.
> - Create a model, in this model create a SDFB diagram,
> - In the diagram create a SF with 2 child SFs,
> - Create a REC with this SF and its children,
> - Create a RPL using the REC,
> - In the REC delete a child SF,
> - Update the RPL from the REC -> the deleted child must be visible in the Diff/Merge dialog (clik on apply to update the RPL),
> - In the RPL delete a child SG,

> - Update the REC from RPL -> the deleted child must be visible in the Diff/Merge dialog (clik on apply to update the REC).","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NjAxMzAxOQ==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1571,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1571,capella,781187626,1571,Better handling of references to project template elements,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T10:00:25Z,2021-01-07T10:00:31Z,"I create a REC of elements that have references to the project template. For example, a System Capability always has a System Capability Involvement that points back to the System template element.
The rec dialog shows 'REC has references to external elements'.

When I now instantiate the REC in a different Project, I would like to restore the template references so that they reference the corresponding TARGET template elements, not the template elements of the SOURCE (REC) template.

> Another case came up: When a user creates a REC which includes a system port, or any port that's allocated on a 'template component', instantiation should automatically allocate the RPL port on the corresponding target template component.

> Philippe, I am not quite sure, but I think there must be a match policy that identifies template elements as equal, i.e. if one creates two projects and compares these empty projects, all elements should match and the only difference would be the project/system engineering name.
