issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1593,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1593,capella,781190583,1593,Experimental Platform build,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:04:36Z,2021-01-07T10:04:44Z,"It would be interesting to have a Luna based Capella build.
> An evolution is necessary on EGF Build to be able to generate update sites in a directory different from the default one.
> Do you want to produce the juno and the luna version in the same job?
> I was thinking about creating a branch on this subject and have a different job, or even working in a gerrit changeset and using the gerrit job.
> Wouldn't that be easier for now?
> There is some problems with Eclipse Luna and Eclipse Mars.
> Problem 1 - OutOfMemoryError : when Capella is installed, Equinox is not able to resolve Capella bundles
> Problem 2 - Performance problem : if the first point is resolved, then Equinox takes a long time to resolve Capella bundles
> The problem 1 will be fixed in Eclipse Luna SR2.
> Problem 1 and Problem 2 will be fixed in Eclipse Mars M5
> For Capella, the modifications were done here : https://polarsys.org/r/#/c/390/
> Some of them could be integrated directly in the master branch.
> Some others must be reworked and/or integrated only when Capella will switch to Luna/Mars
> partial backport from master branch to 0.8.x

> WARNING: this patchset contains 4557 new lines of code and may require a Contribution Questionnaire (CQ) if the author is not a committer on the project. Please see:https://wiki.eclipse.org/Project_Management_Infrastructure/Creating_A_Contribution_Questionnaire

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1607,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1607,capella,781192311,1607,Part duplication on scenario refinement,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:07:14Z,2021-01-07T10:07:22Z,"Part are duplicated when performing a ""Capability Scenario Refinement"".
1. In SA, create an actor ""Actor 1"" (you can name its part ""Actor 1 Part""),
2. Create an interface ""Interface 1"", add an Exchange Item (Operation) in it, make ""System"" implement the interface and make Actor 1 use it (you can use an IDB to do all these operations easily),
3. Create a capability and an IS in it. Using the IS, create a Sequence Message between ""Actor 1"" and ""System"",
4. Perform an Actor transition (SA -> LA) => in LA, ""Actor 1"" and its part are transitioned,
5. Perform a Capability Scenario Refinement on the IS scenario => in LA, part of ""Actor 1"" is duplicated !

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1642,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1642,capella,781196934,1642,Provide an Oomph Setup model for Capella,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:14:17Z,2021-01-07T10:14:26Z,"I would like to contribute an Oomph setup model to simplify Capella development.
The setup is modular so that one can selectively enable support for:
For people that just want to develop new tooling on top of capella. It just sets the target platform.
This imports the capella sources from either git or gerrit into the workspace

This imports the ""data.def"" projects into the workspace and also installs the required EGF tooling into the IDE. (I would need help with that, since I don't know which EGF version is currently in use to generate the m2)
This imports the official capella addons into the workspace, either from git or gerrit.
> there is still some stuff missing:

> - We would need to find out the best way to maintain the target platform definition in the setup file Ideally the setup needs to be updated whenever you change something in the egf build model changes. I think the best way would really be to aggregate all required repositories into a single ""capella target"" repository so that this aggregated repository would always define the current target platform.
> - I will also try to add the capella tests and import test run configurations
> - Currently, all plugins and features that are included in the org.polarsys.capella.core.advance feature will be imported into the workspace. Are there any other features that need to be imported?
> - Could you tell me the exact version of capella studio that you are currently using for m2 generation? Does it matter which version one uses?

> - Once we are happy with the setup model, we should host it somewhere on the wiki so that everyone can just drag/drop the uri onto the eclipse installer. I will try to make a video that shows how to use it.
> The setup now installs the Capella java formatter profile. With that in place, I have created a demo video that shows how to use the .setup file here:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1643,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1643,capella,781197071,1643,Cannot run documentation generation when using bundle pool,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T10:14:30Z,2021-01-07T10:14:32Z,"The build.xml in capella documentation plugins assumes that all plugins are in ${eclipse.home}/plugins. This is not the case when a bundle pool is used, and that's the default when a developer uses Capella.setup. In this case, ant fails with an error:
[taskdef] Could not load definitions from resource org/eclipse/mylyn/wikitext/core/ant/tasks.properties. It could not be found.
As a workaround, one can set the wikitext.standalone property like this:
But I would like a better solution.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1644,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1644,capella,781197171,1644,Build capella addons with tycho,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T10:14:40Z,2021-01-07T10:14:45Z,"Setup a tycho build hierarchy that allows to build existing and future capella addons.

> now that all addons are in a separate repo, it would be good to have a ""parent"" repository which would contain the parent pom and build stuff for all supported addons/tools. We would do this similarly how it works for the platform-releng-parent of eclipse. I think in the future Capella itself will build with Tycho as well, so we could have a single releng-parent repository for all cappella related builds.
> I will just test this with a repo that I'll set up and share somewhere.
> Jean do you think we can get this done for the 1.1.0 versions?
> So what is the best way to specify a tycho target platform for a capella based ""Addon X"" project? I don't think there is a good way atm. It is:
> Addon X Target = Capella Base Target (capella-rcp.targetdefinition) + Capella Update Site + Addon X specific dependencies

> Ideally I want to list just a single repository in the addons target definition => The capella build should create a composite repository which includes the capella artifacts and references the repositories listed in capella-rcp.targetdefinition.
> Well so almost 4 years later work has started on this..

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1645,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1645,capella,781197266,1645,Update site for Capella 1.1 and future versions,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:14:49Z,2021-01-07T10:14:56Z,"I need this for the capella setup model:
Currently, the only directly p2 consumable update sites for capella are the ones on the hudson builds. Would it be possible to create a composite repo for capella stable versions from version 1.1 on?

Otherwise we would need to tag the release builds in hudson, never delete them and have some really weird urls in the .setup, pointing to specific builds, like you can already see it in the .setup for kitalpha/diffmerge/etc, this is not so nice.
> Or, to be consistent with eclipse, the repo should be somewhere under download.polarsys.org something capella. (Currently download.polarsys.org just reedirects to polarsys.org)

> Any plans on this? Maybe we could get started doing it at least for addons and tools? I can't get my head around why the capella download site lists zipped p2 repositories for addons, but does not offer an update site to install directly? We could even add that update site url to capella builds so users could just ""Install new software..."" to get the addons.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1649,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1649,capella,781210882,1649,Guava versions in build and runtime are different,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:35:46Z,2021-01-07T10:35:54Z,"Gerrit build for 1.1.x https://hudson.polarsys.org/capella/job/capella-gerrit/2570/ fails because:
line 145: The method toList() is undefined for the type FluentIterable<T>

toList() is available in Guava 15. The error suggests that the guava version used in the build target platform is something different. However, the latest Capella 1.1.x build ships with Guava 15! So there is a difference between guava versions t build and runtime!?
Can you please investigate and make sure that these two versions match? I will investigate myself if I can change my code as a workaround but until I find one, this is a blocker for me.
> I reduce severity, because the build succeeds if I set a version requirement for the guava dependency:
> Still, I'd expect that unless I specify a version requirement, code is compiled against the bundle that is present in the final product.

> Guava used is now the one provided by eclipse. no longer use orbit one.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NjAzMzI3NA==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1650,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1650,capella,781211004,1650,Correction of EGF Build for XML Pivot add-on,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:35:58Z,2021-01-07T10:36:07Z,"Current EGF Build generates plugins versions.
It is problematic since when a plugin is updated, the add-on does not work anymore.
Need to remove the plugins versions from the generation.
Identified bug in EGF generation : Modify FCORE and add a return carriage at the end of the file.
The content of the tar.gz file is wrong:
- the main folder should be named ""Capella.app"" and not ""capella""
- the second level folder should be named ""Contents""
- the third level should be made of the folders ""Eclipse"", ""MacOsx"", ""Resources"" and ""samples""
- in ""MacOsx"" the file ""eclipse"" should have the permission ""a+x""
- the file ""eclipse.ini"" should be added in the ""Eclipse"" folder.

> since the version 1.2.0 of Capella, this problemn is solved.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NjAzMzQ3NQ==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1652,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1652,capella,781211312,1652,Investigate unification of capella git repositories,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:36:22Z,2021-01-07T10:36:29Z,"Jean, about about splitting addons in different repositories. I thought this was a good thing before, but I changed my mind..
Would it not simplify everything if we put everything into the main capella.git repo? I dont see any real disadvantages.
Lets just create a folder addons/ in capella.git and put the contents for capella-tools and capella-vp-xyz all in there.
> Advantages for doing this would be:
> + Simplified branch management, no need to maintain a map of branch compatibilities
> I don't think it would be a good idea to put all the add-ons in the same repository as Capella, the add-ons have their own life cycle and it will add more complexity on the version tree.

> In the past, all the add-ons were hosted in the same repository and we finally split them because it was too confusing (e.g: when you are are working on an add-on and you want to merge a given branch into another, you don't want to be confused with conflicts from another add-on).

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1659,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1659,capella,781212191,1659,Avoid building all .target files in all builds,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:37:41Z,2021-01-07T10:37:49Z,"There are 3 (future 4) different target-definition files for capella. For every build, all 3 are transformed into a .target file, even if a single build only needs one out of all 3. Parametrize the .target build so that only the required .target file is created, not all of them.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1667,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1667,capella,781213164,1667,Bundle capella dependencies into features,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T10:39:13Z,2021-01-07T10:39:16Z,"For easier synchronisation of target and setup models, I would like to propose that we create (at least) 2 dedicated features for kitalpha and sirius dependencies. The kitalpha feature would include all dependencies from the kitalpha {} sections in the targetplatform model, and the sirius feature would include all sirius {} dependencies. We can then build these features separately on hudson and simplify the .targetplatform files by referring to these 2 features instead. Changes would be managed in the feature.xml files, and the .targetplatform would rarely have to be touched again. In theory we could even extend this pattern to build a capella-targetplatform-feature which includes all other dependencies.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1668,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1668,capella,781213261,1668,Allows build of viewpoints generated for CDO,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:39:24Z,2021-01-07T10:39:31Z,"This plugin allows to build viewpoints that have been generated for CDO even if
all required dependencies are not generated for CDO (or not available somehow).
For a given genmodel, it retrieve all required genmodels from the running target
platform and generate them for CDO using EGF-CDO patterns
Then it is now possible to build the viewpoint.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1671,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1671,capella,781213654,1671,Test framework: Headless diagram actions should not be registered unless tests are running,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:39:57Z,2021-01-07T10:40:05Z,"When I import the plugin org.polarsys.capella.test.diagram.common.ju into the workspace and run capella from the workspace, many diagram tools do not work any more because the plugin re-registers external java services in sirius by rewriting the extension registry. That itself is a questionable technique, but it's not the concern here. I do not remember having these issues before, so I found that probably this commit
5684cc4617bf5914473a1ac9c916af442c5e10c5 [800] Extend test framework to support headless DAnalysis selector
introduced the breaking change: By registering a session listener, the plugin gets activated and rewrites the registry as soon as a session is opened.

A noninvasive fix would just be to add a guard to the plugins activator that checks for the running application id and only rewrites the registry if that application id is the test runner application.
> Or better do not use the extension point to register the headless analysis selector, but register it programatically in the activator.
> This ticket needs to focus on

> Goal of this ticket was to rewrite registering of headless external java services using Sirius API and not rewriting extension registry.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1678,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1678,capella,781214540,1678,[tests] Add a junit listener to be able to run Junit through command line,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:41:19Z,2021-01-07T10:41:27Z,"Eclipse CI is migrating to Jiro.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1693,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1693,capella,781216474,1693,Allow StateMachines to be contained in different types of container -> transitions must work,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:44:21Z,2021-01-07T10:44:30Z,"Using an addon, we want to allow StateMachines to be contained in various element types (not only Components and classes). In this case, transitions have to work.
> This change breaks a test case in system 2 subsystem addon.
> In general, this change breaks any transition of a state machine where the state machine's owner is excluded from the transition. Here is an example:

> In System2Subsytem/Vertical there is an option to transition State Machines of Parent Components. So when this option is selected all State machnies 'above' PC2 (in this case SM1) should be added to the resulting System Component.
> The best traced container for SM1 will be the System Architecture, but a System Architecture cannot contain a state machine => SM2 is lost.
> Jean, can I submit a hotfix patch to be included for 1.1.0?

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1699,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1699,capella,781217232,1699,"[Transition] Improve ""Merge All""",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:45:31Z,2021-01-07T10:45:40Z,"Diff/Merge is used when you called REC/RPL update commands:
- Update selected RPL from its REC
But regardless of the command used:
- the models are always named ""candidate/resulting model""
- the title of the windows is ""Replicable Elements""
Model names and window title must be renamed according to the command called.
> - ""Merge All"" button must be renamed ""Apply All Changes""
> -  this button must be disabled if there are no differences to merge or if the right model is locked
- Do not use Focus mode by default on transition categories if not necessary.
- The category-based filtering algorithm must be corrected.
- When deleting an element with the REC/RPL mechanism, deleted elements still appear in the right panel.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1726,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1726,capella,781220585,1726,Transition from OA to SA using libraries,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:50:37Z,2021-01-07T10:50:44Z,"Hi, I'm trying to use Capella on a project of mine. I created a new library and when I finished Operational Analysis I tried to use the ""Perform an automated transition from Operational Activities"", but the following error appear to me:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: The Editing Domain must be not null and must be a Transactional one | Error | Transition management | null | Transition management |  | 09:17:10
> I face the same issue on transition from SA to LA.
> 2- Create a SAB, add a function in the system
> 3- Using the Activity explorer > Logical Architecture > Transition from System Functions
>   4.1- Note: ""Apply"" is not selected by default, contrary to Capella 1.3.0. Is that voluntary?
>   4.2- Select the function in the middle panel and transfer it to the right, then click on OK
> 5- The following stack trace appears in the error log:
> Caused by: org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: The Editing Domain must be not null and must be a Transactional one
> Caused by: org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: The Editing Domain must be not null and must be a Transactional one
> Caused by: org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: The Editing Domain must be not null and must be a Transactional one
> it is a known issue, a regression from Capella 1.3.1. It impacts all Capella internal transition for elements located in a library: it will be fixed soon, with a new Capella 1.3.2.

> With Capella 1.4.0, the bug is still present but it is not critical: the transition does not fail, even for libraries. However, the result presented in the diffmerge window in Capella 1.4.0 is not correct: it will be fixed in next Capella 1.4.1.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1741,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1741,capella,781222467,1741,[PERFORMANCE] Information View performance degrades with many log messages,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:53:30Z,2021-01-07T10:53:38Z,"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #117 +++
The capella information view causes the UI to block when lots of markers with element references are created.

The cause of the slowdown is that log markers use uri attributes to link to model elements. For each uri in a marker all session resource sets are searched in order to obtain the corresponding EObject.

Capella validation markers already reference model elements directly via an embedded EMF Diagnostic object, so why not apply this method also to log markers? Markers would already carry the referenced objects and no search is done at all.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1743,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1743,capella,781222706,1743,Avoid Concurrent Transaction through ProjectExplorer on reloaded resource event,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T10:53:53Z,2021-01-07T10:54:02Z,"UC:
- Create a function in diagram blank
- Replace the fragment folder's content with topaste's content
- An error occurs ""Transaction aborted due to concurrent write""

This error is triggered when a thread open a transaction while the transaction reloading the resource. One of cases is when the projectExplorer refresh the content of the session while the session is reloaded.
I create a new Operational capabilities diagram thanks to the capella overview and i want to filter the diagrams viewer.

For this i use the link button on Define Operation Entities and Capabilities section. But in the diagram viewer i only see the Operational Entity Breakdown and operational Architecture blank (I expected to see the OCB, not OAB)
Given two instances B1 and B2 connected to an instance A, the semantic browser shows the two B's when focused on A.
Let's navigate to B1 with F9 or double-click, then back to A with the history left arrow button. No trouble, we're back to A.
At this point, the back button goes to B1 instead of A !
This problem arises because the history stack is not updated correctly when adding a new element. The forward history shall be reset before starting a new forward navigation.
I have a patch ready to be submitted.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1760,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1760,capella,781225723,1760,"Select Diagram in Project Explorer when ""Link with Editor"" is enabled loses Project Explorer Focus",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T10:58:40Z,2021-01-07T10:58:43Z,"When the ""Link with Editor"" function is enabled in the Capella Project explorer, the explorer loses focus when an opened diagram is selected in the explorer. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1797,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1797,capella,781230293,1797,Ability to move elements into a library,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:05:46Z,2021-01-07T11:05:55Z,"It should be possible to move model elements from a project/library into a used library. Moving an element should however never introduce a reference from a library to a project. Also, there are semantic rules that are hard to validate before the element was actually moved: E.g. a library function cannot be deployed by a component in a project that uses the library.
> Support for moving a REC Catalog items into a Library project would be desirable.
> The Author creates a project. Example a Medium-Range Radar Physical Model and all supporting models.
> The Author gets the module reviewed and approved and creates a REC. It is visible in his MRR ""REC catalog""
> The Library Owner select object from the MRR Project and brings it into the Library REC Catalog.
> A Consumer that references the Library can create a Replicas from the MRR that was in the Library.
> Hi Anthony. I am not sure I follow 100%. Do you want to move only the REC catalog element, or also the elements that constitute the REC itself?
> Just the REC and what is needed to support its operation.
> Basically looking for a means to build up the library with components that can be reused, but preserve content of replica from the source.
> > Hi Anthony. I am not sure I follow 100%. Do you want to move only the REC
> > catalog element, or also the elements that constitute the REC itself?
> > Just the REC and what is needed to support its operation.
> > Basically looking for a means to build up the library with components that can
> > be reused, but preserve content of replica from the source.
> > > Hi Anthony. I am not sure I follow 100%. Do you want to move only the REC
> > > catalog element, or also the elements that constitute the REC itself?
> Still not sure I follow through. Why don't you just create the REC in the Library REC catalog?

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1798,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1798,capella,781230420,1798,"Pattern, REC/RPL, Show Qualified Name, Modelling Accelerators appear in all popup menus",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:05:58Z,2021-01-07T11:06:05Z,"The Pattern, REC/RPL, and Show Qualified Name menus are shown in all popup menus.

IMO, you cannot assume that all client views will always want these menus. E.g. I am currently implementing a new view which has nothing to do with any of the three menus. I don't want them in my view. Please lets evaluate in which Capella views these menus should be visible, and add them to those views explicitly.
> Now they are contributed on all popup, but parts of group.pattern, group.accelerators, group.rec and no longer added by default.
> If a custom view want them, just add those separators.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1810,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1810,capella,781231858,1810,[Flexi] PropertyContext should only notify listeners if Property value really changes,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:08:17Z,2021-01-07T11:08:25Z,"When I call this:
The property context should only fire a change notification for the first set, since the second time the property value doesn't change.
> Turns out this side effect was used to force refresh on content viewers which is now broken.
> There should be a better way to create synthetic property changes. A workaround for now is to cast IPropertyContext to PropertyContext to call notifyListeners().
> Aaaaand, some more regressions caused by the fix. The pattern is always the same:
> context.setCurrentValue(prop, context.getCurrentValue()) is used to force notifications in these places.
> 1) Manual test is to set ""Locate parents manually"" and drop RPL elements => OK button won't enable and items on left still have yellow background.
> And probably many more. I think the commit must be reverted: https://git.polarsys.org/r/#/c/5496/
> I now have no idea how to really avoid the unneccessary notifications. It looks impossible without redesigning the whole framework..

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1826,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1826,capella,781233718,1826,Provide better feedback in Capella Model Explorer for Invalid representation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:11:23Z,2021-01-07T11:11:32Z,"The aim of this ticket is to provide user feedback in Capella Model explorer when the representation is invalid. It can be because:
* the DRepresentationDescriptor repPath contains an URI that is not reachable. It is the case for example if the DRepresentation is deleted. These cases happens when:
- there is a bad fragment in the repPath URI
- there is a bad segment in the repPath URI
- the DRepresentation is not existing anymore
Actions on invalid representations should let only the delete action available.
> This ticket depends on Sirius bugzilla [ECLIPSE-541513](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-541513&type=Issues)
> Make sure https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/133143/ commit is included in the Sirius version Capella depends on.
> * In ""Capella Project Explorer"" view, expand both semantic model and ""representation per category"" node to see the 6 representation (only 5 are visible in semantic tree)
> -> Only ""[OAIB] Root Operational Activity Valid"" representation should be valid(icon and text not grayed)
> * right click on a valid representation under both the semantic model tree and ""representation per category""
> -> Open, Delete, Rename, Clone diagram should be enabled in the contextual menu
> * right click on an INVALID representation both under the semantic model tree and under ""representations per category""
> -> Open, Rename and Clone Diagram should be DISABLED in the contextual menu

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1827,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1827,capella,781233813,1827,Add an affected objects listener to the Capella Common Navigator,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:11:36Z,2021-01-07T11:11:43Z,"Add a listener to the CapellaCommonNavigator to select and reveal object created by EMF commands in order to show them when the operation is finished.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1828,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1828,capella,781233923,1828,Some exception are raised in case of invalid representation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:11:47Z,2021-01-07T11:11:55Z,"Attachment: [testCapellaInvalidRep.zip](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/281017.zip)
ZIP file with Java source files exhibiting the bug
In the attached model, there are different error cases:

> added : https://git.polarsys.org/r/6898 [2286] Add some checks to handle invalid representation

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1829,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1829,capella,781234039,1829,Provide better feedback in Capella Model Explorer for Invalid representation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:11:58Z,2021-01-07T11:12:06Z,"Attachment: [testCapellaInvalidRep.zip](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/281018.zip)
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #2282 +++
The aim of this ticket is to provide user feedback in Capella Model explorer when the representation is invalid.
When invalid, the representation would be grayed in the Capella Project Explorer
* the DRepresentationDescriptor repPath contains an URI that is not reachable. It is the case for example if the DRepresentation is deleted. These cases happens when:
- there is a bad fragment in the repPath URI
- there is a bad segment in the repPath URI
- the DRepresentation is not existing anymore
Actions on invalid representations should let only the delete action available.
> * In ""Capella Project Explorer"" view, expand both semantic model and ""representation per category"" node to see the 6 representation (only 5 are visible in semantic tree)
> -> Only ""[OAIB] Root Operational Activity Valid"" representation should be valid(icon and text not grayed)
> * right click on a valid representation under both the semantic model tree and ""representation per category""
> -> Open, Delete, Rename, Clone diagram should be enabled in the contextual menu
> * right click on an INVALID representation both under the semantic model tree and under ""representations per category""
> -> Open, Rename and Clone Diagram should be DISABLED in the contextual menu

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1844,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1844,capella,781235785,1844,Refresh action on the Semantic Browser does not work,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:14:47Z,2021-01-07T11:14:55Z,"All use cases use the IFE sample model.

# Check that in the Semantic Browser there are no Referenced elements
# Open properties View and add a element of Interest
# Switch to the Semantic Browser and *click Refresh*
*Expected*: In the referenced Elements  we should see a new Category named *Elements of Interest* with as many items as elements of interest
*Note*: If we switch the selection in the Project explorer and reclick on the  [SDFB] Top Level Functional Overview diagram, the queries are recomputed an the category is displayed correctly.
# Click on Displayed VOD Movie Data Category on System Analysys/System Functions
# Check that in the Semantic Browser there are 3 Functional exchanges
# Open properties View and remove all function exchanges
# Switch to the Semantic Browser and *click Refresh*
*Expected*: In the referenced Elements  we should no longer see the functional exchanges
*Currently*: This category exists and 3 function exchanges are displayed
*Note*: If we switch the selection in the Project explorer and reclick on the category, the queries are recomputed an the category is displayed correctly.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1860,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1860,capella,781258118,1860,Add Copy and Paste as Description Link functionality for the Description Section,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:53:22Z,2021-01-07T11:53:31Z,"Currently there is not easy way to insert multiple Model Elements or Diagram link in the Description Section.
A link must be created for each element and this is a long operation.
Even more, the elements must be relocated in the Insert link dialog even if they are already found in the Project Explorer, Semantic Browser or the currently opened Diagram.
The purpose of this ticket is to add a ""Copy and Paste as Description Link"" functionality that will allow to insert links for multiple elements from all of the above mentioned sources.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1863,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1863,capella,781258455,1863,"Delete the container of the target element from ""Delete From Model"" toolbar action fails",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:53:58Z,2021-01-07T11:54:06Z,"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #554765 +++

It is not currently possible to delete a diagram element that is a the current container of the diagram target using the ""Delete From Model"" action. The editor is closed and the deletion is not performed.
2) Open the PDFB diagram (can be reproduced on another diagrams)
3) Select A and click the ""Delete from Model"" button.
The selected elements are deleted and the editor is closed.
The selected elements are not deleted and the editor is closed.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1864,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1864,capella,781258557,1864,"Delete the target element from ""Delete From Model"" toolbar action fails",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:54:09Z,2021-01-07T11:54:17Z,"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #554764 +++
It is not currently possible to delete a diagram element that is a the current diagram target using the ""Delete From Model"" action. The editor is closed and the deletion is not performed.

The selected elements are deleted and the editor is closed.
The selected elements are not deleted and the editor is closed.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1865,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1865,capella,781258684,1865,Refresh All Sub Representations needs progress monitoring improvements.,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:54:21Z,2021-01-07T11:54:29Z,"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #554447 +++
* Open a Capella project with a large amount of representations
* Select the .aird and launch the Refresh All Sub Representations
* A dialog is displayed asking for confirmation. It shows the number of found representations
* Clic on the progress icon or open the Progress view
* The task is renamed for each refreshed representations the progress bar shows one tick sometimes before being set to 0.
* Users do not known when this will end or the amount of done/remaining work.
I detected the issue on a project with 328 representations.
Additional remark: It seems that the action should be called refresh all representations, I do not see the meaning of ""Sub"" in this case.

> ""Link content"" default value for semantic browser
> * change ""Link content"" default value for semantic browser to true
> * Fix Sirius preferences overload (PREF_REFRESH_ON_REPRESENTATION_OPENING and PREF_AUTO_REFRESH)
> * [559169] Adapt the Capella Sirius Preference Customization Test

> -> you should have the same changed preferences than in 3

> -> you should have the same changed preference than in 3.

> -> you should still have the unchecked button

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1891,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1891,capella,781261433,1891,Avoid inter-resource set dependencies with platform plug-in elements,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T11:59:21Z,2021-01-07T11:59:29Z,"If there are elements which are outside comparison scopes but referenced within the scopes through unidirectional cross-references (typically, from platform plug-ins), then a merge can result in those elements being similarly referenced in the opposite scope. In the case where the comparison is computed between two models that are open, the opposite scope is in another resource set. But that resource set may already have the same out-of-scope elements loaded through the same platform plug-in URI. If there is functional logic that is based on equality by object reference, then it may fail on the merged model because it finds elements loaded in the opposite resource set: even though the elements are the same, the Java objects that represent them are not.
> An obvious solution consists in resolving platform plug-in elements locally, either in general or in certain cases where it is needed. Beware of the possible performance cost.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1897,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1897,capella,781262022,1897,Icons from StyleCustomizations are not taken into account for cs.Part,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:00:27Z,2021-01-07T12:00:34Z,"Hello,
With Capella 1.4.0, org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.analysis.extension.style.PartComponentStyleConfiguration has been introduced through the org.eclipse.sirius.diagram.ui.styleconfigurationProvider.
In this class, the getLabelIcon method doesn't handle possible custom icons from StyleCustomizations.

> DRAFT on Capella (https://github.com/eclipse/capella/commit/852d51ad79bffd32509a1e58248ef2ae657a3928) depending on a Sirius commit to make org.eclipse.sirius.diagram.ui.tools.api.graphical.edit.styles.SimpleStyleConfiguration.useCustomIcon(DDiagramElement, IGraphicalEditPart) protected.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1898,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1898,capella,781262120,1898,Transition LC to PC: A logical component (isActor = false) shall be transitioned with a BEHAVIOR nature,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:00:37Z,2021-01-07T12:00:45Z,`ðŸ†” ECLIPSE-561178` `ðŸ‘· sandu.postaru` `ðŸ“… 2020-03-17` `ðŸ”Ž 1.4.1`,"{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1898/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
> 1) Logical Components that are not Actors (isActor: false) are transitioned as BEHAVIOR Physical Components (isActor: false)

> 2) Logical Components that are Actors (isActor: true) and are part of a component hierarchy where at least one Logical Component that is not an actor (isActor: false) exists, are transitioned as BEHAVIOR Physical Components (isActor: true)
> 3) Logical Components that are Actors (isActor: true) and do not obey rule 2 are transitioned as NODE Physical Components (isActor: true)
> It looks like point 1) is still NOK in Capella 1.4.1: I tried to transition a non actor LC and it becomes a Node PC. Could you double check this?
> A child ticket 565957 has been fixed for transitions of leaf components in 1.4.2.
> It shall be ok in the latest stable 1.4.2

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1900,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1900,capella,781262324,1900,Richtext can save previous description into the current element,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:00:59Z,2021-01-07T12:01:06Z,"- Open two diagrams with description.
- In property view for both element, switch to Description Tab
- If you switch quickly from one diagram to the other, then the description of the first one will be displayed instead of the second.
> Diagram A, having as description â€œAAAAâ€
> Diagram B, having as description â€œBBBBâ€.
> 1) Open the two diagrams, and in the properties view select the description tab.
> 2)Select diagram B, switch fast to diagram A and come back fast to diagram B.
> -> Diagram B has the description of diagram A.

> In org.polarsys.kitalpha.richtext.widget.internal.ListenerInstaller.installChangeContentListener(MDENebulaBasedRichTextWidget) we have a listener that listens to the event â€˜changeâ€™ and save the content of the rich text.

> â€œThe change event is fired when the content of the editor is changed. Due to performance reasons, it is not verified if the content really changed. The editor instead watches several editing actions that usually result in changes. This event may thus in some cases be fired when no changes happen or may even get fired twice.â€
> The content of the editor changes in 2 cases:
> - The user entered a new text on the keyboard, or copy pasted something.
> - We programmatically use the â€˜setTextâ€™ method to replace the content of the editor.
> It is the 2nd case that is problematic for our scenario.
> Select diagram B, switch fast to diagram A and come back fast to diagram B:

> The object is now B, the feature is now that of B, the editor text is that of A for the moment. We now do a setText call with the description of B, the description is now being modified but due to the async nature CKEditor it might not be yet modified in the UI. The handler is now called because a â€˜changeâ€™ happened, so we perform a save with the description which is that of A.

> The fix is to not use the â€˜changeâ€™ event, but â€˜keyâ€™ (https://ckeditor.com/docs/ckeditor4/latest/api/CKEDITOR_editor.html#event-key) event, the text will be saved only when the user modifies it, and not when we modify it programmatically.
> This does not induce a performance degradation, since the scenarios which lead to the event being fired are smaller.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1913,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1913,capella,781263716,1913,Memory leak with org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:03:22Z,2021-01-07T12:03:30Z,"I detected this memory leak during a more global analysis about memory leaks in TeamForCapella.

In Capella environment, the FileModificationPreCommitListener is added to the SessionsListener with org.eclipse.sirius.business.api.session.SessionManager.addSessionsListener (SessionManagerListener). It is never removed. It's a memory leak. Furthermore, the FileModificationPreCommitListener retains the TransactionalEditingDomain with the target field (and with a TED potentially a lot of other Objects are retained).
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (first capture)
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* Create a new Capella project Capella1
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (second capture)
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* Create a new Capella project Capella2
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (third capture)
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* Create a new Capella project Capella2
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (fourth capture)
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* Close project Capella1 (the contextual menu on aird is not used to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Close project Capella2 (the contextual menu on aird is not used to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Close project Capella3 (the contextual menu on aird is not used to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (fifth capture)
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* There are always 7 instances of FileModificationPreCommitListener. They are retained by the programmaticListeners field of org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.session.SessionManagerImpl.
> With the above pull request the result is:

> The remaining instance is created during the first project creation in org.polarsys.capella.common.libraries.manager.LibraryManager.getProviders(). The CapellaWorkspaceProvider is created until creation of a new FileModificationPreCommitListener. This ""problem"" will be handle in another issue. Indeed the field workspaceDomain is a TransactionalEditingDomain that it is never disposed. I do not know at this point whether it is normal or not.
> Corresponding stack of the creation of remaining FileModificationPreCommitListener:
> The pull request has been merged (commit https://github.com/eclipse/capella/commit/df777349dacf5e91c616c74ca41c67e4c86af027).

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1916,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1916,capella,781264070,1916,Memory leak in CapellaSessionHelper.checkModelsFullCompliancy(URI),eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:03:56Z,2021-01-07T12:04:05Z,"This leak has been detected during an analysis about memory leaks in Team for Capella context. Indeed, this method is only used in this context.
When it is called, the temporary resourceSet is not correctly cleaned:
1- Resource are unloaded but not with the org.eclipse.sirius.business.api.resource.strategy.ResourceStrategyRegistry (used everywhere else)

2- The resources are not removed from the resourceSet and this creates a memory leak in Kitalpha, org.polarsys.kitalpha.ad.services.manager.ViewpointManager. The instance of ViewpointManager created for this resourceSet is not removed because the adapter added in ViewpointManager.getInstance(ResourceSet) is not called.
There is no real steps to validate in Capella context. The steps to validate in Team for Capella context is:
* Launch a T4C server (with a blank database)
* Launch a T4C client on a clean workspace (with YoutKit)
* Import the project IFE in workspace
* Ensure that ""Link with Editor"" is disabled in ""Project Explorer"" view
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (first capture)
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on ""org.eclipse.emf.internal.cdo.transaction.CDOTransactionImpl"".
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on ""org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl"".
* Export the project IFE to the server
** With contextual menu ""Export.../Team for Capella/Export model to remote repository"" on the project
** On first page, click on ""Test connection"" (use credentials user1/user1)
** On second page, uncheck the 3 options ""Override existing resources"", ""Connect to the exported project"" and ""Export referenced workspace images""
** A popup appears to say that ""The model has been successfully exported to the repository"". Click on OK.
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (second capture)
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on ""org.eclipse.emf.internal.cdo.transaction.CDOTransactionImpl"".
* Expected: There is 0 instance of ""CDOTransactionImpl"". Indeed, the local session is not opened and the wizard should not retain any CDOTransaction. --> OK
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on ""org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl"".
* Expected: There is 0 instance of ""ResourceSetImpl"". --> KO, there is one retained by ""ViewpointManager.instances""
> > * Expected: There is 0 instance of ""ResourceSetImpl"". --> KO, there is one
> The last step of ""steps to validate"" is wrong. It must be replaced by:
> ** One retained by the ""org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.componentization.ViewpointRegistryImpl"" (where all the known VSM resources are loaded).
> --> KO, there is another one retained by ""ViewpointManager.instances""
> The pull request https://github.com/eclipse/capella/pull/217 fixes the problem.

> For information, I've rebased the pull request on master.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NjA3NTg1Nw==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1917,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1917,capella,781264172,1917,In scenario initialization Guard are not referenced on operands,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:04:08Z,2021-01-07T12:04:21Z,"On InteractionOperand, guards are propagated but not referenced.

* Add a breakpoint in method ""org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.session.danalysis.DAnalysisSessionImpl.close(IProgressMonitor)""; just after the code that sets the ""transactionalEditingDomain"" to null.
* Close the session with contextual menu ""Close"" on the aird file
* The execution is stopped on the breakpoint.

* You can observed ,in the Variables view, like in potentialLeak.png, that transactionalEditingDomain is really set to null, but ""val$transactionalEditingDomain"" has always the reference to the SemanticEditingDomainFactory$SemanticEditingDomain.

This is because in the code, the final parameter transactionalEditingDomain is directly used in the anonymous inner class. In team environment a leak has been detected with this problem and fixed in MelodyTeamSessionFactory. It is better to directly use this.getTransactionalEditingDomain() instead of the parameter. I not reproduce the leak only in Capella but the code will be cleaner.
The actions provided by extension point ""org.eclipse.ui.navigator.navigatorContent"" can cause memory leaks.

For example, when the contextual menu is open on a semantic element, the ""context"" of ""org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator.actions.providers.EditCommonActionProvider"" is set with the semantic element. This context is changed on the next click on a ""compatible object"". For EditCommonActionProvider, only EObjects are compatible. If you close the session, the ""EditCommonActionProvider"" retains the semantic element and with it all the semantic model.
* Launch Capella with Yourkit (in a workspace containing the IFE project)
* Check that ""Link with Editor"" is disabled
* Open the session (using contextual menu ""Open Session"" on the aird file)
* Open the contextual menu on ""Operational Analysis"" node, and expand the menu ""Add Capella Element""
* Click 2 times on escape key (to close the menu)
* Close the session (using contextual menu ""Close"" on the aird file)
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on org.polarsys.capella.core.data.oa.impl.OperationalAnalysisImpl.
* There is one instance of this kind. Select it and click on ""Calculate paths"" int the ""Paths from GC Roots""
* It is retained by several paths but at least:
Remark 1: The size of the leak depends of the size of the semantic model (all elements of the semantic model are indirectly be retained).
Remark 2: This leak is ""temporary"". If you open another session, and click on another semantic element, it will replace the previous in the context of CommonActionProviders.

A solution will be to add all the CommonActionProviders provided by Capella as SessionListener to listen ""org.eclipse.sirius.business.api.session.SessionListener.CLOSING"" and to clean the context if it concerns an EObject of the session.

With the same scenario as [ECLIPSE-563385](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-563385&type=Issues), we can observe than there are memory leaks retained by FullDecoratorRunnable (org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.FullImageDecoratorRunnable or org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.FullTextDecoratorRunnable).
As you can see in memoryLeaksWithFullDecoratorRunnable.png, the FullImageDecoratorRunnable and the FullTextDecoratorRunnable retain the semantic elements even if the session is closed.

This is maybe linked to [ECLIPSE-167018](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-167018&type=Issues) (but it has been closed as a duplicate of another bugzilla). In this bug, it was written that ""full decorators are lot less effecient"". Maybe the org.polarsys.capella.common.re.ui.decorators.InstanciationLabelDecorator should be ""lightweight""? I don't really know the differences and I don't master the impacts. It is only a proposal.

CapellaValidateAction"" retains the ""TransactionalEditingDomain"" (through its field ""domain""), even if the corresponding session is closed. Furthermore, it seems that one CapellaValidateAction is created at each display of contextual menu (and retained in the list ""org.eclipse.jface.viewers.Viewer.selectionChangedListeners"" of the ""org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator.view.CapellaCommonViewer"".
* Launch Capella with Yourkit (in a workspace containing 2 Capella projects, I call them ""P1"" and ""P2"" in th scenario)
* Check that ""Link with Editor"" is disabled
* Open the session of project ""P1"" (using contextual menu ""Open Session"" on aird file)
* Open the contextual menu on ""Operational Analysis"" node (expand the root of semantic tree if necessary)
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Open the contextual menu on ""Operational Analysis"" node
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Open the contextual menu on ""Operational Analysis"" node
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Open the session of project ""P2"" (using contextual menu ""Open Session"" on aird file)
* Open the contextual menu on ""Operational Analysis"" node (expand the root of semantic tree if necessary)
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Open the contextual menu on ""Operational Analysis"" node
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Close the session of ""P1"" (using contextual menu ""Close"" on the aird file)
* Close the session of ""P2"" (using contextual menu ""Close"" on the aird file)
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit
* In ""Object explorer"" view of YourKit, filter on ""org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.actions.CapellaValidateAction"".
* There are 5 instances of this kind.
** One of them is retained by the ""org.polarsys.capella.core.validation.ui.actions.ValidationActionProvider"" with ""defaultValidationAction"" field (the last created)
** All of them are retained in the ""selectionChangedListeners"" list of ""CapellaCommonViewer""
** They retain the TED of both sessions.
You can see in memoryLeaksWithCapellaValidateAction.png the Yourkit resukt corresponding to this scenario.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1933,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1933,capella,781265955,1933,Obfuscation Documentation Missing,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T12:07:14Z,2021-01-07T12:07:20Z,"When exporting two capella projects (direct copies of each other) and the single referenced Library to Teams for Capella server, attempting to connect to one model results in an ""Unhandled Event Loop Exception"" at the final connection dialog.

> Corrected the title of the bug as appropriate to the missing Obfuscation Documention from the Capella menu.  Please disregard the original title/comment about Teams For Capella... clerical error on my part.
> There is not documentation about how the obfuscation function works in Capella to properly assess the IP sensitivity of releasing an obfuscated model for bug analysis.
> To present the obfuscation feature, I sent the following presentation to Brandon. If it is ok, I will create a gerrit review to add it to the Capella documentation.
> The ""Obfuscate Model"" feature is provided by Capella.
> The algorithm is divided in two parts.

> First, there is a scan of the model in org.polarsys.capella.core.model.obfuscator.actions.ObfuscateSemanticResourceCommand and org.polarsys.capella.core.model.obfuscator.actions.ObfuscateRepresentationCommand: it scans the entierty of the content of the different resources of the session. For each textual attribute (name, descriptions, notes ...) that are not IDs, it replaces the value by a random String.

> The obfuscation of each attribute is done in org.polarsys.capella.core.model.obfuscator.ObfuscatorHelper.generateUnreadableString. It generates an id using java.util.UUID.randomUUID(). Then it replaces the attribute value by a subset of the id, so each String will have the same length and the file size will be similar.
> This is not an encryption of the information but really an obfuscation. The only information that will be kept are:
>     The structure of the modÃ¨le (tree structure, ids and link between elements)
>     The length of the textual attributes values.
> The code corresponding to the 1.4.1 version is visible here:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1950,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1950,capella,781268627,1950,Capacity to hide legacy requirements options on Capella,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T12:11:40Z,2021-01-07T12:11:42Z,"Proposed enhancement is to add an option (preferably enabled by default) to hide the legacy requirements options on context menus so that new users won't try to use them.

This item is being proposed due to a number of forum entries that I've seen where people new to Capella are trying to use requirements in their diagrams and are not knowledgeable of the Requirements viewpoint. They are often told not to use the legacy requirements feature and opt for the new add-on.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1951,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1951,capella,781268726,1951,Contextual menu did not show 'Move diagrams' after opening a diagram,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:11:50Z,2021-01-07T12:11:59Z,"Attachment: [moveDiagMenu.zip](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/283845.zip)
After opening the diagram, the contextual menu did not show 'Move diagrams' menu.
To display it in the contextual menu, we need to close diagram and/or click somewhere else.
* import the attached Capella project in your workspace
* open contextual menu --> 'move diagram' does not appear. (BUG)
> When the user open the diagram, the moveRepresentation menu is disposed (RepresentationActionProvider class) in order to make sure action contained list are freed at each selection time.
> (For example, if you display menu ""Move diagrams"" on a first diagram, some sub menu will appears to choose where to move.
> Thanks to this method, these submenus won't be displayed if you display menu ""Move diagrams"" on a second diagram. Only those concerning the second diagram will be displayed.)
> The dispose of the moveRepresentation menu explains why the menu disappear after opening.
> So to display it then, we have to launch a selection change event in order to re-initialize menu, for example by clicking on an other item or on the diagram again.
> This dispose security (to freed the list) is already present in class MoveRepresentationMenuManager.
> Indeed, when sub menus of ""Move diagrams"" menu are initialized for a given selection, existing menu items are removed.
> So in fact, the dispose of moveRepresentation in class RepresentationActionProvider is overkill and it can be removed.
> With this fix, after opening diagram, menu ```Move diagrams``` is displayed correctly and menu ""Move diagrams"" is not complete with previous sub menus.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1952,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1952,capella,781268842,1952,Semantic Browser in unsynchronized mode changes content in an unexpected way,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:12:02Z,2021-01-07T12:12:11Z,"Steps to reproduce:
1. Deselect the synchronization button on Semantic Browser
2. Select an element in the Project Explorer and press F9 => The content of SB changes accordingly.
3. Select another element in the Project Explorer => The content of SB does not change which is normal because it's in unsynchronized mode.
=> The content of SB changes which is not normal. It should stay the same.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1953,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1953,capella,781268951,1953,Allocated Functions in Exchange Scenario diagrams,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T12:12:14Z,2021-01-07T12:12:16Z,"In Exchange Scenario (ES) diagrams, the tool 'Allocated Function' used on a lifeline allows selecting a Function to indicate that at this point of the lifeline, the selected Function is executed.

The Function is represented as a box on the lifeline (semantic element 'StateFragment') and can be moved along the lifeline to indicate whether the Function execution is earlier or later than some other Function execution or incoming/outgoing Functional Exchanges.
If we delete the ES diagram and re-create it, the following problematic behaviors happen:
* We can no longer move the box along the lifeline
* We cannot delete the 'StateFragment' element: the Capella dialog for deletion appears but upon OKaying it nothing is performed
* The tool 'Allocated Function' no longer works: the dialog for selecting a Function appears, but upon OKaying it nothing is performed.
Closing/opening the session seems to fix these issues.
Exemple of function not displayed on PAB
I try to use Capella 1.4.1 in both way, via upgrade of a previous model from version 1.4.0 or with a new model (1.4.1).
In the PAB diagram, I am able to create a physical node, then to create a behavioral node.

When I try to create a physical function directly into a behavioral node via the palette tool, the function is created (I can see it into the model explorer) but it is not attached to the behavioral node and it is not displayed.
I try to allocate the function via the functional allocator tool and I am able to attach the function to behavioral component but it is not still displayed.
When I try to use the tool ""Allocated functions"", I am now able to display the function.
Compare to previous version it is a more complicate way to create model.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1959,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1959,capella,781269566,1959,Description can be lost when switching quickly between elements with an opened description editor in property view,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:13:22Z,2021-01-07T12:13:29Z,"Due to the asynchronization of Nebula Richtext editor events, when we switch quickly between elements with an opened description editor in property view, the description of an element can be unexpectedly replaced by the description of another element.

The solution for the [ECLIPSE-561365](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-561365&type=Issues) was to dispatch all the events of Nebula Richtext editor for each action. However, this has some side-effects, for example double-click events appear without any reason.
We need to find a way to react to asynchronized events of Nebula Richtext editor instead of forcing them to be synchronized with our UI events.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1964,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1964,capella,781270116,1964,"Potential ""Invalid thread access"" in SemanticBrowserView.setInput",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:14:18Z,2021-01-07T12:14:27Z,"This can happen in a collaborative context, with Team For Capella, when the connection with the server is lost. In this case, the cleaning of the SemanticBrowserView is called out of the main thread (UI thread) and causes an ""Invalid thread access"".
> * Open a ""shared"" session (the activity explorer is opened)
> * Select one element in the diagram

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1965,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1965,capella,781270239,1965,Do not consider closed session as dirty,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:14:29Z,2021-01-07T12:14:38Z,"This problem has been observed sometimes in a collaborative context, with Team For Capella, when then connection with the server is lost.

Indeed, the code in ""org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator.viewer.CapellaSaveable.isDirty()"" checks that the current session is known of the SessionManager but not that it is opened. This can happen randomly because of execution of several threads in parallel.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1966,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1966,capella,781270362,1966,"Handle specific ""connection lost"" problem that can appear when using Capella with collaborative environment (Team for Capella)",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:14:41Z,2021-01-07T12:14:50Z,"As for Sirius [ECLIPSE-566274](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-566274&type=Issues), in a collaborative environment, when the data is host on a server, the connection with the server can be lost. Capella is not ready to handle this context. If Capella tries to access to data, for example with an async refresh of the UI that needs information from data to be refreshed, a org.eclipse.net4j.util.lifecycle.LifecycleException is thrown with the message ""Not active: CDOTransactionImpl"". This kind of errors is showed to the end-user instead of silently catch it. Indeed, in this situation, the UI should be refreshed with ""blank data"" instead of displaying an ""incomprehensible"" popup to the end-user.

In [ECLIPSE-566274](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-566274&type=Issues), a specific query has been added to ""detect"" this specific case. The goal of this issue is to use this specific query to avoid this kind of problem.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1976,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1976,capella,781271429,1976,"[xCBD] Incorrectly use ""owned components"" instead of ""component breakdown""",eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T12:16:31Z,2021-01-07T12:16:33Z,"![xCBD display only owned components.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/284079.png)
In a project with ""Reuse of components through parts"" enabled, a component can have multiple parents. However, a component can only have one owner.
A component breakdown diagram only shows ""owned components"".
It will be better if a component breakdown diagram shows the entire component breakdown, instead of only owned components.
This applies to logical component breakdown diagrams (LCBD) and physical component breakdown diagrams (PCBD).
Connectors that represent parts are not shown
Some connectors on component breakdown diagrams do not show (see attached screenshot). There is no way to make those connectors show.
This problem applies to logical component breakdown diagrams (LCBD) and physical component breakdown diagrams (PCBD).
This only happens when ""reuse of components through parts"" is enabled in a project.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1992,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/1992,capella,781273328,1992,Refresh All sub representations fails when something wrong occured on one representation,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:19:36Z,2021-01-07T12:19:45Z,"The aim of this ticket is to ensure that the Refresh All sub representations functionality finishes properly.
If a representation refresh fails, it should not prevent the process to continue. All other representations should be refreshed.
Moreover, Invalid representation detected before the ""refresh all"" should be excluded as a representation to refresh.
> * deploy the refreshWithErrorExtension plugin in the runtime
> * open the ""Error log"" and the ""Information"" view
> * open the session and right click on the aird + click ""Refresh All Sub Representations""
> * Check that you have a warning in the error log view which message is:
> 1 representation refreshed and 5 representation(s) failed to refresh
>  - name: [OAIB] Root Operational Activity BROKEN2 repPath, uid: _S6Rj4P5oEeqrnYiX_w9WIA, target: Root Operational Activity
> Representation(s) with no valid semantic target (invalid)
>  - name: [OABD] Root Operational Activity  BROKEN target Rep, uid: _YeHm8f5oEeqrnYiX_w9WIA, target: Root Operational Activity
>  - name: [OAIB] Root Operational Activity BROKEN targetRepDesc, uid: _h-ygcA7FEeuH6beRn0TQew, target: [Unnamed element]
>  - name: RefreshTest[OAIB] Root Operational Activity 1 NPE, uid: _c_QP0P5oEeqrnYiX_w9WIA, target: Root Operational Activity
>  - name: RefreshTest[OAIB] Root Operational Activity 2 CCE, uid: _9ZzYsAiyEeuOh5F7ZRcCFw, target: Root Operational Activity
> * Check that you have the same warning in the Information view + 5 lines for each representation(3 errors and 2 warnings)
> -> the representation should be selected in the Project Explorer except for ""[OAIB] Root Operational Activity BROKEN"" for which we get ""No element foundin the Explorer""

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2000,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2000,capella,781274196,2000,Improve analysis selector for better management and understanding,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:21:06Z,2021-01-07T12:21:14Z,"There as been some improvement on the analysis selector to be more user friendly. As the one provided in Capella was better that the one in Sirius, it was made as a class (instead of a nested class) so it could be reused properly.
Furthermore, the move representation actions have been modified. Instead of having an action for each available aird file, there is now only one action that displays the analysis selector.
> - Import the test sample, in attachment, in your workspace
> #1 Check that you can see a contextual action ""Move""
> #2 Check that there is only one destination possible and it is displayed as ""Local (in path_to_aird)""
> - Press OK and select the Move action again to check that it now displays the path of the other aird
> - Select new Package1 and the ""Uncontrol"" contextual action
> #3 Check that the Move action is not available (there is only one aird now and nowhere to move a representation)
> I mixed up the Capella bugzilla and the Sirius one. Ignore the previous validation scenario.
> - Import the capella project from Capella_project_567909.zip in attachment, in your workspace
> - Unfold the first nodes until you can find the representation [OAIB] Root Operational Activities
> #1 Check that you can see a contextual action ""Move""
> #2 Check that there is only one destination possible and it is displayed as ""Local (in path_to_aird)"" where the path is located in the ""fragments"" folder
> - Press OK and select the Move action again to check that it now displays the path of the other aird
> - Select ""Root Operational Activiy"" and the ""UnFragment..."" contextual action. Press the OK button.
> #3 Check that the Move action is now disabled (there is only one aird now and nowhere to move a representation)

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2001,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2001,capella,781274294,2001,Duplicated contribution in the feature plugin org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.perspective for Tips and Tricks,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:21:18Z,2021-01-07T12:21:25Z,"Capella Tips and Tricks is contributed via the plugin org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.perspective. This feature plugin is referenced as branding plugin in the feature org.polarsys.capella.core.advance.feature. Since in the product we have 2 versions of this feature: one without source and one with source. The tipsAndTricksHref is referenced twice.

When we look at product such as Eclipse PDE or JDT, they do have a feature plugin, but it is not referenced as the branding plugin in the corresponding feature. The feature plugin just needs to have an identical name as its feature. Like this, even though there are 2 versions (with/without source) of the feature, only one feature is taken into account.
- Use the org.polarsys.capella.rcp feature plugin instead and rename the feature to have the same name as its feature plugin
- Remove the branding plugin reference from the feature org.polarsys.capella.rcp

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2016,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2016,capella,781275849,2016,Project renaming fails for names containing non-alphanumerical characters,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:24:02Z,2021-01-07T12:24:11Z,"Project renaming fails for names containing non-alphanumerical characters
1) Create a project with name ""[test]"" or a variant
3) Try to rename the .aird or .capella resource
-> Existing references towards the renamed resources are not updated
The issue comes from the use of the Word Boundary: \b in the match regex. This regex does not support non-alphanumerical characters.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2017,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2017,capella,781275977,2017,Forbid Project creation or Resource renaming for names containing special characters,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,CLOSED,2021-01-07T12:24:15Z,2021-01-07T12:24:24Z,"During Capella Project Creation there is an error that is raised if the name contains some special characters such as ""<"".
These special characters are the same as those authorized by the host OS for a file/folder creation.
The rest of the characters are thus authorized by the OS, but might raise issues in a EMF-XML serialization context .
Some authorized characters such as ""#"", ""%"", ""$"" raise a runtime error during project creation.
These characters should not be allowed.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2021,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2021,capella,781276386,2021,Capella additional installation steps for macOs and Linux,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-07T12:25:02Z,2021-01-11T08:44:42Z,"Hi,
Tehre are several messages on the forum which indicates how to make the Linux and macOS versions of the Capella bundles works :
* Installation procedure for Capella 1.1.0 on Mac OS
* Detailed instructions to run Capella 1.2.x on MacOS
The main step it to do a chmod O+x on the the eclipse executable.
For 5.0, this additional step will have to be modified as the packaging has changed:
* the executable is now named capella and is in the capella folder (the eclipse subfolder no more exists).
* the JRE is directly packaged in the bundle, the Java executables will need the same modification.
A first lead is to modify the build to produce a tar.gz archive instead of a zip to keep the autorizations on the files/scripts (see for example Eclipse Rust 2020-09)
The Capella studio might need the same changes.
> *** [ECLIPSE-569628](https://github.com/search?q=ECLIPSE-569628&type=Issues) has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
> Additional remark : the capella.ini which is present in the Capella bundle for macOS does not contain a -vm with path to the JRE 14.0.2 included in the bundle.
> See this post to use Capella 5.0 on macOS with the packaged JRE.
> > See this post to use Capella 5.0 on macOS with the packaged JRE : https://forum.mbse-capella.org/t/capella-5-on-mac/4354
> The  https://wiki.eclipse.org/Capella/Installation_Guide#Capella_Installation page could also been a good candidate to host the procedure for Linux and macOS.
> The pull request has been merged by Philippe.
> Nightly builds of Capella now produces tar.gz bundles for Linux and macOS.
> * extract the content of the archive
> * extract the content of the archive
> * regarding the configuration of your OS, the application is tagged as quarantined
>     * go to the folder in which you did the extraction, cd Desktop/ for example
>     * execute ls to check that Capella.app is present and that you are in the expected folder
>     * if you see com.apple.quarantine as result of the previsou command : execute xattr -d com.apple.quarantine Capella.app
>     *. execute xattr Capella.app : this time you should see no result

> * Double clic on Capella application to launch it","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc1NjA4NTgyOA==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
