issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2028,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2028,capella,784041469,2028,Undo of State creation on MSM diagrams fail if state grandparent is a StateMachine.,eclipse-capella-bot,59924963,,,OPEN,2021-01-12T08:54:39Z,2021-01-12T08:54:45Z,"Attachment: [stackTrace.txt](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/eclipse/capella/attachments/280893.txt)
StackTrace of the exception after undo.
On MSM diagram, if the user undo a State creation, which container of the container is an AbstractState, an exception occurs : BasicIndexOutOfBoundsException
2- Add a StateMachine on the root LogicalSystem (LogicalArchitecture>Structure>LogicalSystem)
3- Add a State on the region of the previous created StateMachine
4- Create a MSM diagram on the region of the new State
After few analysis, it seems that during undo, list of object to change is first recovered (class ChangeDescriptionImpl.java).
Then for each object to change, we reverse operation on their features (featureChange.applyAndReverse(objectToChange)).
The first object to change is the region on which we remove the state from involvedState (containement=false) and ownedState (containement=true)reference.
The second object to change is the StateMachine on which we remove the state from referencedStates (containement=false) reference but it has already been removed previously, so an exception occurs.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2061,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2061,capella,796216123,2061,Incompatibility between exchange categories addition in diagram and VP diagram styler,LisaF268,78154066,,,CLOSED,2021-01-28T17:41:58Z,2024-04-22T21:57:22Z,"When VP diagram styler is active on a diagram, it is not possible to add exchange categories.
![No proposed exchange categories with VP diagram styler activated](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78154066/106177166-74f3f380-6198-11eb-8550-24d7baa6406f.PNG)
![proposed exchange categories when VP diagram styler is not activated](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78154066/106177183-79201100-6198-11eb-99ab-e228807f7ca4.PNG)

It is necessary to deactivate the viewpoint to add an exchange category on the diagram.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2061/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
- Import the Capella project from the attached archive
- Select ""FunctionalExchange 1"" and go to the properties view
- The field ""Exchange category"" should be empty. Select the ""..."" button
- On the ""Transfer Dialog"", double click on ""ExchangeCategory1"" to move it on the right side. Click on OK.

-> Validation: Check that ""ExchangeCategory1"" has been added to the field.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85sG0PP/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
- Create a PVMT model applied on Functional Exchange
- Create an architecture blank diagram displaying an Functional Exchange
- Display Diagram Styler layer and color the exchange by applying the PVMT property value
- Create an Exchange Category on the Functional Exchange
- The Switch Exchange Category display an empty wizard if the Diagram Styler layer is enabled.
I recreated my sample from Capella master branch and without requiring the VPMS viewpoint that wasn't needed in this context.

@pdulth your changes adding some other calls to DiagramServices.getDiagramServices().isMapping looks good to me, thanks.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w852nL2t/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2062,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2062,capella,796217910,2062,Port allocation are deleted when moving component ports from one component to another,LisaF268,78154066,,,OPEN,2021-01-28T17:44:35Z,2024-01-11T00:15:50Z,"Context : a functional exchange is allocated to a component exchange, and related functions ports to components ports.
When the component port is moved from one component to another, the allocation link between the moved component port and the related function port is lost.
Allocation links between the other function/component ports and functional exchange/component exchanges are ok.
It is necessary to redo the allocation between the function port and the component port or between the functional exchange and component exchange to solve the problem
- Drag and drop the black port on LC1 to LC11

-> Validation: The green reference with dashes between the moved port and LogicalFunction1 is still displayed","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85sGukS/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

New scenario handle by the PR https://github.com/eclipse/capella/pull/2788 drag and droping a port will not clear the ComponentExchange from its allocated FunctionalExchanges. Using the new sample from archive [2062test_functional_exchange_allocation_on_move.zip the scenario is:
- Drag an orange port from LogicalFunction2 and drop it on LogicalFunction3
- Validation: All 4 dashed reference are still displayed. C1 still has both ""Allocated Functional Exchange""
- Drag the orange port from LogicalFunction2 and drop it on LogicalFunction4
- Validation: All 4 dashed reference are still displayed. C1 still has both ""Allocated Functional Exchange""
- Drag the port CP1 (ComponentExchange end) from LC3 and drop it on LC2

- Validation: Only 3 dashed reference are still displayed, the one from CP1 to FIP2 on LogicalFunction 4 has been removed. C1 still has both ""Allocated Functional Exchange"". CP1 only has FIP 1 in its allocated ports","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85waZVw/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2114,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc5MzUzNzI4Mg==,capella,793537282,2114,NA,felixdo,179663,,,NA,2021-03-09T08:24:48Z,2021-03-09T08:24:48Z,"Well, for me, the workaround is to just clone the capella rotative provider, use my own image paths. This works bc all the 'highest' providers will be asked first, before falling back to the lower providers. The capella rotative provider returns null for images that it doesn't recognize, so the next highest provider will be called, which is either my clone or the kitalpha thing. I'll try when I port the addon for 5.0","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc5MzUzNzI4Mg==/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2114,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDc5MzY2MTcyMA==,capella,793661720,2114,NA,felixdo,179663,,,NA,2021-03-09T10:10:36Z,2021-03-09T10:10:36Z,"The kitalpha solution is  suboptimal because it requires rotating images to be registered via extension. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2171,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2171,capella,861180734,2171,Migration aird delegated handlers are wrongly called on non aird resources,pdulth,34767327,Philippe DUL,,CLOSED,2021-04-19T10:54:29Z,2021-04-21T13:04:24Z,"- `AirdMigrationRunnable` registers `RepresentationsFileXMIHelper` in any resources whereas it shall be registered on aird only

- `SiriusMigrationContribution` is a contribution for aird only calling sirius `RepresentationsFileMigrationService` methods. Since it is registered as a `IMigrationContribution` it will be called for any EObject while migration and can lead to unexpected behavior in `RepresentationsFileMigrationService` sirius side. (such as 572828)","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2171/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2178,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2178,capella,863969701,2178,XAB diagrams created from graphical model elements in mono-part mode are stored under the Part instead of its Component type,sandupostaru,59692543,Sandu Postaru,,CLOSED,2021-04-21T14:45:04Z,2021-04-22T13:45:18Z,"![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59692543/115573257-e1c2e980-a2c0-11eb-9389-1b8e55cf83ac.png)

Capella/Sirius supports models with missing viewpoints, which allows us to import/export projects between Capella installations and keep using them. However, the ""migrate toward current version"" action seems to have stricter requirements on this. With the following steps:
* Unzip Capella 5.0.0 in a first location
* Use ""install new software"" to install the Requirements add-on (0.12, available from https://github.com/eclipse/capella-requirements-vp/releases).
* Use Window > Show View > Viewpoint Manager
* Right-click the ""Capella Requirements"" in Viewpoint Manager and use ""Reference""
* Immediately right-click ""Capella Requirements"" again and use ""Unreference""
This project can still be used without issues from this Capella instance.
* Unzip Capella 5.0.0 in a second location
* Use File > Import > existing projects into workspace
* Select the project we've created in the first Capella instance (tick ""Copy projects into workspace"")
* Right-click the project and use ""Migration > migrate toward current version""

The migration will refuse to go forward since the Capella Requiements viewpoint is not available... even though we had ""unreferenced"" it from the project it is still referenced from both the afm and the aird files.

I've used Capella 5 in both cases to remove all other variables, but this also fails when migrating projects from 1.4.2 to 5.0.0, and in the case of other viewpoints, we may not have a reference from the ""afm"" file, only from the ""aird"", which will fail with different error messages.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2180/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2193,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2193,capella,874636586,2193,Log in console appear at load of transition plugins,mPorhel,1019672,Maxime Porhel,maxime.porhel@obeo.fr,OPEN,2021-05-03T14:42:34Z,2023-10-09T14:29:25Z,"### Steps to reproduce - 1:

* Secondary way to see this issue:
* Go into the Run Configuration... wizard
* Double clic the Transposer node and select the Purpose _org.polarsys.capella.common.re_

MetaClasses that have IMPLICITELY Defined Mappings : [0]

* The second purpose is reported as valid (org.polarsys.capella.core.transition)

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2197,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2197,capella,884112426,2197,SetName CapellaModelDataListeners use ExecutionManager.execute rather than CapellaModelDataListener.executeCommand,pdulth,34767327,Philippe DUL,,CLOSED,2021-05-10T12:24:42Z,2021-05-12T14:55:58Z,"When the semantic resource is loaded in `session.open` by `SessionResourcesTracker.initialize`, this is done with an exclusive transaction, if the `DataNotifier` is creating new commands by using `ExecutionManager.execute`, it will raise failures at loading in this context. This is the goal of `CapellaModelDataListener.executeCommand`

With https://github.com/eclipse/capella/pull/2190, while used directly with `session.open` (and not `OpenSessionAction`) like junit, the semantic resource is no longer loaded at `DAnalysisSessionImpl constructor / setAnalysisSelector`, but while `session.open`. We enter here in the case where the `DataNotifier` will create errors on the resource.
At the end of the load, the resource contains errors, (and so on, `LibraryManager.getModel` returns null making it invisible in Project Explorer.

The junit for `Rule_I_45` is also expecting that the resource contains a part with an invalid name. It was the case in 5.0 but since the migration of the project is fixing these issues, it is no longer the case when the model is properly migrated to 5.1. The junit has to be adapted to create a wrongly named part before the test.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2208,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2208,capella,922402543,2208,"Hide the ""Modeling Project"" feature from the Capella perspective exclusively.",GlennPlou,33932970,Glenn Plouhinec,,CLOSED,2021-06-16T10:00:04Z,2021-06-30T16:11:26Z,"Most of the Sirius/Modeling features are available in Capella from the Modeling perspective. In order to have a consistent behavior on Modeling features, the ""Modeling Project"" creation action should be available. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2210,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2210,capella,928069793,2210,"1.4.x build is broken, kitalpha repo moved",felixdo,179663,,,CLOSED,2021-06-23T09:47:54Z,2021-07-13T20:54:56Z,"Please fix the repo reference in

Please don't use such unstable references in release tags.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2210/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

Indeed the stable 'to-be-the-official-release' is always builded while other cots are still in stable process and once the capella stable release has been qualified, which can take several weeks, this stable is tagged as official release. We don't want/can't rebuild a new product with new date qualifiers nor have official tag refering to another commitId than the one used while building the stable 'to-be-the-official-release' one.
cots promotion to official release depend also on their own lifecycle, and can be officially released after capella is released.
e.g, Sirius stable will be marked as official when the next eclipse is made official, as they follow the eclipse release train.

One possible thing might be to avoid the tpd being located on eclipse/capella repository and maintained in a separate repo with .setup, .tpd and composite site with all addons for each releases, 1.4.0 to 1.4.2 / 5.0 and 5.1.
As we will now maintain Kitalpha, EGF and diffmerge, hopefully the process of releases shall be easier from now and we need to think to all of this.
If you really need it, can you commit for 1.4.x to refer to official kitalpha release as its highly probable that there will have no 1.4.3 ? For 5.1, it shall still work.

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2210,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDg3MTIxNTM5Mw==,capella,871215393,2210,NA,pdulth,34767327,Philippe DUL,,NA,2021-06-30T08:48:56Z,2021-06-30T08:48:56Z,"Yes same issue for our addons, but we don't build 1.4.x ones since stable have been deleted. I think we probably have a 1.4.x addon in upcoming next month.
> And, why not mirror these unstable URLs all together into a local ""capella-dependencies"" repository that can be kept forever?
Yes or no, capella depends on official releases of cots, not yet published while build, but they will become releases, so a mirror is not really needed
But yes target platform are badly managed now.
They are wrongly promoted to download.eclipse/capella/xx/targets which shall not never had be the case,
And the one stored in github/eclipse/capella in the official tag is not the reference neither.
What is working now is to refer to the latest tpd of the branch, which shall be uptodate (but which is not in the 1.4.x branch, but it should)

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2218,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2218,capella,952875303,2218,Product loading with workspace in use,arnauddieumegard,1576016,Arnaud Dieumegard,,CLOSED,2021-07-26T12:58:20Z,2022-05-18T14:48:16Z,"With the current launch options, current Capella 6.0.0 product does not ask for a repository path at launch.

The consequence is that when launching an other Capella instance, the workspace is in use. By default the associated behavior is to close the product and not allow to chose an other workspace => user is stuck an cannot launch another instance without modifying launch configuration.

Fix: add `-Dosgi.dataAreaRequiresExplicitInit=true` in the launch configuration of the product to fallback on the workspace choise when in use.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2218/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2225,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2225,capella,962723472,2225,FE computed representation in a SAB,jerome-montigny,88544535,,,OPEN,2021-08-06T13:10:15Z,2022-07-21T20:11:24Z,"We have a problem regarding computed representation of functional exchanges in a SAB.
We illustrate the issue in a sample capella project with 2 parent functions SF1 & SF2.
Each one are decomposed in 2 leaf functions (respectively SF11, SF12 & SF21,SF22).

The problem occurs when some of the leaf functions are stored in a System Function Package below the parent function (see SF_Model picture): in this case, as example, the FE2 is not represented by computation in the SAB Overview.
I opened the subject in the Capella Forum :

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2226,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2226,capella,962725744,2226,Missing opaque expression update in guards when instantiating a RPL from a REC,jerome-montigny,88544535,,,OPEN,2021-08-06T13:12:57Z,2021-08-06T13:12:57Z,"In Capella 5.1, in an MSM of a component belonging to a REC, Iâ€™m using some guards that are referencing FEs using the auto completion (ctrl-space) feature. The FEs are also part of the REC, with a suffix.
Updating the MSM guards when changing the FE names works perfectly in the REC. Great feature !
But when I instantiate an RPL from this REC and open an MSM diagram of this RPL, the guards in the MSM are not updated with the suffix added to the FE name. This creates little model inconsistencies.
Having a deeper look at the semantics in the opaque expression behind the guard, I recognized the the opaque expression in the RPL were still referencing the REC object :
the subject is opened in the Capella Forum :

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2229,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2229,capella,981202293,2229,Contained In tool in CIBD created under Structure doesn't work,pdulth,34767327,Philippe DUL,,OPEN,2021-08-27T12:29:31Z,2022-08-17T19:11:45Z,"- Create a EPBS Breakdown under the Structure Pkg

Nevertheless, using the menu Edit->copy and Edit->paste works nicely.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2231,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2231,capella,982150407,2231,Ctrl+ARROW not working properly,stephanelacrampe,43188260,,,OPEN,2021-08-29T16:59:12Z,2023-08-04T08:43:42Z,"It is not possible to navigate in texts sections using the CTRL+ARROWS keyboard shortcuts. This is the case for example in diagrams when you want to navigate on long textual labels for nodes or relations or Note/Text elements.

This is due to the fact that the CTRL+ARROWS shortcuts are assigned to the Semantic Browser history navigation. I do not know why these shortcuts have been assigned to the Semantic Browser History and if this is heavily used by users, but I find it problematic that textual navigation is lost because of this shortcut.
These shortcuts are assigned in the plugin.xml file of the org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.semantic.browser plugin:

One simple way to fix the issue is to comment on these lines in the plugin.xml file - but of course, the shortcuts are then disabled for the semantic browser history. If this function is useful, maybe another shortcut could be used like CTRL+PAGE_UP/PAGE_DOWN ??
I also tried to go on the Eclipse preferences in the Key tab but was not able to find this binding in the list.
Indeed I don't think this is often used.
The fix is probably to make it work only when the semantic browser has the focus,
By adding a `contextId` like the Delete menu.
They don't appear in the list of `Window > Preferences > General > Keys`
Those command are apparently legacy `IAction` created programmatically and not `ICommand` like other commands

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2231,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w842f7b9,capella,914339581,2231,NA,stephanelacrampe,43188260,,,NA,2021-09-07T14:10:19Z,2021-09-07T14:10:19Z,"That's great if this works only when the Semantic browser has the focus, thanks, Philippe.

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2231,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85jMSS6,capella,1664165050,2231,NA,stephanelacrampe,43188260,,,NA,2023-08-03T15:09:11Z,2023-08-03T15:09:11Z,"I think Philippe is referring to using CTRL+ARROWS for navigating in the history of the semantic browser. I think we all agree that navigating within text with CTRL+ARROWS is typically used.
@pdulth do you think that the fix you proposed could be merged into the next Capella version?
@stefan6973 a workaround for Capella 6.1 is to do the following:
- find the file org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.semantic.browser_6.1.0.202303291413.jar in the Capella plugin folder
- Rename it with a .zip extention so that you can enter in it, and edit the plugin.xml file
- save the file in the zip, and rename the file extension back to .jar

You should do this in a clean Capella installation. If you use an existing Capella installation, there is a chance it won't pick up your new settings, so to make it work on an existing installation, I had to start from a new workspace and I also replaced the configuration folder in the Capella installation by a clean one for the Capella bundle file.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2235,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2235,capella,988891735,2235,Tempered jar content in Capella RCP Product : template.html file of nebula.widgets.richtext ,mPorhel,1019672,Maxime Porhel,maxime.porhel@obeo.fr,CLOSED,2021-09-06T08:02:33Z,2022-05-18T14:48:18Z,"While using the Capella bundle as a repository to build another product, I get the following error:

> 14:54:16 [ERROR] An error occurred while transferring artifact canonical: osgi.bundle,org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.richtext,1.2.0.201711021145 from repository https://MyCustomMirroBasedOnCapellaProduct5.1.0:

> 14:54:16 [ERROR] Internal error: org.eclipse.tycho.repository.local.MirroringArtifactProvider$MirroringFailedException: Could not mirror artifact osgi.bundle,org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.richtext,1.2.0.201711021145 into the local Maven repository.See log output for details. The file ""org/eclipse/nebula/widgets/richtext/resources/template.html"" in the jar ""/tmp/signatureFile7108071569084742198.jar"" has been tampered! -> [Help 1]

> 14:54:16 org.apache.maven.InternalErrorException: Internal error: org.eclipse.tycho.repository.local.MirroringArtifactProvider$MirroringFailedException: Could not mirror artifact osgi.bundle,org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.richtext,1.2.0.201711021145 into the local Maven repository.See log output for details.
Capella builds alter the content of this jar at build time : some html templates are modified to correct a compatibility issue with IE/Edge.

This done in the _create_dropins_ execution of _maven-antrun-plugin_ from [Capella RCP Product pom](https://github.com/eclipse/capella/blob/master/releng/plugins/org.polarsys.capella.rcp.product/pom.xml):
<!-- Modify Nebula Richtext's template to fix IE compatibility bug. To remove if Nebula patches this -->
The alteration of the html/jar should be mentioned somewhere (I did not look for this).

The product signatures files might maybe be modified to correspond to what it provided in the RCP. (The modification should maybe be done before the package phase in the local tp/repo and not after the construction of the bundle.
Does this modification correspond to an open bug on Nebula ?

Having the current messages might let think that some corruption has occurred after the build. ","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2235/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

the nebula issue https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=521983 has been fixed in the meantime, so this pom.xml fix can be cleaned up.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w842cmd7/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2303,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2303,capella,1099034361,2303,Add computed transitions in M&S diagrams,nlepine,3184827,,,CLOSED,2022-01-11T11:26:48Z,2022-04-07T08:08:59Z,"As computed links functionality in Architecture Blank diagrams, add computed transitions in M&S diagrams. It displays transitions when sub regions, sub states or sub modes are hidden.
* Expected: They are hidden. The transitions from or to them are also hidden.
* Expected: ""Computed transitions"" are visible. They appear from or to the parent of the hidden modes.
* Expected: They are hidden. The transitions from or to them are also hidden.
* Expected: ""Computed transitions"" are visible. They appear from or to the parent of the hidden modes.
* Expected: The computed transitions are hidden.
* Expected: The computed transitions are visible.
* Expected: The hidden elements are visible with ""transparency"".
* Expected: They are visible. The transitions from or to them are also visible. The computed transitions are always visible.

* Expected: Corresponding ""computed transitions"" are no longer visible.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85BC06G/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2304,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2304,capella,1099036157,2304,"In Semantic Browser, add ""Involved Activities"" category for ""Operational Capability""",nlepine,3184827,,,CLOSED,2022-01-11T11:28:41Z,2022-04-07T08:07:25Z,"In Semantic Browser, add ""Involved Activities"" category for ""Operational Capability""","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2304/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2316,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2316,capella,1108580548,2316,Description editor is broken on Linux,vik378,8280844,Viktor K.,,OPEN,2022-01-19T21:30:59Z,2024-07-16T05:35:42Z,"Since a while we noticed that description editor on Linux is broken. Our current solution to that is downgrading some system libs (listed below). That temporary fix however will stop working soon as the downgraded packages may become incompatible with the rest of the OS.
This is how a broken description editor looks like on Ubuntu 20.04:
This is the list of packages and versions where the editor is still working:
And here is the stack trace:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: file:///home/.../apps/capella-5.2.0%20.202111301257/capella/plugins/org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.richtext_1.2.0.201711021145/org/eclipse/nebula/widgets/richtext/resources/template.html:213:50: ReferenceError: Can't find variable: getAllOptions
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86_64, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Can you try by using the latest stable Capella 6.0 ?
We have upgraded some internal components, maybe it will work properly.

(Note that this release is not yet officially published)","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w848tzk_/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2316,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w848t6U3,capella,1018668343,2316,NA,vik378,8280844,Viktor K.,,NA,2022-01-21T16:32:41Z,2022-01-21T16:32:41Z,"I tried it on Ubuntu 20.04, @pdulth , the result is slightly different:
on the first start I had the below (no editor loaded, similar stack trace to above)
however after restarting Capella the editor is loaded. The save button doesn't seem to work (can not set event handler issue I guess), but Ctrl+S does the trick.

I was able to reproduce the failure to initialize again - on a clean workspace. It fails with the same message `ReferenceError: Can't find variable: getAllOptions`. Loading the workspace where that failure happened before results in editor loading with warnings only as in screenshots above. `ReferenceError` gives some hope that it is not a fundamental GTK compatibility issue, right?

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2316,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w854Qe1y,capella,2017586546,2316,NA,MoritzWeber0,23395732,Moritz Weber,,NA,2024-03-25T09:38:48Z,2024-03-25T09:38:48Z,"Since this continues to be a major problem for us and continues to occur all the time, I've investigated that in more detail and found that the issue comes from Eclipse/Nebula:
It was fixed with Eclipse version 4.24.
Unfortunately, the latest release (Capella 6.1.0) is still based on Eclipse 4.20.
I tested it with the pre-release of Capella 7.0.0 and the bug is fixed, the previously broken description editor just works again ðŸ¥³

Is there any release date for a Capella 7.0.0? If it's not planned to release it soon, is there any chance to backport Eclipse 4.24 or 4.27 to Capella 6.0.0 or 6.1.0?","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w854Qe1y/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2316,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w854RFIF,capella,2017743365,2316,NA,jeffallen,1131456,Jeff Allen,,NA,2024-03-25T11:05:20Z,2024-03-25T11:05:20Z,cc @mumbricht who is also suffering from this problem and would like a release to fix it.,"{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w854RFIF/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

There is also remaining work for documentation and Capella addons.

we also suffer from the same issue and request a backport Eclipse 4.24 or 4.27 to Capella 6.0.0 and 6.1.0 as bugfix release.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2319,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2319,capella,1114862659,2319,Incorrect message displayed when workspace is already in use when capella product is launching,jessymallet,24290600,Jessy Mallet,,CLOSED,2022-01-26T10:29:59Z,2022-05-18T14:48:28Z,"**Description of the problem :**

After launching Capella product on a workspace already in use, a new popup is displayed. This popup informs user that the chosen workspace is currently in use.  This message contains an error. Indeed the localisation of the workspace is not replaced in the message, we just have argument ""{0}"".
The message _IDEApplication_workspaceInUseMessage_ is used without format (argument ""{0}"" is so not replaced).
1- Launch capella product on a workspace
2- Launch again capella product on the same workspace

3- A popup is displayed with wrong message","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2319/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2321,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2321,capella,1119519103,2321,Update tip and tricks for title blocks,pdulth,34767327,Philippe DUL,,CLOSED,2022-01-31T14:41:49Z,2022-05-18T14:48:29Z,"With new enhancement on Sirius side, the current tip and tricks to move a block is now useless.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2323,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2323,capella,1119660599,2323,Adapt Semantic Browser view according to a Sirius selection behavior change,lredor,1825882,Laurent Redor,,CLOSED,2022-01-31T16:36:05Z,2022-05-18T14:48:30Z,"An improvement is in progress on Sirius side concerning the selection changes done during a drag and drop or during a reconnect (bugzilla [578436](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=578436) - 2 refreshes are done for the listening views during a drag'n'drop of an element in a Sirius diagram editor).

With this improvement (currently in review), the Semantic Browser view will no longer be refreshed after a drag'n'drop. As consequence, the information displayed in this view could be inconsistence. For example, after a drag'n'drop of an element from a container to another, the displayed parent would be wrong.
The view must be adapted to change the refresh condition.
* Create a new ""Operational Activity Interaction Blank"" diagram under ""Root Operational Activity""
* Create 2 Operational activities: OA1 and OA2 on the diagram
* Create 1 Operational activity: OA3 in OA1
* Expected: In ""Current Element"" section, the parent is OA1.
* Expected1: With improvement of Sirius, there is no longer a ""blink effect"", ie temporary selection of the diagram.
* Expected2: After the drag'n'drop, in ""Current Element"" section, the parent is OA2.

* Observed: in ""Current Element"" section, the parent is always OA1.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2323/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2340,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2340,capella,1139703565,2340,Richtext Editor - Image Copy-Paste is broken on Linux since the Nebula 2.3.0 update,florianbarbin,7601213,Florian Barbin,,OPEN,2022-02-16T08:41:37Z,2022-02-16T10:54:36Z,"Since Capella updated the Nebula version from 1.4.0 to 2.3.0, the copy paste of an image from the system clipboard to the Description editor does not work on Linux.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2388,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2388,capella,1224304970,2388,Missing SLF4J implementation plugin in Capella products ?,mPorhel,1019672,Maxime Porhel,maxime.porhel@obeo.fr,CLOSED,2022-05-03T16:08:33Z,2022-05-18T14:45:56Z,"When launching capellac.exe -console -consoleLog the following error/warning appears in the Windows command line window:
SLF4J: Defaulting to no-operation (NOP) logger implementation
SLF4J api plugin is bundled in Capella:
It seems that the SLF4J logs comes from the fact that there is no implementation plugin.
This is reproductible directly with Capella (capellac.exe -consoleLog to see this in the console, this not written in .log which is available in ""selectedWorkspaceLoc""/.metadata/.log)

The first item of https://www.slf4j.org/codes.html mentions that those messages would be displayed if Capella would contain the slf4j-nop.jar plugin. They might also have to move to a more recent version.

> This warning, i.e. not an error, message is reported when no SLF4J providers could be found on the class path. Placing one (and only one) of slf4j-nop.jar slf4j-simple.jar, slf4j-log4j12.jar, slf4j-jdk14.jar or logback-classic.jar on the class path should solve the problem. Note that these providers must target slf4j-api 1.8 or later.
> In the absence of a provider, SLF4J will default to a no-operation (NOP) logger provider.

> Please note that slf4j-api version 1.8.x and later use the ServiceLoader mechanism. Earlier versions relied on the static binder mechanism which is no longer honored by slf4j-api. Please read the FAQ entry What has changed in SLF4J version 1.8.0? for further important details.

> If you are responsible for packaging an application and do not care about logging, then placing slf4j-nop.jar on the class path of your application will get rid of this warning message. Note that embedded components such as libraries or frameworks should not declare a dependency on any SLF4J providers but only depend on slf4j-api. When a library declares a compile-time dependency on a SLF4J provider, it imposes that provider on the end-user, thus negating SLF4J's purpose.
But on the other way, even on 6.0, several components from the platform references 1.7.30 version :
Eclipse 2021-06 Java IDE packages contain ch.qos.logback.slf4j_1.2.3.v20200428-2012

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2395,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2395,capella,1235258352,2395,Performance regression around RotativeImageEditPart in Capella 6.0,lredor,1825882,Laurent Redor,,CLOSED,2022-05-13T13:39:31Z,2022-09-14T14:26:03Z,"Because of a regression detected in a T4C perfomance test, I had launch a Yourkit session to compare T4C 5.2.0 and T4C 6.0.0. The regression concerns the opening time of a ""big"" diagram. After analysis, it seems that the cause is some changes made on RotativeImageEditPart.

In T4C 5.2.0, the method org.eclipse.sirius.ui.business.internal.dialect.DialectUIManagerImpl.openEditor(Session, DRepresentation, IProgressMonitor) takes 66% of org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.runnable.OpenRepresentationsRunnable.run(IProgressMonitor).

In T4C 6.0.0, the same method takes 73%. In Yourkit, we can observe that 7% are for RotativeImageEditPart. These ""elements"" do not appear in 5.2.0. So we can deduce that the perfomance problem is caused by the changes about RotativeImageEditPart in Capella/Kitalpha.

For information, there is 1264 border nodes in the concerned diagram (""BigPhysicalPAB3""). I have not added the use case projects because there are big. I can send it (in private) if you want (projects compatible with 5.2.0 and 6.0.0).
), shall be longer but not blocker as before.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2434,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2434,capella,1317600938,2434,Moving model elements in the project explorer with the mouse can lead to inconsistent models,stephanelacrampe,43188260,,,OPEN,2022-07-26T02:09:32Z,2022-08-17T19:12:03Z,"Hi there,

This is a tricky one, so I created a video for this one. I did it with Physical Components, but this behavior happens with any model element and in all engineering perspectives as long as you have the right to move an element to the root of the structure.

Description: Let's say you have PC1 and PC2 contained in PC1. If you take PC2 with your mouse from the project explorer to drop it on the ""top-level Physical Component - by default, the ""Physical System"""", it would usually work nicely and put PC1 under the Physical System as intended. But if you drop the element in the top part of the label of your Physical System, then it will actually put it at the same level as the Physical System, which is forbidden in Capella. Once you're in this state, you will see some odd behaviors in Capella (see video for some examples).

I believe this bug is linked to the feature where you can re-order modeling elements with your mouse in the project explorer. Just a guess here.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2434/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2449,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2449,capella,1346084671,2449,Customize Double Click on FunctionalChain and Scenario elements,arnauddieumegard,1576016,Arnaud Dieumegard,,CLOSED,2022-08-22T09:17:29Z,2023-03-09T10:38:39Z,"In this issue, we modify the Double Click behavior on the following **semantic elements**:
- FunctionalChain refers to OperationalProcess, FunctionalChain, PhysicalPath elements
- Scenario refers to all scenarios available in any architecture level

Default Double Click behavior on Scenario and Functional Chain opens the Properties Dialog for the element. This default behavior shall be adapted to open related diagram if it exist and is unique, if not unique, open a dialog to select the diagram to open, if not existing open the diagram creation dialog (if multiple possibilities of creation then adapt the creation dialog to select the kind of diagram to create).

This default behavior shall be accessible on all views, explorers, diagrams displaying the related **semantic elements**. This means that diagram elements referencing the **semantic elements** shall also implement this double click behavior: for example scenario references (in scenario diagrams, explorers and views), and ""Functional Chain Reference"" and ""Functional Chain Use"" (in XFCD, XAB diagrams, others ?).
Default behavior being overridden, provide a Capella preference to get back the original behavior.

The ""diagram"" decoration ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1576016/185882025-9e0ac8c5-7679-428a-bea5-fb0c28d57ffb.png) is not displayed in all diagram elements for which a diagram is available, when modifying the Double Click behavior of a diagram element, if a diagram is available then ensure that this decoration is available.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2465,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2465,capella,1366268222,2465,Migration issue with collapse border nodes,florianbarbin,7601213,Florian Barbin,,CLOSED,2022-09-08T12:54:24Z,2022-09-14T14:23:04Z,"The migration introduced in SIrius by https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=576423 fixes inconsistency between GMF size and computed size for workspace image nodes.
This migration mishandles the collapse case: when migrating a Capella model containing collapsed ports from 5.2 to 6.0, collapsed ports are revealed with transparency.
To avoid waiting for a new sirius release, we will replace the migration participant in Capella.
The fix will be reverted as soon as Capella will be based on the next Sirius version.
* Import the use case LevelCrossingTrafficControl in https://download.eclipse.org/capella/samples/5.2.0/
* Migrate the project to the current version
* Open PUBLI [PDFB] Decomposition of the function Activate the crossing or [PAB] Behavioral components and implementation
* The collapsed ports are visible with a partial opacity.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2480,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2480,capella,1376594911,2480,Memory Leak of an Image when opening the properties popup,SteveMonnier,11756121,,steve.monnier@obeo.fr,OPEN,2022-09-16T23:52:58Z,2022-09-16T23:52:58Z,"When double-clicking on a diagram element, it opens a Dialog with the properties of the element. Once the dialog is closed, there is one image that is not disposed. After some time, this will cause an SWTException : no more handle
- Edit a launch config, go to the ""tracing"" tab, enable tracing. On the left panel, select and check org.eclipse.ui. On the right panel, check ""debug"" and ""trace/graphics""
- Open a diagram with diagram elements
- Press the ""Snap"" button and notice the ""Images"" count
- Back on the diagram, double click on a diagram element. Once the dialog is displayed, close it.

- In the Sleak view, press the ""Snap"" button again -> The image count should not increase by 1 each time the dialog is opened/closed","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2480/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2490,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2490,capella,1387253845,2490,Functional Exchange looping on the same function,irina-toma,55532987,,,CLOSED,2022-09-27T07:24:36Z,2023-03-09T10:29:08Z,"- A FE cannot be created between two ports on the same function using the diagram interactor, yet using a drag and drop, or a direct edition using the expert tab of the property box allows it
- When we create this looping FE, it disappears from the diagram

- There isn't a validation to detect this pattern in the model","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2490/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

using the `Export representations as images` to export diagrams as SVGs can lead to erroneous container elements in this SVG. This is normally not a problem for Document Viewers (for e.g. chrome (I suppose PDF.js) or [Evince](https://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Evince)) except Adobe Acrobat Reader which is pretty popular and exposed this problem in the first place. All content that follows such a faulty SVG won't be rendered anymore while using Adobe Acrobat Reader. I also submitted a thread in the [Adobe Support Community](https://community.adobe.com/t5/acrobat-reader-discussions/adobe-acrobat-reader-errors-on-svgs-with-stroke-miterlimit/m-p/13248873#M94625).
font-style=""normal"" height=""580"" stroke-width=""1"" stroke-dashoffset=""0"" font-weight=""normal"" stroke-opacity=""1"">
<!--Generated by the Batik Graphics2D SVG Generator-->

The problem is the invalid value ""0"" for [stroke-miterlimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-miterlimit#usage_context). This has no effect in when `stroke-linejoin` isn't set to `miter`, which is the case here: `stroke-linejoin=""round""`.
We added an additional step in our SVG postprocessing that removes this attribute. I just wanted to inform you about this bug.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2504,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2504,capella,1414491713,2504,Wrong position of new lines and columns in TitleBlock when diagram is unsynchronized,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,CLOSED,2022-10-19T07:58:08Z,2023-03-09T10:38:52Z,"When diagram is unsynchronized
Inserting a new line or a new column in a TitleBlock will always insert it at the end (inserted at the bottom for a line, inserted at the right for a column)
When synchronizing the diagram and refreshing, the newly created lines and columns appear at the place where they were initially inserted

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2511,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2511,capella,1453033532,2511,Generalize filter categories from REC/RPL and transitions diffmerge dialogs to view filter in Project Explorer,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,CLOSED,2022-11-17T09:48:24Z,2023-03-09T10:38:54Z,"In REC/RPL and transition diffmerge dialogs, specific category filters exist which are not present in other diffmerge editors / dialogs.
These filters deal with Capella elements, in the ""Semantic Criteria"" category
Most of them are not covered by a filter in the Capella Project Explorer (or they may be, but with a broader filter)
It is intended to remove those specific filter categories and generalize them to filters in the project explorer.
There is already an issue opened in diff merge (https://github.com/eclipse/org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.core/issues/254)

One of its subissue deals with providing a solution to create , in all diffmerge dialogs and editors with a capella context, a copy of each project explorer viewer filter but as a diffmerge category filter, providing the same filtering capability in both project explorer and diffmerge.
For this reason, it was decided to add these specific filters as common filters in the project explorer.
Step 2 : Create their equivalent as Project explorer filters
Step 3: Align default filters in a Diffmerge Capella Context, with filters from the Project Explorer
(and NOT their default values -> the new filters shall all be disabled by default)
Some filters are not relevant and should not be created as category filter, such as :
This creation can be made automatically (scanning all visible filters from project explorer)
- test that the category filters are properly populated
TODO : Update documentation for REC/RPL and transition
Align Left, Align Center, Align Top, Align Middle menu tools do not work as expected.
Example of issue is shown in the attached image.
While working in SDFB, imported and selected a group of Functions which needed to be aligned.

Current behavior seems to be to do the same alignment action for Align Left, Align Middle and Align Right, and similarly, Align Top, Align Middle and Align Bottom act in result in the same alignment action.
This alignment behavior is also seen in other diagram types.
**Align Left**: Align the left edge of each element to the left edge of the element farthest left
**Align Center**: Align the center of each element to the center-point of the element distribution
**Align Top**: Align the top edge of each element to the top edge of the topmost element
**Align Middle**: Align the midpoint of each element to the midpoint of the element distribution
**Align Right**: Align the right edge of each element to the right edge of the element farthest right - seems to work OK but may need checking.
**Align Bottom**: Align the bottom edge of each element to the bottom edge of the bottommost element - seems to work OK but may need checking.

I have just done as fast test on my side (macOS Ventura 13.1 on an Intel-based MacBookPro):

- I do. not have the crash but only the loading errors/attempts on Capella 6.0 releases and the last stable build of Capella 6.1 (consistent behavior are they are based on the same Eclipse Platform / Java / RichText
- In my dev environnement, with the Capella target platform from master branch and a runtime, I have the RichText editor working fine.

- With a 5.2 release of Capella: when trying to display the ""Description"" tab in Properties view or on double clic on an element to see the ""Properties wizard"" --> Capella 5.2 crashes with no error in logs
I did not noticed this issue before.
Please find below the concern I would like to raise about Capella
Thanks by advance about any help

When deallocating an exchange item from an interface, meaning deleting its instance there, some mechanism leads to erase the exchange item name. This EI may continue to be used elsewhere, especially when reallocating functions, the FE allocating this EI is reallocated by a new CE. This requires to adjust the relevant interfaces contents. Pending on the process used to do it, it may be automated or manual: manual deallocation causes EI name loss, I suspect that assisted (quick fix) does as well, and I wonder when automated, by transforming again scenarios to ES behavior and IS after changes.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2539/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2598,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2598,capella,1596516370,2598,Capella Model Explorer displays a useless and hard to read node when resources are added to a Capella session,ldelaigue,900728,Laurent Delaigue,,CLOSED,2023-02-23T09:36:17Z,2024-04-09T13:22:25Z,"If an additional EMF resource is added to a Capella session, manually or contributed by an add-on,
then the Capella model explorer displays a weird node with
* A label that is not human readable, like ```[org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EPackageImpl@542113fe (name: ), nsPrefix: null)]```
* This label is actually the result of toString() invoked on a List (a ```ContentsEList```)
This problem comes from the CapellaNavogatorContentExplorer#getChildren(Object) method:
At some point, the contents of the additional resource is added to a list 'others', with the intent to properly sort the elements within the Capella model tree:
Unfortunately, this code adds a List within the 'others' list, instead of adding the list elements to the 'others' list.
The intent was probably to add the elements, which could be implemented that way:

This is a screenshot of the problem (with a dummy empty ecore resource added, just for the sake of the example)","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85V6uTF/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2603,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2603,capella,1601016692,2603,Capella 6.0.0 management of images embedded in Description property affecting M2Doc and Git,mc2172,96718742,Pier Giorgio Esposito,,OPEN,2023-02-27T11:40:17Z,2023-03-02T08:23:04Z,"Capella 6.0 stores images embededd in Description as external files instead of encoding them.
This design choice causes the following drawbacks:

1. Images absolute path causes M2doc to fail  including them in the generated document, because it relies upon relative paths. Manual editing of the HTML is therefore needed, by removing absolute paths
1. If the project is under version control, e.g. by Git, failure to add new images to git causes broken images when checking out the project.
With regards to HTML editing, in-place editing of HTML source would be really helpful, when polishing of HTML is needed, especially while pasting text from external sources.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2621,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2621,capella,1620557123,2621,Problem with running Capella on macOS 12.6.3,stanislaw,452547,Stanislav Pankevich,s.pankevich@gmail.com,OPEN,2023-03-12T23:50:46Z,2023-03-17T17:58:04Z,"Hello everyone,
I am very new to Capella, so I apologize if I missed an important installation step. I am reporting my problem here, guided by the Wiki page: https://github.com/eclipse/capella/wiki/Repositories.

I am downloading Capella for macOS from both [this page](https://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/capella/core/products/releases/6.0.0/capella-6.0.0.202209090800-macosx-cocoa-x86_64.tar.gz) and [this page](https://download.eclipse.org/capella/core/products/stable/6.1.0-S20230214/).
The result of running both macOS applications is seen on the screenshot. The German text says: ""Capella is broken and cannot be open. It is recommended to move the object to Trash."".

I have found [another report](https://forum.mbse-capella.org/t/installation-issue-mac-osx/3873) where it is suggested that one has to make the Capella binary executable (`chmod +x`). I have done that, but the outcome is still the same.

Can anyone advise me what should I do to solve the problem? Thank you in advance for reading this.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2621/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
- move the extracted Capella (Capella.app) in the folder of your choice,
- open a terminal and execute a cd to this folder
- then you can double clik on Capella application to launch it.

The Capella installation guide already contains a note about this: [How to install Capella and Addons > Mac](https://github.com/eclipse/capella/blob/master/doc/plugins/org.polarsys.capella.ui.doc/html/Installation%20Guide/How%20to%20install%20Capella%20and%20Addons.mediawiki#user-content-Mac)

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2624,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2624,capella,1627491372,2624,Diagrams in hyperlink not resolved when diagram has not been loaded yet (Team context),etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,CLOSED,2023-03-16T13:36:42Z,2023-04-27T10:30:22Z,"In description field,

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2625,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2625,capella,1627498501,2625,Label of hyperlink referencing a model element or a diagram is always invalid if a chain of spaces characters is present,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,CLOSED,2023-03-16T13:41:01Z,2023-04-27T10:30:23Z,"In Description

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2634,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2634,capella,1649227538,2634,Optimize Capella validation,lfasani,12660743,,,CLOSED,2023-03-31T11:55:34Z,2024-04-09T13:22:26Z,"A lot of time is spent iterating on the model during the Validation of the Capella model:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2642,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2642,capella,1666416728,2642,Using Activity Explorer to transition Logical Capabilities to Physical Capabilities does not detect any capability,ldelaigue,900728,Laurent Delaigue,,CLOSED,2023-04-13T13:24:04Z,2024-04-09T13:22:26Z,"Steps to reproduce:
- Use a Capella model with some Capability Realizations in the Logical Layer's 'Capabilities' package
- Use the Activity Explorer, in Physical Architecture tab, choose Enrich Physical Scenarios > Perform an automated transition of Logical Architecture Capabilities
This causes an empty diff/merge dialog to pop-up, where no Capability is present and thus nothing can be transitioned.
- Doing the same from System Architecture to Logical Architecture works as expected
- Using the right-click menu 'Transition > Functional Transition' on the Logical Architecture's Capabilities packages works as expected
the ""Perform an automated transition of Logical Architecture Capabilities"" action is wired on a transition from System Analysis
Whereas the ""Transition > Capabilities"" is wired on the selection's block architecture (logical system in our case)

Needs more investigation to check if that's an expected behavior, or if we are missing a specific handler to transition from logical to physical ","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85Z1Eaa/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2644,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2644,capella,1668346328,2644,Add quick fix to remove missing image from diagram,scosta-obeo,128719897,,,CLOSED,2023-04-14T14:20:56Z,2023-10-31T08:52:17Z,"**Capella Version**: 6.1.0, Build id: 202303230910

Create new quick fix to remove images not found in diagram (element with workspace image style) for error of `Validate Model` (I_46) and `Validate Diagram` actions.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2644/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
- Open diagram `[OCB] Operational Capabilities` (in Representations per category/Operational Analysis/Operational Capabilities Blank)
- **Expected:** You can see two element with image not found
- Right-click on diagram background, `Validate Model`, press OK
- **Expected:** In Information view, you can see 2 error in Capella/Integrity
- For both error, right-click, `Quick Fix`, `Remove missing Image`
- **Expected:** You can see `OA 1` is a rectangle and `OperationalCapability 1` is ellipse with text `OC`

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2656,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2656,capella,1745522360,2656,Creating diagrams stopped working on fragmented models [Linux 6.X.0],MoritzWeber0,23395732,Moritz Weber,,CLOSED,2023-06-07T10:03:56Z,2023-09-07T10:26:17Z,"With Capella versions 6.0.0 and 6.1.0, no diagrams can be created anymore on fragmented models with the Linux package.
- Fragment a layer, e.g. Operational Analysis
Nothing happens and the error message in the error log is: ""Unhandled event loop exception"" with the following stack trace:

java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke ""org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.getDisplay()"" because the return value of ""org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.FilteredItemsSelectionDialog.access$0(org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.FilteredItemsSelectionDialog)"" is null
We reproduced the issue on multiple Linux devices, also with fresh workspaces. We could not reproduce it with the macOS archive, everything works fine there.

With Capella version 5.2.0, the feature works as expected (also for Linux packages), so the bug has been introduced in version 6.0.0. This is the dialog which appears for version 5.2.0, but it doesn't for 6.X.0:
Interesting enough, it works for TeamForCapella models. For TeamForCapella models, the dialog shows up:

This is an important feature for users within our organisation and has worked before. Is there a chance to provide a patch in the short-term? Thanks for a reply in advance.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2656/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
which does not reuse the shell from its parameters but call Display.getDefault().getActiveShell() which returns null in some cases  in Linux.

java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraint violation for class org.eclipse.elk.graph.text.ui.ElkGraphExecutableExtensionFactory: when selecting overriding method 'com.google.inject.Injector

org.eclipse.elk.graph.text.ui.ElkGraphExecutableExtensionFactory, and the class loader org.eclipse.osgi.internal.loader.EquinoxClassLoader @6106e3e for its super type org.eclipse.xtext.ui.guice.AbstractGuiceAwareExecutableExtensionFactory have different Class objects for the type com.google.inject.Injector used in the signature (org.eclipse.elk.graph.text.ui.ElkGraphExecutableExtensionFactory is in unnamed module of loader org.eclipse.osgi.internal.loader.EquinoxClassLoader @5d6ffae0, parent loader 'platform'; org.eclipse.xtext.ui.guice.AbstractGuiceAwareExecutableExtensionFactory is in unnamed module of loader org.eclipse.osgi.internal.loader.EquinoxClassLoader @6106e3e, parent loader 'platform')
In Capella TP `com.google.inject` is found in two versions: `5.0.1` and `3.0.0`

The issue comes from the fact that there is two versions of this plugin. We are in the case where two dependency plugin paths lead to the usage of two different versions of {{com.google.inject}}(A uses ""com.google.inject v1"" and B and B uses  ""com.google.inject v2"")
Among, the features included in the Capella TP, only {{org.eclipse.viatra}} uses the old 3.0.1 version.
Note that viatra is not included in the Capella product.
* It is is in the Capella TP, so we have the issue in dev environment.
* It is also present in `org.polarsys.capella.viatra.core.feature` so we would have the issue as soon as this feature is installed.
* remove Capella viatra feature(which I guess is not acceptable :) ). Nevertheless, I am asking the question: do you intend to keep this feature. What is it used for?

I have a similar issue, but for me it was not possible to restore it by re-opening Capella nor by a fresh install. I cannot create Physical Architecture Diagrams or Physical Component Breakdown Diagrams, both give me unhandled event loop exception in one of my projects. It does not occure in another project, which seems strange, since I expected it to be not an issue on project site.
I am using Capella 6.1.0 on Windows 10.
java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke ""org.eclipse.sirius.viewpoint.description.RepresentationDescription.getName()"" because ""description"" is null

My colleague and I found a workaround by using the Sirius Model Explorer. The right click menu of the Physical Architecture in the Project Explorer also does not offer the possibility to add the PAB, but in the Sirius Model Explorer it is possible to add it on Physical System -> New Representation -> Other. After doing this, the diagram is added and it is also possible to add all other diagrams, which didn't work before. All menus behave as normal after doing this.

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2660,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w86ZC15H,capella,2567659079,2660,NA,ewuerger,50786483,Ernst WÃ¼rger,,NA,2025-01-02T11:51:55Z,2025-01-02T11:51:55Z,"> @ewuerger did fresh install resolve the issue, as @etraisnel2 suggested? I am facing the exact same symptoms, both running _Capella_ locally and in a container (from @dsd-dbs/capella-dockerimages)
I am experiencing the same symptoms as initially described, both when running **Capella** locally and in a container (from `@dsd-dbs/capella-dockerimages`).
- **v7.0.0-202407091438**: Latest stable version (fresh download on Ubuntu 22.04)
The issue persists across both scenarios.
Using `Instantiate RPL from REC` on a `PhysicalComponent` marked with `[REC]` works as expected:
- A replicate is created and marked with `[RPL]`.
- The corresponding trace is added to the REC Catalog.
- Deleting the replicate requires manual removal from the REC Catalog (tedious but expected behavior).
Using `Instantiate RPL from REC` on an **existing** `PhysicalComponent` causes:
- Multiple **Unhandled event loop exceptions** caused by a **NullPointerException** (similar to the stack trace shared by `@OhItsHarry`).
- Requires a restart to regain functionality.
After a restart, attempting `Instantiate RPL from REC` again on the same `PhysicalComponent`:
- Selecting the REC and confirming (`OK`) creates a replica as a child component.

- However, this does not align with the intended use case of applying a REC to an existing component while retaining relationships and properties but overwriting content based on the REC. I guess this isn't covered at all by Capella yet.
The operation should not crash Capella.
An operation for applying a REC to an existing component retaining relationships and properties, except the ones defined in the REC.
java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot read field ""alpha"" because ""gdkRGBA"" is null

> Using the Sirius Model Explorer, it is possible to add representations (e.g., PAB) under Physical System -> New Representation -> Other. This restores functionality for adding diagrams and interacting with menus normally.
- This workaround does not restore the Activity Explorer for me.
- However, manual modeling tasks like opening diagrams and changing properties work.

Hope this clarifies and helps to reproduce the issue. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2666,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2666,capella,1776388498,2666,"Exception when using ""delete"" on representation categories",Kellindil,661592,Laurent Goubet,laurent.goubet@obeo.fr,OPEN,2023-06-27T08:37:40Z,2023-06-27T09:37:19Z,"In any project, select the ""category"" of a diagram within the ""Representations per category"" folder:
Then hit the ""delete"" key (or right-click > Delete).
Caused by: org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: The Editing Domain must be not null and must be a Transactional one
I've taken a look at it.
The exception is thrown because there is no execution manager nor transactional editing domain.
The execution manager is deduced from TransactionHelper.getExecutionManager(selection)
on the actual selection, where any element that isn't an EObject is filtered out.
The item you tried to delete is a org.eclipse.sirius.ui.tools.internal.views.common.item.RepresentationDescriptionItemImpl
which isn't an EObject, hence resulting in an empty selection
A fix could be to handle these cases and to delete all the Representations contained inside of it

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2673,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2673,capella,1790693799,2673,Allocation of component exchanges to a Physical Path in PA does not work when using an Actor (without a behaviour),carl-owen,30802125,,,OPEN,2023-07-06T02:45:55Z,2024-04-13T07:37:25Z,"When attempting to allocate component exchanges to a Physical Path within the Physical Architecture no component exchanges are shown within the dialog as shown in the below screenshot

Performing the same process at the logical level using Logical Components and Physical links to the Logical System works as expected with the physical path component exchange dialog showing the appropriate component exchange.
1. (within the PA) Create a Physical Node (PC 1) and associated Behaviour (PC 2)
3. Create a component exchange between the PA 1 and PC 2 (C 2)
5. Create a Physical Link between PC 1 and PC 3 (PL 1)
6. Create a Physical Link between PA 1 and PC 3 (PL 2)
7. Create a Physical Path using PA 1, PL1, PC 3, PL2 and PC 2 (Physical Path 1)
8. Open the properties for Physical Path 1 and select ""..."" on Component Exchange Allocations
9. The Transfer dialog will be displayed however no Component Exchanges will be available for selection
At step 9 above the Component Exchange C 2 should be available for allocation to the Physical Path.
1. Deploy a Behaviour ""PC 4"" to the Physical Actor ""PA""
- This Behaviour is only needed temporarily and can later be hidden or deleted entirely.
2. Create the Component Exchange between ""PC 4"" and ""PC 2""
3. Open the properties for Physical Path 1 and select ""..."" on Component Exchange Allocations
4. The Transfer dialog will display the Component Exchange between PC 2 and PC 4
5. Allocate the Component Exchange to the Physical Path
6. Drag the Component Port from PC 4 to PA
* from the explorer, select and cut OAInner ans paste it on OA2
-> The pasted OAInner has dissapeared and is no longer in the model
-> KO In Capella, before 7.0, there is an error and no feedback in 7.0.
In T4C, there is a NPE, error when saving

Even if user closes its Session and reopen it, the data is lost","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2675/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2675,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85hTok6,capella,1632536890,2675,NA,lfasani,12660743,,,NA,2023-07-12T13:31:23Z,2023-07-12T13:31:23Z,"I make changes so that PasteCommandHelper uses a Recording command instead of AddCommand and SetCommand and it solves the issue.
I started to think if other part of Capella would have the same kind of issue.
So what happened precisely before the fix:
* With copy+paste+undo, an object is created and then added via AddCommand. At undo, AddCommand removes, the previously added objects. Then it works

* With cut+paste+undo, an existing object is added via AddCommand and because of EMF mechanism, it is automatically removed from where it was cut. At undo, AddCommand removes the previously added objects but nothing is done about the old owner of the cut objects. Then it failed.
So, for the rest of the Capella code, where AddCommand and SetCommand are used, if the objects being added or set are newly created objects, AddCommand and SetCommand will do the undo job properly
But, if the objects being added or set are existing objects, then the undo will fail.
So we need to detect the second case occurrences.

column1: The initial intention was to extend the scope of validated elements in diagrams.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2681,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2681,capella,1819290562,2681,[Capella properties] Bad concurrent modification,SteveMonnier,11756121,,steve.monnier@obeo.fr,CLOSED,2023-07-24T23:28:27Z,2023-08-02T21:49:13Z,"This issue has been created to update Capella widget concerning https://support.jira.obeo.fr/browse/DOREMI-4694

The ""Properties"" view displays Capella widgets (org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.properties.fields.AbstractSemanticField implementations) instead of Sirius widgets if the current selection is not in a Sirius editor (for instance selection in the ""Project Explorer"" view).

With Team for Capella, when a remote user (user2) locks a semantic element, the Capella widget are disabled so the other users (like user1) can't edit while it is remotely locked. Once unlock by the remote user (user2), for the other user the Capella widgets will be re-enabled. However, if user1 has not changed the selection, then the widget will be enabled but the displayed values will not have been updated from the semantic element. That is why this issue adds an update of the widget on the enablement of the widget.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2681/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2683,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2683,capella,1822565969,2683,NPE upon representation creation when missing associated viewpoint,flatombe,1379525,Florent Latombe,florent.latombe@obeo.fr,OPEN,2023-07-26T14:37:15Z,2023-07-26T14:39:58Z,"Version : capella-6.1.0.202303291413-win32-win32-x86_64
* Try to create some representations through the Activity Explorer, sometimes nothing happens, sometimes the following NPE is logged (e.g. when trying to create diagram CBD)
> java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke ""org.eclipse.sirius.viewpoint.description.RepresentationDescription.getName()"" because ""description"" is null
Workaround: right click on the aird file, 'Viewpoints selection' and enable some viewpoints.
Ideally the Activity Explorer should not suggest representations that are not available in the viewpoints selected for the project.

Another fix would be to have the Activity Explorer suggest enabling the viewpoint that provides the selected representation type.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2683/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
