issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2725,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2725,capella,1915576684,2725,EMF Diff/Merge produces broken links when resolving Git conflicts on fragmented models,Wuestengecko,1579756,Martin Lehmann,,OPEN,2023-09-27T13:20:25Z,2023-09-27T14:13:44Z,"Hi! I'm one of the engineers at DB, where we use Capella in different internal projects. In one of them, we encountered an interesting issue with the EMF Diff/Merge tool when it comes to Git merge conflicts in combination with fragmented models.

After performing the merge, some of the links that came in from ""their side"" (in git terminology) no longer use the correct relative workspace file paths. Instead, the link seems to point to somewhere in the git index, which - when opening the model afterwards - no longer exists.
We managed to reproduce the issue on [our public ""coffee machine"" demo model](https://github.com/DSD-DBS/coffee-machine). Compare the following working FunctionRealization:
With this non-working version after using the merge tool:

1. Make sure you have at least two fragments. In the demo model, we have fragmented out OA and SA, but in production we saw it in SAâ†’LA realizations as well (with all layers fragmented out). This is the `index-links/base` branch.

2. Also make sure you have a diagram in the airdfragment file that you'll later create the link in. In our model, we already have the ""[SAB] make coffee"" diagram, which is defined in SA.airdfragment.

3. For ""their side"" (the ""incoming changes""), open the ""[SAB] make coffee"" diagram and add a note to it (to provoke a conflict later). Create a new OperationalActivity (we called it ""make delicious drinks""), and add it to the ""realized functions"" of ""make coffee"". (This is the `index-links/right` branch.)

4. For ""our side"", simply change the same diagram as in the previous step. We did so by renaming ""make coffee"" to ""make black water"" and moving and resizing its box a little. (This is `index-links/left`.)

5. Make sure you're on ""our"" branch, and then merge ""their"" branch using the Capella GUI. The Git integration should inform you about the conflicts, and mark the airdfragment as a conflicted file in the project explorer.
6. Open EMF Diff/Merge by right clicking the conflicted airdfragment, then choosing Team > Merge Tool. Confirm the default settings.

7. Make sure to at least accept the new link (the FunctionRealization from step 3) that came in and should be therefore marked in blue. (If it's red, you need to switch branches and the merge the other way round.) Then ""ignore"" the name change, so that it stays ""make black water"" instead of reverting back to ""make coffee"". The other changes don't seem to matter at all, so you can simply accept everything from incoming. (This is `index-links/merged`.)
You should now have a Git history that looks similar to this:

(Use `git log --format=oneline --graph` to double check, and make sure that ""their changes"" come in from the right. The Repository History view in Capella ignores this ordering when drawing the graph.)
Importantly, ""our side"" and ""their side"" must be parallel branches that both have the base commit as their immediate and only parent commit.

When opening the model now and inspecting the ""make coffee"" / ""make black water"" SystemFunction (depending on whether you accepted ""our"" or ""their"" name), you'll notice that the ""realized functions"" says ""undefined"" instead of ""make delicious drinks"" again. When inspecting the XML, you will see a broken link with an `index:` prefix.

**Affected versions:** We successfully reproduced this on Capella 6.0 and 6.1, using the steps described above.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2725/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2725,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85njyyJ,capella,1737436297,2725,NA,vik378,8280844,Viktor K.,,NA,2023-09-27T13:46:45Z,2023-09-27T13:46:45Z,"Just a few more words regarding the effect / criticality of this issue - the effect is that almost all of the changes related to traceability (realization links) are broken silently. In Capella you will see that an object is realized by ""operational capability"" but that is it.

Diff/merge with git is essential functionality in our context and this issue currently endangers a few running projects that were not allowed to use Team4Capella - basically any project with strict change control requirements (under assumption that EMF diff/merge is a trustworthy core technology). We would love to see some root cause analysis and solution options as well as eager to help resolving this issue.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w85njyyJ/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2726,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2726,capella,1915669624,2726,Option to double-click a model element to navigate to a lower-level diagram,Epictetusx,146205145,Jay,,OPEN,2023-09-27T14:05:29Z,2023-09-27T14:05:29Z,"Add a double-click behaviour or an alternative click (ctrl+click or shift+click) behaviour on model elements to open a new diagram (representation).

For less experienced users, even with the Semantic Browser, navigation can be a challenge. The representation links were suggested, but I find they arenâ€™t very clean, and the option isnâ€™t easy to find if you donâ€™t already know about it. The semantic browser is great for familiar users, but it isnâ€™t the fastest or most intuitive for new users. Itâ€™s a behaviour that we are familiar with from other architecting tools, and itâ€™s a behaviour that people with no prior experience almost always seem to expect to happen right out of the box. When trying to convince people of the values of MBSE, Iâ€™m getting feedback like â€œSounds good! It would be great if we could double-click to zoom into the system.â€ I find that the user's mental model of the system already has this sort of object hierarchy, but the Eclipse Capella 6.1 does not support their mental model of the structural hierarchy.

For example, add a global settings toggle, or an individual properties window toggle, and a place to override the default â€˜open on double clickâ€™ diagram (or ctrl+click). Add a properties field or otherwise a place create the connection or the URL for the destination.

I suggest that Structural model elements redirect by default to lower level structural elements (e.g. LAB to PAB or PAB to PAB) and Behavioural model elements redirect to lower level behavioural elements (e.g. OC to an Exchange Scenario, or high level function to LDFB).","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2726/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2727,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2727,capella,1917296657,2727,"Operational Processes cannot be formed into a Loop, unlike Functional Chains",josh-kayak,146340923,,,OPEN,2023-09-28T11:25:40Z,2023-09-28T11:25:40Z,"Description of problem is discussed in this Forum post:

Regarding â€œloopsâ€ in Functional Chains, it is not possible to create them outside of Functional Chain Description diagram as the tool cannot know the starting and ending point of a Functional Chain if you have a loop. So it is possible to define them only in FCD for a good reason. This is the correct behaviour.

However, for Operational Processes, it is a missing feature (the creation of loops in description diagram). Loops cannot be created. issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2733,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2733,capella,1926473817,2733,Generated SVGs differ without any actual changes on the diagrams,ewuerger,50786483,Ernst WÃ¼rger,,OPEN,2023-10-04T15:22:34Z,2024-07-26T14:07:25Z,"Hi dear Capella devs,

I'm one of the engineers at DB, where we use Capella in different internal and public projects. I generated representations as SVG images via the option exposed by right-clicking on the `.aird` file. When I do this consecutive times without any changes on the diagrams the exported SVGs still differ. I don't even need to re-open the model or Capella.

As you can see the difference in the SVG is just about IDs of symbols or other decorative content, generated by the `Batik Graphics2D SVG Generator`. Therefore references on all other elements are also changed.

Change-Control is a task which can be very complex on its own. With this behavior we need to divide between non-visual and visual changes. The non-visual changes are false positives, triggering processes waiting for changes in diagrams. If you remove this behavior, we can focus on just Change-Control without any filtering of false positives.

I have not tested to confirm, but as the screenshot shows a SVG `symbol` element, this might be due to the use of `UUID.randomUUID()` [here](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-desktop/blob/master/plugins/org.eclipse.sirius.diagram.ui/src-diag/org/eclipse/sirius/diagram/ui/tools/internal/render/SVGImageRegistry.java) in Sirius (2 different locations in that class).

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2737,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2737,capella,1934958273,2737,Referencing a read-only library that was unreferenced may lead to library modification,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,CLOSED,2023-10-10T10:05:20Z,2024-04-09T13:22:38Z,"Steps to reproduce :
- Reference the library and sets it to read-only
- Create a new Class Diagram, displays the library ExchangeItem on it, and save
- delete the ExchangeItem on the diagram (impact dialog must popup)
- The exchangeItem has been deleted from the library
There is no way to forbid the deletion of the ExchangeItem, since the library isn't considered a library anymore
1 - if the session is dirty -> forbid
2 - if one of the resources in the resource set is dirty (meaning a library model was virtually changed) -> forbid and ask for restart
3 - If a user unreference a library, displays a warning to read the doc, and ensures he sees it with a popup when pressing ok

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2739,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2739,capella,1939351858,2739,Validation rule that checks if a Component Exchange is assigned to multiple PhysicalLinks,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,CLOSED,2023-10-12T07:12:33Z,2024-04-09T13:22:38Z,"Due to a difference of copy paste behaviour between the diagram editor and the project explorer, it is possible to have multiple PhysicalLinks allocating the same ComponentExchange
Diagram copy paste will only copy paste the edge representing the PL
Project explorer copy paste will copy the PL and its contents (which is a CE Allocation)
a Component Exchange shall be allocated to only one Physical Link
Quickfix : prompt for a physical allocation to keep, delete the others

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2752,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2752,capella,1967839133,2752,Project explorer automatically collapses on some actions,Kellindil,661592,Laurent Goubet,laurent.goubet@obeo.fr,OPEN,2023-10-30T08:55:08Z,2023-10-30T08:55:08Z,"The Capella Project Explorer often collapses the whole tree during work, forcing users to navigate back to the parts they were working on. When manipulating huge models, this is a really disruptive behavior as we need to find the elements we need again.

This seems to happen more often when using actions or wizards that modify the models (result of a diff/merge dialog when deleting elements, creating a REC, instantiating a RPL...). It also seems to be dependent on the selected element as we can see the automatic collapsing, but then Capella tries to re-reveal the selected object. The rest of the tree still ends up collapsed, which isn't ideal either as if it was expanded, it means it is a part we were working on.
This doesn't happen on every action, but this simple use case seems to allow 100% reproduction of the issue (the first time it is done):
* Create 3/4 Physical Components nested one into the other
* Expand the tree to reveal the deepest PC in the Project Explorer
* Expand the Logical Architecture and Structure package within it
* Right-click one of the 3/4 components in the PAB diagram
* Use the REC/RPL > Create REC > From Selection... action
* Click OK to complete the wizard, no need for any modification.

The  Project explorer still shows the content of the Physical Architecture, but the ""Structure"" package has been collapse so we need to manually reexpand everything to display our Physical Components.

Collapsing might not be avoidable as the model is modified by the action. However, it should remember all of the tree paths that were previously expanded and automatically restore its state when the paths still exist.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2752/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2757,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2757,capella,1975995448,2757,Capability Realization Involvement are not displayed,lfasani,12660743,,,CLOSED,2023-11-03T11:36:11Z,2024-04-09T13:22:40Z,"Steps to reproduce
KO: the Capability Realization Involvement is not displayed
The issue is that the `org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.analysis.ContextServices` is not registred because the java service is declared only in `context.odesign` (that correspond to system analysis)

So the fix is declare `ContextServices` also ni `common.odesign` where the edge is defined (so where ContextServices.getMBActorGeneralizationSemanticCandidates is used)","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2757/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2759,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2759,capella,1979082307,2759,Transitions between layers not working on a migrated project from Capella 5.2,dubeseb,149169830,,,OPEN,2023-11-06T12:53:50Z,2023-11-07T10:02:31Z,"For training purpose, we use a generic case study called Health Agriculture UAV (presented in a Capella Webinar). issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2780,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2780,capella,2049089554,2780,Quickfix to re-align direction of a Functional Exchange between different diagrams,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,OPEN,2023-12-19T17:07:05Z,2023-12-19T17:07:05Z,"There is no synchronization on representations of Functional Exchange, between a Sequence Diagram and the others (the other way around actually)
create a FE between F1 and F2
display the FE and all functions on a Function Scenario
in the SDFB , modify the FE, by moving the target port to F3
the change isn't updated on the FE
a validation rule exist DWF_DS_19 that finds incoherence between the 2 diagrams
Provide a QF to align the FE direction, so that source and target of the invoked operation are used for source and target of sequence messages
Provide a QF to do the other way around

Same check for all Scenarii in each phase, check for CE FE FC CM and Interactions","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2780/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2785,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2785,capella,2066998305,2785,Test Framework : ToolHelper doesn't provide all available tools,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,OPEN,2024-01-05T09:21:21Z,2024-01-05T09:21:21Z,"Seen with https://github.com/eclipse/capella/issues/2783
ReconnectTool are owned by a iagram but they are associated to a mapping
the tool can be in a given diagram but will be available to all elements using the mapping
ToolHelper doesn't get these tools, it only provides tools owned by the diagram

As a consequence, in tests, it is necessary to duplicated tools in all required diagrams ","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2785/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2789,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2789,capella,2078288154,2789,"Pie icons not displayed when exported, or on first diagram opening",etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,CLOSED,2024-01-12T08:08:37Z,2024-04-09T13:22:42Z,"When multiple Functional Chains or Physical Paths overlap on a single graphical edge, edge color changes and a pie Icon representing all overlapping colors is displayed at both ends of the edge.
These icons are transient and not stored in the model nor the aird.

In your project or workspace preferences,if the ""refresh on opening"" preferences is set to false (which are default values for projects on T4C), the icons won't appear on opening, but only after the diagram is refreshed
In the same way, exporting representations won't properly work if the diagrams are not opened and refreshed

In order to fix this issue, edges for FunctionalExchange and PhysicalLink (on xAB and dataflows) should reference (using the semanticElements field) all displayed involving FC or PP (any displayed FC or PP that involve the edge)

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2794,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2794,capella,2091196257,2794,Transition of functions from SA to LA results in duplicate functions in LA,mirkov,204850,Mirko,,OPEN,2024-01-19T19:18:11Z,2024-02-28T19:43:05Z,"This may be related to [Architecture can be duplicated while transition #1716](https://github.com/eclipse/capella/issues/1716).
I am on Capella 6.1 on Windows 11.
When I transition one or more function from SA to LA, the functions get duplicated. The functions have different object ID's.

I observed the same behavior when I transition from LA to PA. For example, when I transition a functional chain twice in succession, the second time I do it, I see the same model elements available for transitioning. I would expect the left window to be empty, i.e., no elements to be tagged for transitioning.

It is possible that I corrupted the model. A couple of weeks ago, I wanted to reset my LA model, so I deleted all elements in the LA tree in the project explorer. A few elements were marked as protected, and they remained. But I may have still deleted something important to the functioning of Capella.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2821,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2821,capella,2156326788,2821,NameCollisionHelper does not play well with EAdapters pre-emptively resolving name collisions,flatombe,1379525,Florent Latombe,florent.latombe@obeo.fr,OPEN,2024-02-27T11:17:02Z,2024-02-27T13:11:22Z,"In `org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.commands.CapellaPasteCommand.doExecute()`, first the command is performed, which means EAdapters can intervene and possibly update the name of an element being added (to prevent name collisions for instance).

Then the Capella name collision check is performed via  `org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.commands.NameCollisionHelper.isCollide(Collection<?>, String)`, but it searches for collisions by iterating through all the contents of the parent element, meaning that a collision is **always** found.

Instead, there should only be collisions to handle if the element that just got pasted really has the same name as its origin.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2821/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2827,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2827,capella,2161354008,2827,Document workaround for Richtext not working on Windows,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,CLOSED,2024-02-29T14:07:53Z,2024-04-09T13:22:45Z,"In some rare cases on windows,
The richtext widgets (description editor etc) are not working properly

images are not displayed nor handled etc ..
So far, the only cause identified is that the capella archive was unzipped using WIndows archiver

I tried to download the [Chromium integration for Eclipse](https://marketplace.eclipse.org/content/chromium-integration-eclipse) but it did not solve the issue (I no longer have a crash, but there are bugs all over the place, most of the time nothing happens when I double click on diagram elements while it should open the properties windows, and I get `An error has occurred. See error log for more details.

Cannot invoke ""org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.properties.richtext.fields.CapellaElementDescriptionGroup.setBaseHrefPath(String)"" because ""this.descriptionGroup"" is null` error when I try to open the description view, which looks more like a bug from the extension than anything else).

I tried other versions of java (first I left the default java delivered in the capella archive, which was java 17, and I tried 11 and 22 and none work, same result each time), and I also have the same behavior on different linux (fedora 39). The behavior is the same on an X11 and wayland desktop environment. I tried setting `-Dorg.eclipse.swt.browser.DefaultType=chromium` or `-Dorg.eclipse.swt.browser.DefaultType=mozilla` in capella.ini but the behavior is the same.
I tried everything I could find by looking at docs or forum but I am running out of leads, can somebody help?

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2847,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2847,capella,2234913738,2847,Beginning and end label of exchange have a visible edit box,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,OPEN,2024-04-10T07:12:30Z,2024-04-10T12:25:16Z,"Exchanges have an edit box on their beginning and end label.
This edit box isn't editable - it is used to display overlapping chains
However when no overlap is displayed, these box shouldn't be visible.
- when an exchange port is dnded -> exchange label resized to default
- when the exchange edge is dnded -> exchange beginning and end labels resized to exchange label

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2860,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2860,capella,2261158218,2860,Migration and repair actions fail to close modified opened diagrams and throws NPEs ,mPorhel,1019672,Maxime Porhel,maxime.porhel@obeo.fr,OPEN,2024-04-24T12:17:11Z,2024-04-24T14:17:26Z,"Several scenarios have been identified leading to unsafe state of the Workbench after the use of the migration or repair actions on modified projects with opened diagram editors.
The underlying issue is an NPE during attempt to closed opened an dirty diagrams editors :

java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke ""org.eclipse.sirius.ui.business.internal.session.RestoreToLastSavePointListener.isAllowedToReturnToSyncState()"" because ""this.restoreToSavePointListener"" is null
Then several NPEs or Unhandled Event Loop exception can be thrown as side effect by actions, properties views or any elements trying to perform some refresh and access the model or the session:
java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke ""org.eclipse.sirius.business.api.session.Session.getSessionResource()"" because ""session"" is null
* Errors in asynchronous notifications (Capella Navigator, saveable, ...)
java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke ""org.eclipse.ui.ISaveablesLifecycleListener.handleLifecycleEvent(org.eclipse.ui.SaveablesLifecycleEvent)"" because ""this.listener"" is null
* null representationDesxriptor in LinkWithEditor refresh in org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator.view.AirdDiagramLinkHelper.findSelection(IEditorInput)
* failed figure paint attempt with Team for Capella connected project
* Open Capella 7 and create a project with a few diagrams
* Open the project : ActivityExplorer is opened
* Open a diagram, perform some modifications
* Run the migration on a freshly imported Capella project created in 6.1
* Choose to save the opened and modified projects

* When the migration ask you to perform a backup before the migration execution, you can cancel, this issue is not related to the effective migration behavior but with the preparation steps performed by the action before launching it.
* Check the errors in error log
* Expected: all editors (activityEditor and open diagrams) must be closed, project must be closed
* Expected: after reopening : your changes have been saved.
* Open Capella 7 and create a project with a few diagrams
* Open the project : ActivityExplorer is opened
* Open a diagram, perform some modifications
* Right clic the .aird and run the Repair action
* Choose to save the opened and modified projects
* Check the errors in error log
* Expected: all editors (activityEditor and open diagrams) must be closed, project must be closed

* Expected: after reopening : your changes have been saved.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w857q09Z/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
- PR #2859 which minimize the side effects

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2860,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w857ru_C,capella,2075062210,2860,NA,mPorhel,1019672,Maxime Porhel,maxime.porhel@obeo.fr,NA,2024-04-24T14:17:23Z,2024-04-24T14:17:23Z,"New fix added to the PR, seen while testing the other fixes:
- When Capella Migration runnable starts, it disables CapellaExplorer notifications

- When Capella migration is cancelled by user by clicking on Cancel button in backup creation popup: Capella notifications are not re-enabled : next project opening does not refresh the explorer, no children displayed under the .aird
* (opt) open a diagrma and do some modification
* launch the migration on this second project
* cancel the migration at the backup creation popup
* re-open first project session by double clicking on the aird
* Activity Explorer is opened,, but session seems to be closed in the Capella explorer: no child displayed under the .aird
* workaround : close and reopen the project, or open a diagram from the Activity explorer.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2864,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2864,capella,2279076491,2864,DSL evaluation for capella - please take a look,dzw1999,47890122,,,OPEN,2024-05-04T15:21:27Z,2024-05-04T15:21:27Z,"Hello, greetings from **the software engineering group from Beihang University**, China. We have been working on **the evaluation of Domain Specific Modeling Languages (DSMLs )**, the main purpose is to find out the flaws of the design of the DSML. To test our evaluation framework, we evaluated your software design, mainly based on your **ecore and odesign** files, and found out that even though the overall quality of your software design is very good, there still exists some minor problems. The details are as follows:
Firstly, we did some rule-based evaluation, mainly focusing on the **graphic part**.

We've checked your odesign file  according to Goodman's theory of symbols[Goodman N. Languages of Art: An Approach to a Theory of Symbols[M]. Hackett publishing, Indianapolis, 1976.], and there are some minor problems that can decrease the semiotic clarity of your design as follows:
There are some cases where various graphic symbols are used to represent the same element of the language.
There are some graphic symbols in your design that is assigned to more than one element.
There are some elements in your design that are not represented by any graphic symbols.
Certainly, we know that some elements do not need to be assigned symbols to, but we believe it is best to check whether these elements really do not need symbols or they were just overlooked.
There are some referenced symbols in your design that  do not actually exist in the project.

We believe that **overly similar symbols** are not conducive to users' understanding and use of language. Therefore, we use image features such as **SSIM** to detect the **similarity between the symbols** you use. Below are some pairs of symbols that may be too similar:

Secondly, we did some LLMS-based evaluation, mainly focusing on the model part. Generally speaking, we try to make LLM act as a domain expert to provide multidimensional evaluations of your language design.

We give your ecore design to LLM and ask the LLM to  guess which domain your language is designed for. And then we ask LLM to add possible missing elements to your language (perhaps not taken into account in the first version of the design, but can be considered for inclusion in future versions). The results are as follows:

Based on the provided meta model and relationships, this model is highly likely to belong to the field of system modeling, especially in applications such as system engineering and architecture design. More specifically, it may be related to **MBSE (Model Based Systems Engineering)**, especially in scenarios where **Arcadia methodology** and **Capella modeling tools** are used. Arcadia is a systems engineering methodology that focuses on architecture design, while Capella is an open-source modeling tool that supports Arcadia.
Some key meta models that need to be supplemented and their relationships may include descriptions of system requirements, evolution, validation, and validation activities, as follows:

These supplementary meta models and relationships contribute to a more comprehensive understanding of requirements management, system evolution, and verification and validation (V&V) activities in systems engineering activities. All these elements and relationships are crucial aspects in the field of system modeling, especially in the process of system design and analysis using the MBSE method.

We are not sure if these issues actually constitute a problem, **the decision to fix them or not is still up to your team**, looing forward to your respond, **thanks**!","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2864/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

Do not delete !"" when using ""Manage Function Allocation"" tool",Kellindil,661592,Laurent Goubet,laurent.goubet@obeo.fr,OPEN,2024-05-14T12:30:30Z,2024-05-14T12:30:30Z,"* Create a new project

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2866,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2866,capella,2297407074,2866,"Richtext editor fails to open with message ""Failed to evaluate javascript expression""",Kellindil,661592,Laurent Goubet,laurent.goubet@obeo.fr,OPEN,2024-05-15T09:54:35Z,2024-05-15T09:54:35Z,"This happens by simply installing Capella (version irrelevant as far as I could see, but happened in 5.2 and 6.1), creating a new project and opening the ""description"" property tab on any element.
As far as I've analyzed, this is due to security policies on the user's machine, preventing eclipse from knowing the IE version it should use?

This can be reproduced by creating a value named ""Security_HKLM_only"" in registry key ""HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings"" and setting it to ""1"".
This can be solved by either of the following:
1. Unset the ""Security_HKLM_only"" value within the registry key ""HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings""

2. Manually create a DWORD value named ""capella.exe"" within registry key ""HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main\FeatureControl\FEATURE_BROWSER_EMULATION"" and set it to 0x2af9 (11001, meaning ""IE 11"")

The ""capella.exe"" value does exist in HKCU, same path, but ""Security_HKLM_only"" prevents that value from being read by Capella, and Capella probably doesn't have write access in HKLM to create the needed value.

Ultimately, this should be an issue of the SWT browser (the embedded browser view and the eclipse help content won't work either if ""Security_HKLM_only"" is set to 1 without the corresponding ""capella.exe"" value in HKLM), but I believe it would be a nice to have in a Capella troubleshooting guide, such as what has been done for the ""template.html"" blocking issue some users encounter (https://github.com/eclipse-capella/capella/commit/dd742de317e95bb2626a1ac4386e2828de63e7ec).

More details about these registry values can be found from the IBM support pages at https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/6342891 and details on the security zones on the Microsoft forum at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/troubleshoot/developer/browsers/security-privacy/ie-security-zones-registry-entries .
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to evaluate javascript expression

Commands from REC/RPL dialogs/actions and from transitions ACHIEVED THOURGH DIAGRAM EDITOR  cause the commandstack/session to be dirty, but capella can be closed without confirmation nonetheless","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2868/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2879,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2879,capella,2370279521,2879,Richtext editor freezes Capella 7.0.0 on Linux,MoritzWeber0,23395732,Moritz Weber,,OPEN,2024-06-24T13:36:47Z,2024-07-09T13:04:53Z,"In the latest pre-release of Capella 7.0.0, the description editor / richtext editor is completely unusable. Whenever I start typing, Capella freezes completely.
1. Install the latest 7.0.0 Capella bundle on Linux
3. Create any element that has an description
4. Open the description field in the Properties tab. It takes a few seconds to load. Then start typing at least two characters and Capella will freeze.
I can also provide a Docker image to reproduce. Let me know if that would help.
SWT call to Webkit timed out after 10000ms. No return value will be provided.
1) Problem: Your javascript needs more than 10000ms to execute.
Solution: Don't run such javascript, it blocks Eclipse's UI. SWT currently allows such code to complete, but this error is thrown
and the return value of execute()/evalute() will be false/null.
2) However, if you believe that your application should execute as expected (in under10000 ms),
then it might be a deadlock in SWT/Browser/webkit2 logic.
I.e, it might be a bug in SWT (e.g this does not occur on Windows/Cocoa, but occurs on Linux). If you believe it to be a bug in SWT, then
Please report this issue *with steps to reproduce* via:
For bug report, please atatch this stack trace:
Additional information about the error is as following:
I've tried several different webkit2gtk versions, also different distributions (Alpine, Fedora & Debian). I could reproduce the issue in all cases.

The issue seems to be different to the other reported issues affecting Capella versions < 7.0.0 on Linux: https://github.com/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2316","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2879/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2879,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w86CVPsG,capella,2186607366,2879,NA,MoritzWeber0,23395732,Moritz Weber,,NA,2024-06-24T13:38:26Z,2024-06-24T13:38:26Z,"I tried both workarounds with environment variables described in https://github.com/eclipse-platform/eclipse.platform.swt/issues/843.

Neither `WEBKIT_DISABLE_COMPOSITING_MODE=1` nor `WEBKIT_DISABLE_DMABUF_RENDERER=1` have worked for me.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w86CVPsG/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
I tried with Ubuntu 22.04.4 as windows11 sub system and I reproduced the issue.
I reproduced with and wihtout `WEBKIT_DISABLE_COMPOSITING_MODE=1` nor `WEBKIT_DISABLE_DMABUF_RENDERER=1`
Nevertheless, I did not get completely freezes but get the Webkit time out of 10000ms.
I also get first this error

`libEGL warning: MESA-LOADER: failed to open vgem: /usr/lib/dri/vgem_dri.so: Ne peut ouvrir le fichier d'objet partagÃ©: Aucun fichier ou dossier de ce nom (search paths /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/dri:\$${ORIGIN}/dri:/usr/lib/dri, suffix _dri)`
It probably comes from a not proper ubuntu installation using wsl.
So to eliminate this additional context problem.
I tested with virtualbox with unbuntu 24.04
This time I also did reproduced but did not get the same errors.
!MESSAGE Rich text widget can not install beforePaste/afterPaste/beforeCommandExec listeners!
!MESSAGE Rich text widget cannot install the open link command
Those warning are about java call back that are called when doing things in the CKEditor
At this stage, I have no idea of where the issue is located.
* Is it in kitalpha that badly set that callback

* Is it somewhere in the way webkit do the rendering.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w86DWZ8d/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2879,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w86DgmQf,capella,2206360607,2879,NA,lfasani,12660743,,,NA,2024-07-03T14:43:31Z,2024-07-03T14:43:31Z,"I reproduce the issue and the stack trace with ubuntu 24.04.4 in a virtualbox
There are two `progressListeners` called in the for loop:
* The first one is added in `/org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.richtext/src/org/eclipse/nebula/widgets/richtext/RichTextEditor.java`
This method fails. So something gets wrong in `initEditor()`

It turns out  `initEditor` calls `customizeToolbar` which calls the java method `org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.richtext.RichTextEditorConfiguration.getCustomButtonConfiguration()` that will cause evaluation error.
And then `browser.evaluate(""initEditor();""); ` will end up with similar stack trace.

thanks for the detailed investigation, appreciate it!
The warnings (`Rich text widget can not install * listeners`) exist for a long time already and were also printed in Capella 6.0.0. I'm not sure how they are related to the actual issue.
I think that the JavaScript timeout is responsible for the freezes.

It's interesting that you don't see the freezes in your installation (We have reproduced it on debian, fedora and ArchLinux). Maybe it's related to specific versions of other dependencies. But hard to figure out which dependency is responsible for it.
Which versions of libwebkitgtk do you installed in your VM?

I'll try to run Capella against webkit2gtk-4.1 instead of libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 (Probably needs this commit https://github.com/eclipse-platform/eclipse.platform.swt/commit/4d1d26a8d9347a8d379819887464eca83ab39023 tho).","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w86Dn3eM/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"
To clarify, I did get the javascript timeout of 10s but, after that, the Capella is still usable (the Capella is not freezed).

To complete the analysis in my previous comment, I tried to understand what was problematic in the script(I supposed for example that `CKEDITOR.instances.editor.addCommand` was undefined), I manually changed the injected JavaScript in `org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.richtext.RichTextEditorConfiguration` and I ended up figuring out that just the script `console.log('hello')` will make the evaluation fail. I have no clue why this simple instruction make the evaluation fail.
So I have no lead to progress except debugging the CKEditor JavaScript.

The RichtextEditor widget in Capella fails, because the method `.evaluate()` of the `org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser` refuses to execute Javascript code as @lfasani already figured out.
The RichTextEditor tries that in this line 233:
which in turn calls a Java method which is located in line 612 here:
Whatever non-empty Javascript string we pass to `browser.evaluate()`, it will time out after 10 seconds.
One can demonstrate that wihout the Richtext widget:

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2881,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2881,capella,2383858077,2881,Typo in org.polarsys.capella.core.re.project.handlers.Messages leads to NLS missing message,flatombe,1379525,Florent Latombe,florent.latombe@obeo.fr,OPEN,2024-07-01T13:26:36Z,2024-07-01T13:56:16Z,"A String is missing from the UI due to a typo in class org.polarsys.capella.core.re.project.handlers.Messages
* Right click on the library, use action ""REC / RPL > Create REC > With whole library content...""
* Message dialog with title ""Library is empty"" and message ""NLS missing message: ProjectRecHandler_emtpyLibraryDialogMessage in: org.polarsys.capella.core.re.project.handlers.messages"" => KO

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2882,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2882,capella,2383933626,2882,org.polarsys.capella.core.re.project.ReProjectScope ignores elements with a set ProgressStatus,flatombe,1379525,Florent Latombe,florent.latombe@obeo.fr,OPEN,2024-07-01T13:56:48Z,2024-07-01T15:15:48Z,"org.polarsys.capella.core.re.project.ReProjectScope is invoked when we have a Capella Library and we use the contextual menu action ""REC / RPL > Create REC > With whole library content...""
When a library element has a Progress Status that is set, then this element (and its heirs) gets pruned from the scope.

This can result in either an incomplete REC (that can cause issues later when trying to instantiate a corresponding RPL, see issue #2883), or with the dialog telling us the library is empty (when it is not).
* Create an element e.g. Logical Function and set its Progress Status to any value
* Right click on the library, use action ""REC / RPL > Create REC > With whole library content...""
* => The empty library dialog appears (with a missing dialog, see issue #2881). KO

When creating the REC from selecting the Logical Function, upon creation of the corresponding RPL, the Progress Status from the library is referenced by the RPL element. This sounds OK to me. I think RECs from whole libraries should behave similarly.
org.polarsys.capella.core.re.project.ReProjectScope should not consider an EReference to a Progress Status contained by the library to be an ""external reference"".

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2883,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2883,capella,2384094889,2883,"If a REC in a Library is ill-structured, the RPL creation in a Project fails silently",flatombe,1379525,Florent Latombe,florent.latombe@obeo.fr,OPEN,2024-07-01T15:06:35Z,2024-07-01T15:06:35Z,"Due to manual user operation, or in case of bugs like issue #2882, users can sometimes end up with ill-structured RECs in a Capella Library.
There is no validation to report about issues in the REC.
Then when trying to instantiate a corresponding RPL in a Capella Project, the UI makes it seem that everything worked as expected, but in reality a RollbackException got thrown.
* Create two LogicalFunctions LF1 and LF2 connected by a FunctionalExchange FE1 through FIP1 and FOP1

* Create a REC containing only LF1, LF2 and FE1 (Note: the UI tries to add them by default, but by manual user operation or due to issue #2882, it can happen organically that we end up in this situation)
* Create a Capella Project and reference the library
* Create a RPL of the REC defined above => Nothing happens: the session is not dirty (and the model not modified), no log, etc. Underneath, a RollbackException has been thrown.
* Bonus: create a RPL in the Library itself => the RPL gets created and the REC gets automatically enriched with FIP1 and FOP1
* Maybe add validation rules on RECs to warn of missing key elements
* Provide some user feedback when the RPL instantiation fails (log an error, display an error message dialog)
* Provide some user feedback when their REC gets automatically modified (log an info, maybe display a confirmation dialog beforehand)
When drag and dropping a deployment link (with multiple deployment links enabled), other links are removed.
For example, if I drop PC4 from PC2 to PC3, PC4 in PC1 is removed and should not.
* Create a new PAB diagram, add 3 Physical Components with ""Node PC"" tool and another one with ""Deploy Behavior PC"".
* In Window > Preferences > Capella > Model, check ""Multiple deployment allowed""
* Add a deployment for ""PC 4"" in ""PC 1"" with ""Manage Behavior PCs Deployment"" tool in palette.
* In Filters and Customization of the Capella Project Explorer, uncheck ""Parts"" filter to reveal ""[Part Deployment Link]"" in the Project Explorer
* Drag and Drop PC 4 from PC 2 to PC 3.
**Expected:** PC 4 is removed from PC 2, added to PC 3, and PC 1 remain unchanged.

**Actual:** **K-O** --> All previous references of PC 4 have been removed (Deploying Parts in Properties view > Semantic tab), and two have been added in PC 3 (Deployment Links in Properties view > Semantic tab)
* Undo. Drag and drop PC 4 from PC 2 to PC 1.
**Expected:** DnD is not allowed since PC 2 is already deployed in PC 1.
**Actual:** **K-O** --> Drag and drop is made. PC 2 has no longer PC 4 Deployment Link, and PC 1 has two Deployment Links

comment,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2886,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/comments/IC_kwDODd22w86D-B4V,capella,2214075925,2886,NA,etraisnel2,109157813,Erwann Traisnel,,NA,2024-07-08T13:26:52Z,2024-07-08T13:26:52Z,"Seems like cases where VPDEditor is opened on a .vpd file isn't properly handled

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2891,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2891,capella,2457415694,2891,Force embedded Guava version,pdulth,34767327,Philippe DUL,,OPEN,2024-08-09T08:37:20Z,2024-08-09T09:29:51Z,"Guava has many versions.
Capella 7.0 embeds the 31.jre one as it is the latest available for 2023-03.
We need to hardcode the embedded versions in both location:
- In target platform, it allows addons to inherit from it and be able to define a specific version (as we can't have both `lazy` and `fixed one`

- In capella feature as if an addon install a prior version of guava in a dropin (e.g. 30), capella startup (reconcile.dropins) will remove guava from the main capella configuration to rely only on the one embedded in the dropin (as both are compatible. when uninstalling the dropin, guava will no longer be found, failling capella to start anymore).","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2891/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2894,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2894,capella,2514114718,2894,DiagramServices::getEditPart(DDiagramElement) can cause deadlock,mPorhel,1019672,Maxime Porhel,maxime.porhel@obeo.fr,OPEN,2024-09-09T14:21:23Z,2024-12-17T16:29:05Z,"In some situations, deadlock can occur during refresh of diagrams having the capability to display functional chains or physical paths: ie diagrams with Sirius post refresh extensions :
The detected performance issue or potential deadlock comes from the DiagramServices::getEditPart(DDiagramElement)  which uses an helper using Display.syncExec method to get the ActiveEditor.
This also means that a refresh occuring on a non active editor will not refresh the edit parts.
Reproduction scenario exists with Team for Capella:

* when a user has received remote changes on a locked diagram, if the automatic refresh is disabled, this diagram will be frozen and will need a manual refresh to display the received remote changes and be refresh accordingly to potential local changes.

* with Capella 6.1 and 7.0 (an dI assume 5.2/6.0), with the _[LAB] [Build] All Components, Functions, CEs, FEs_ diagram from the IFE sample, I get a ~29s manual refresh for this particular scenario compared to an immediate (200ms to 1s regarding the versions) time for other refresh use cases of the same diagram

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2913,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2913,capella,2638174958,2913,Changing navigation of associations in CDB diagram recreates them modifying original layout or hiding them in unsynchronized mode,scosta-obeo,128719897,,,OPEN,2024-11-06T13:57:44Z,2024-11-06T13:57:44Z,"Step to reproduce:
* Create 2 classes and an association between them
* Create a bendpoint on the association edge
* In the property view, make the association navigable in both directions (by checking the checkbox ""Is Navigable"" which is unchecked)
* **Expected**: the edge is always visible and it has the same bendpoints

* **Actuel**: the bendpoints are reset (synchronized mode) or the edge disappears (unsynchronized mode)","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2913/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2922,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2922,capella,2748034051,2922,Outdated documentation to set an image for the style of an element,Kellindil,661592,Laurent Goubet,laurent.goubet@obeo.fr,OPEN,2024-12-18T14:53:08Z,2024-12-18T14:53:08Z,"This concerns the following help page : https://github.com/eclipse-capella/capella/blob/master/doc/plugins/org.polarsys.capella.ui.doc/html/04.%20User%20Interface/4.05.%20Diagram%20Editor.mediawiki
The section ""Diagram Element toolbar"" explains how to set an image as the style of an element:
However, there is no ""insert image tool"" icon in the toolbar, and the two screenshots also seem outdated.
There is an icon in the toolbar with the description ""set style to workspace image"" and it displays a popup looking like the following:
I think the documentation needs to be updated.

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2925,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2925,capella,2809637426,2925,[RichText] LifecycleException: Not active: Transaction,GlennPlou,33932970,Glenn Plouhinec,,CLOSED,2025-01-24T14:48:27Z,2025-01-29T13:37:53Z,"Similar to #2822 , in a team environment
1. Restore Default Capabilities: `Window > Preferences > General > Capabilities`, click on `Restore Defaults`.
3. Create a Capella project `p1` with one representation.
4. Duplicate `p1` as `p2` or create a new Capella project p2 with one representation.

1. In the Project Explorer, open `p1.aird`, then navigate to the representation under `Representations per category`. Select the representation. The RichText `Description` tab should be open by default in Properties view.

3. Open `p2.aird`, then navigate to the representation under `Representations per category`. Select the representation. The error appears.","{""url"": ""https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2925/reactions"", ""total_count"": 0, ""+1"": 0, ""-1"": 0, ""laugh"": 0, ""hooray"": 0, ""confused"": 0, ""heart"": 0, ""rocket"": 0, ""eyes"": 0}"

issue,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2932,https://api.github.com/repos/eclipse-capella/capella/issues/2932,capella,2853362834,2932,FE Cat bugued on xDFB diagrams using contextual elements+unsynchronization,Pierre-Besson,199071156,,,OPEN,2025-02-14T11:00:35Z,2025-02-14T11:05:28Z,"Hello,
I got an issue, on a xDFB **unsynchronized** diagram using a macro-**function as contextual element**, i can't display correctly FE Cat (Cat and FE are both displayed).
I already posted on ThalÃ¨s forum : https://forum.mbse-capella.org/t/error-with-fe-cat-contextual-element-unsynchronized-diag/10348

I first thought it was correlated with the number of Cat linked to FE, on a simple sandbox model it seemed to work correctly (cf my post) and i realized recently than on my real model it still doesn't work and i don't know why.

Context need : contextual function + unsynchronized diagram is the simpliest way we found to display and maintain efficiently a macro-function with its directly connected macro-functions, displaying also only the interfaces between the contextual macro-functions and the others functions (we don't want the interfaces between the other macro-functions).
Maybe this bug is more a behavior lying beyond the limits of use intended by the designers, so can we discuss about it ? :)
It is important for my project/company to resolve it.
